reviews.text: I went to lunch today and the total was $66. The cost to dine here has become astronomical! $4 for a soda, $14.50 for an appetizer, and $18.50 for a lunch portion of pasta with protein. The Cheesecake Factory is known to be spendy but I felt this was a little excessive. Just a heads up that they raised their prices!

First time dining here yesterday. We had a wonderful experience. The pasta we ordered were impressive. The veggie lasagna and bistro shrimp pasta were perfectly seasoned. The place was very busy but the wait time wasn&#39;t too bad. Food also came out in a timely manner. The pretzel bites with cheese fondue was amazing. It was freshly baked. They give complimentary freshly baked bread as well. What made our experience even better was our server Brittney. She was attentive, helpful, constantly checking on us considering it was unbelievably busy. Her personality and attentiveness just shows naturally. It was the best customer service I&#39;ve had in a while. Overall we had a wonderful experience with food and service. Highly recommended.

It&#39;s always busy in here. We used to go here in the past, but not anymore. <br><br>Portions are too huge for the average person, too expensive, too many calories. <br><br>The only reason we came here this time, someone gave us a gift card for Christmas &amp; we decided to get 2 slices of cheesecake to go.

I sure sounded good but when I got it the chicken was dry , onion skin , and had forgot it had bacon it was charred. I sent back and said not bacon that&#39;s when I got the onion skins . Not very many mushrooms and they wee over cooked  almost black. Then I ordered the $9.50 piece of chocolate carmalucious cheese cake made witchy snickers. The brownie crust is not a crust it is like uncooked brownie dough. The nuts were soggy and as you can no snicker on top just soggy nuts. Sorry this was a fail and very expensive one .

I shopped at Washington Square Mall while my daughter went to her friend&#39;s going away party and when she got back to meet me, it was dinner time. I wanted to do Cheesecake Factory, which was perfect, A Cheesecake Factory at this location. So convenient, This Cheesecake Factory is huge! There are lots of parking and I scored a perfect spot, close to restaurant and as we walked in, no wait! We were seated promptly. This never happens in Hawaii. We got our menu and the waitress was super nice and quick during our entire visit. It was also late, we were there after 8 pm on a Sunday, we were in and out of Cheesecake Factory within one hour. I usually stick to my usual ( miso salmon, the mini chicken sliders, or calamari) as I glanced thru the menu booklet, something on the specialties menu caught my eye. Chicken Parmesan &#34;Pizza Style&#34;, chopped chicken breast coated with breadcrumbs, covered with marinara sauce, and lots of melted cheese, then topped with angel hair pasta in a alfredo cream sauce. (15.95) <br>This sounds so good, I love pasta, angel hair, chicken parm, and alfredo cream sauce, all of my faves in one dish, so I had to try this. Talking to the waitress, I think only this Cheesecake Factory has this specialty, I don&#39;t see it back in Hawaii, another reason that I must go back to this location again. My daughter always gets her favorite, Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic (17.95) the bow tie pasta is so cute. <br>On my pic, doesn&#39;t come with mushrooms, since my daughter doesn&#39;t like mushrooms, it was by request to <br>add them from my daughter&#39;s entree to mines. *bonus*<br>I really enjoyed my chicken parmesan pizza style, it was really filling, lots of carbs, I was stuffed eating half of my entree. Since it was my daughter&#39;s 22nd birthday, she got the lemon cheesecake, nicely decorated and the staff came by to sing and wish her a Happy Birthday. That was so nice! <br>The lemon cheesecake was so good and refreshing, first time trying. <br>Overall, we had a great dining experience at this Cheesecake Factory, on her special day. I can&#39;t wait to be back!!

Hmmm an hour wait for food and service that was lacking. The food was hot but flavorless, and the only thing the waitress asked when seeing my picked over plate of food was did i want a to go box. Definitely not worth the wait with a six month old baby.

My husband &amp; I come here fairly often. We have actually never landed on entrees that either of us love. (Crazy right? The menu is huuuuge!) That&#39;s the only reason I&#39;m giving 4 stars instead of 5; CF is in fact a restaurant &amp; to me the food falls pretty flat. However, they make the PERFECT martini (The Well Mannered Dirty Martini.) It&#39;s absolutely delicious- not too dirty, it&#39;s always nice &amp; cold, &amp; the bleu cheese stuffed olives are to die for. This trip I also tried a new dessert - the Lemoncello Cream Torte. I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;ll ever get cheesecake again. WOWWWWWW the torte blew my mind. I wish i has taken a picture, but I was 3 bites deep before I thought of it. I 100% recommend the torte.
Great Service and food was perfect. The wait was a little long. Wish they had reservations.

UPDATE: Contacted them twice via their website like they auto reply to almost every post, never heard back and it&#39;s been over 2 weeks...<br><br>Extensive menu, normally tasty food. Our waitresses and waiters each time have been pleasant. Usually like to get the caesar salad and farm fresh breakfast. <br>I feel personally that the happy hour menu doesn&#39;t give me many options (I can never find a single thing on there that sounds good to me, which is surprising considering their normal menu is pages long) <br>I feel menu prices are still high for what you get. For example a small salad (with no meat) was still $7. If you want a grilled chicken caesar it&#39;s $20. If you have two people there just getting salad and a drink your tab is over $50. <br>Last time we went we did notice they&#39;ve changed the milkshakes. Used to be a huge glass and tasted better. Now tastes like Breyers blended with chocolate syrup (which I could easily make at home) served in a normal size glass... BUT they still have it priced at 8.50! If you&#39;re going to make it smaller at least make the price reflective of that. It was definitely not worth 8.50 and we were disappointed in it not being at all close to how it used to be. <br>At least I split it with someone (who also said it was not the same) because if we both had paid 8.50 for that we would&#39;ve brought it up while we were there. I do not recommend getting a shake here unless they either bring back the same quality, or reduce theirprice to reflect their new standard.

The worst service from our server. We got our bread at the end after eating. When the waiter had told us he was bringing us a warm basket when we got seated. We tried ordering refills and more seasoning, but he never came back until we had to get the attention of a different server.

I&#39;d not eaten here in the past but it was the choice of our &#34;birthday person&#34;, and I&#39;d say it was a very good choice! We&#39;d made a reservation and, though very busy, we were seated within minutes. Our server, Anastasia, was professional, energetic and attentive, so we lacked for no refills and enjoyed every bite. Dinner was delicious, and all four at our table praised our selections highly. In truth, I had no room left for dessert! I recommend The Cheesecake Factory for family dining and those special occasions that deserve something extra!

Starting off.... the only reason I&#39;m giving two stars is because our waitress was decently delightful, not the best waitress but she was well aware that she was a little rusty having been out of work so long due to COVID. If not for that it would be one star, only because they require at least one. <br><br>We made reservations online for 8:00pm, for dine in service. We arrived at 7:45 and checked in with the hostess who was standing outside the doorway at a table that was set up. She found our reservation and said it would just be a few minutes and we would receive a text letting us know the table was ready. We stepped aside and waited outside for the text. Over the course of time several other couples/families came up after us, I was able to overhear some had reservations and some did not. They also waited outside to maintain social distancing guidelines. As time went on all were notified that a table was ready and were seated before us that were originally there first. We were the only people left outside waiting. We continued to wait for a minute or two and finally at 8:20 we went inside to speak with the hostess and inquire about our table as we had been waiting 20 minutes past our reservation. This new hostess asked our name and proceeded to look it up. She stated there was no reservation under that name even though we have text confirmations of the reservation and text reminders stating the day and time. Regardless she was able to seat us right away which was a positive. <br><br>They do not give you menus. You have to look it up online. Which we did. Found what we wanted and ordered. I had some special requests on mine, Bow tie pasta with roasted chicken. I specifically asked for Parmesan crusted chicken instead of roasted chicken which I got. I also requested no mushrooms and no peas (due to an allergy) and add asparagus instead. <br><br>Entrees arrived and seemed fine, I actually really enjoyed my food. Of course my husband eats faster then me and he made it through his steak and went to eat the chicken dish (he got one of the speciality splits) while eating it he kept getting lemon seeds he had to spit out while chewing the chicken. He also ordered a side of spinach. It was exceptionally oily/watery on the bottom of the dish and salty. We asked to speak with a manager to make them aware that their food preparation had a few issues. Not once did we ask him to comp anything just to make them aware that the food was at a lower standard then TGI Friday&#39;s . <br><br>When telling him about the lemon seeds he said &#39;yea, when they plate it they squeeze fresh lemon over it&#39;. My thoughts on the statement &#39;uhhhh yea obviously but there are ways to prevent having lemon seeds end up in it.... say a strainer or putting the free hand underneath to catch the seeds&#39; Then explaining the concerns about the spinach and excess oil/water/liquid he just asked if we wanted another one. Again &#39;ugggghhh NO just use a fricking STRAINER.&#39; Which is apparently something missing in the kitchen. I have at least three at home I&#39;ll let you borrow one - he was a complete jerk. <br><br>I finally was done eating and asked for boxes for the excess food. Our lovely waitress brought them and I started to put my food away and when I was nearly done I noticed something concerning. Peas. There were peas in the bottom of the dish. I had to get the attention of our waitress as this was just another issue and now I get to have an allergic reaction. Thankfully it&#39;s just itching, hives, and swelling in my lips and throat. I asked if there was a different manager on the floor as I felt like the previous one I had spoken to was a condescending prick. She said she would speak to a different manager and send them out to us, but in an apparent &#39;miscommunication due to a loud kitchen and face masks&#39; condescending prick showed up back at our table. <br><br>I explained my specific request of no peas and showed him that there were peas in my dish. He asked &#39;did you tell your server that you had an allergy&#39; I said &#39;no, I just strictly stated that I did not want them in the dish&#39; he said &#39;well for future reference in any restaurant you need to say that you have an allergy because then everything is done different. Do you want something else?&#39; &#39;Uhhh, no, not from you. My husband just has lunch for tomorrow now and I don&#39;t have the time to wait I need to get home and get a Benadryl&#39; (it was around 9:40). <br><br>I thought saying no peas meant no peas. Now it is my fault that your kitchen can&#39;t read or understand what basic food preparation is. <br><br>Thanks condescending prick - Stephen. Night ruined. First time I had been in a sit down restaurant in 3 months due to this virus BS and you ruined it.

Sunday after 1pm and knowing the wait was going to be a while (30 min) we got our pager for our group of six. While waiting, two people in our party decided they wanted something else and with the new info went back to tell the front that we had a party of four now and got a new pager. Come to find out the first pager wasn&#39;t even charged and working, so glad we got a new one. It makes me wonder if we would of ever gotten seated if I didn&#39;t let the staff know our party size changed!<br><br>The wait time of 30 minutes was kind of close, we waited 40 min and we got seated with our menus. We were asked if we wanted anything to drink and looked over the menu. I know we usually got bread but nothing was mentioned of it until our entree orders were taken about 15 min later. More bread was being baked and coming out soon, by this time it was almost 2pm. <br> <br>The bread arrived a little after 2pm and while fresh and warm, the five pieces were smaller and thinner. The butter that was individually wrapped before was now in slabs. Bread did hold everyone over until our food arrived at 2:20pm. We got two orders of the lunch size fettuccine alfredo, thai lettuce wrap, and chicken tacos. The alfredo was bland and it seemed that none of the flavors of cheese and oil were working together. The taco platter was really good and the lettuce wraps too. Four decent size tacos with rice and beans. The lettuce wraps had lots of veggies and sauces so it&#39;s an entree you don&#39;t get bored with. <br><br>We got a cheesecake to go, the special cinnabon one and also got one wet wipe after the thai letttuce wrap sauces were all over our hands. The portions for the lunch pasta special was decent and the regular size entrees were great as we took leftovers. Our server was attentive as he refilled our drinks and told us about the bread and asked about dessert and was friendly, but overall the service seemed to be slower than usual. I think I&#39;ll come for happy hour during the week as the weekends packed!

Amazing cheesecake and awsome service! Unfortunately I didnt get the name of the waiter who helped me , but he was super nice and attentive, best service I have had in a restaurant in a loooong time. I got the chicken lettuce wraps asian style, they were super delicious.  For dessert I indulged and got a slice of the oreo cheesecake,  the resses peanut butter cheesecake and the birthday celebration cheesecake. The best one hands down was the oreo. Cant wait to come back here, they have so much on the menu.

Not gunna lie, and you can judge me for it.. i love cheesecake factory. The portions are huge, the menu is a novel in itself, and the brown bread is literally crack. I love coming here with my family because everyone can get something they like and there&#39;s always enough to take home for lunch the next day. I&#39;ve been coming here for years and I&#39;ve never had a horrible experience, which is good considering how busy this place gets! All the servers have been efficient and helpful and I love hearing their suggestions and favorites. <br>From years of coming here, I&#39;ve tried a lot and here are some of my favorites in no particular order. <br>1. Bistro shrimp pasta: light yet super flavorful but does not come in lunch portions <br>2. BBQ ranch chicken salad: so good and worth the 2000+ calories... i think...<br>3. Lasagna verde: vegetarian apparently and I didn&#39;t even know because it is JAM PACKED with flavor. <br>4. Pasta DaVinci: It&#39;s so good. Just try it. Yummm <br>5. Spinach artichoke dip: i believe it also had crab in it but i might just be making it up in my head? Anyways, it&#39;s the BEST I&#39;ve had anywhere. Make sure to ask for a side of chips!<br><br>The only downside of cheesecake factory is you have to literally yell in order to hear someone from across the table. It gets veryyy loud and I don&#39;t think the high ceilings help.

We came here when they were pretty busy for lunch during the holidays but got seated within 20 minutes. We have always avoided any Cheesecake Factory thinking that they were just an expensive chain restaurant but do think now that they are fairly priced considering the quality of the food that they bring out. Our server was very friendly and the place is clean.

What a Disappointment!!<br><br>I hadn&#39;t been in the area where Cheesecake Factory is located for quite a while.<br><br>Finding myself nesrby, I was delighted and decided to treat myself.<br><br>I was surprised that the large space was not crowded as it used to be.<br><br>Soon to find out!<br><br>The menu seemed to show chicken in every guise.<br><br> Trouble was it was all breast meat when i prefer dark.<br><br>Basically, I could choose between a salad or chicken.<br><br>My chicken almond (I think it was almonds, but couldn&#39;t find any) sandwich was mostly mayonnaise. <br><br>It took forever to come, and my fries came even later!<br><br>The menu used to have a variety of interesting options. <br><br>I couldn&#39;t find those!<br><br>I&#39;m afraid that was my swan song at Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I&#39;m heartbroken!  I used to love that restaurant!

It was our first time there . The lighting is very low has that relaxed atmosphere soft music playing . I did not care for the small table they gave us . Really strange if it&#39;s two people you are kinda forced to sit next to someone U don&#39;t know . The food was good a little pricey . Cheesecake was outstanding ..Our waitress was great always there to service us ..<br><br>If you try then out get an appetizer and small salad that way you can have a piece of cheesecake . They have happy hour from 4/6pm and it gets packed too ..

A staple at the Washington Square Mall that serves variations of American foods, as well as some cuisine from other cultures. There was a vast selection of entrees, with most ranging between $13-$17 a plate. If you&#39;re trying to cut calories, they have a decent sized menu with dishes that have low calories and/or carbs. Of course one cannot go here without mentioning the cheesecake! I counted at least 35 different variations on the menu, with the price point starting at $7.50 a slice. Not bad for what I got in my opinion! <br><br>Because it&#39;s not exactly close to me, I wouldn&#39;t regularly dine here, but I would definitely come back again.<br><br>Notes-<br>The lightning is quite low in here &amp; there is plenty of seating choices to choose from, good families, friends, or dates!<br><br>Order:<br>Bread(free)--<br>2 pieces of wheat bread, one of white bread, and a big side of butter. I usually dislike eating the brown colored or wheat breads, but I actually liked the bread they type that they serve here.<br><br>Raspberry Lemonade--<br>Though it wasn&#39;t nasty, it definitely tasted like it came from a powder. Wouldn&#39;t recommend this for people who aren&#39;t a fan of sour drinks, as it was more sour than sweet. Great amount for the price.<br><br>Southwest Chicken Sandwich w/ Salad ($14.95)--<br>The sandwhich came with guacamole, grilled<br>Chicken, diced tomatoes, and lettuce and was served on a toasted baguette. It was good, but not something I&#39;d order again. The Cesar salad on the other hand was fresh and tasted amazing! I definitely didn&#39;t mind paying a $1.00 extra to have it instead of the fries.<br><br>Crispy Lemon Herb Chicken()--<br>Came with lightly fried breaded chicken, mashed potatoes, and carrots. The person I ate with ordered this and I liked it so much that I ended up taking it home. The seasoning or sauce they used on the chicken and vegetables was sooo good! The chicken wasn&#39;t overly fried either. I would order this again. <br><br>Chocolate Mouse Cheesecake()--<br>A fairly large slice of chocolate cheese cake with whipped cream on top. It was very good and though it was big enough to where I could&#39;ve saved it for later, I liked it so much that I ate it in one sitting.<br><br>Service:<br>The tall waiter with dirty blonde hair was nice and periodically checked up on us. His service is what made the experience 5 star worthy.<br><br>Wait time:<br>None to be seated and ~20 minutes for the food.<br><br>Bill:<br>$$
One of the best vegan meals I&#39;ve ever had here. Good for family dinners, dates, anything. Shout out to their chef for cooking great vegan meals.

Ok, so my fiancé &amp; I went to Cheesecake to use our gift card. I don&#39;t wanna be rude &amp; put our servers name but like I said in my last review, Cheesecake seriously takes sooooooo long to get your food to you &amp; their service is thee worst. On top of that, we got there a little after they opened so they weren&#39;t busy at all.<br><br>Our server passed us at least 6 times before our food got to us. We wanted to order drinks but he never even made eye contact with us or stopped to ask if we needed anything. The only time he stopped at our tables was right after we received our food from another waiter &amp; to ask if we wanted a box. So we finally ordered our drinks when we got our food....<br><br>It was crazy because 3 tables around us sent back their food. Today was the last time I&#39;ll eat here. Service is horrible &amp; waiting 45 minutes for my meal is just ridiculous. Glad it wasn&#39;t my money &amp; it was a gift card.

This is what happens when you&#39;re in a rush, you make stupid decisions.  We went to TCF for brunch.  Look at the pic of the eggs Benedict, would you even serve that at home?  Pathetic.  We ordered a bloody mary that was so weak we sent it back but they didnt care.  She brought the same glass back and told us we had to pay for an extra shot.  How about we never pay for anything here ever again?  It didnt even taste like a v8, it tasted like water w a dirty celery stick in it.  Listen, this is portland, have you seen the breakfast around here?  You can keep your tomato slices (that&#39;s what they were right?) and dirty celery sticks.  I cant believe I spent $40 on the junk served there!

Wouldn&#39;t seat a party of 8. The State says you can do up to 10. We are all in the same family. Will never go to your restaurant again. FYI Covid is still contracted when your sitting down. So we can all take our masks off while sitting no problem but God forbid there&#39;s more than 6 of us.

Served relatively quick. It&#39;s your typical Cheesecake Factory. Consistent and reliable but never mind blowing.<br><br>It was clean inside, the bathrooms were well kept, we were served relatively quick, our drinks were kept full, and the brown bread, massive portions, and decadent cheesecake satisfied us (ignore the calories haha).<br><br>Overall a good experience here! I would only really come here for celebrations or for Cheesecake.

I would say the price you pay for the food is really good. I&#39;ve never been able to finish an entire plate (alone) and so I&#39;ve always had leftovers which is a plus for me. <br><br>The service has been a hit or miss for me. Sometimes I get an amazing waiter and get my food incredibly fast. Other times I&#39;ve had waiters not want to bring back my change because &#39;it should be tip.&#39;  <br><br>I would highly recommend the Mac and Cheese balls along with their pastas. <br><br>The cheesecakes are amazing and are what I expected each and every time. <br><br>The ambiance is ok. The lighting is a big too dim at times which can get frustrating when trying to read the menu. <br><br>Overall, I would say it&#39;s somewhere worth trying at least once in your life.

Horrible, Horrible.  Is it just me or has take out here and many places gone to crap.  With curbside service and long lines there seems to be a lack of consistency with the food. I order the same thing from here every time so know chicken madeira does not come in a huge square tub filled with bow tie pasta that is not al dente but raw nonetheless.  It shouldn&#39;t even come with pasta so unsure why I received an over cooked dry piece of chicken with raw bow tie pasta. That&#39;s not even a correct order.  Seriously WTF and then charge me $20 for something so inedible I couldn&#39;t eat and had to throw away.  Don&#39;t waste your time because since you&#39;re driving through you will get drive-thru quality.  Very disappointing

I recently just started to eat here again. <br>My last visit I got the chicken avocado club with fries. I was impressed, the service had improved, I liked the new items and variety on the menu. <br><br>I went today, Trent was my waiter, I want to say that first off he was amazing and the only reason I have the review any stars. He was helpful, he checked in often and was prompt. <br><br>Today I had the Shepard&#39;s pie, comfort food on a rainy day. About bite #2 I felt something a little tough I figured it was just the zucchini skin, then bite #6 I found another piece. Only to see it was a piece of blue thread. <br><br>Jeff the manager seemed surprised and didn&#39;t feel like he believed me, until I showed him the picture I took for yelp! He told me not to worry they would cover my food. It felt as if he was telling me he was doing me a favor. I wouldn&#39;t pay for food with an item in it anywhere! I asked to pay for my drink so I could leave a tip. <br><br>It will be awhile before I will even think of returning.

Oh my gawd! How is this place that popular?? Our waitress was a complete dumba** she forgot drinks, gave us the wrong bill, got the wrong order and then treated us like complete and utter shit! Then the manager just shrugged us off.. It took us 2.5 hours to get through dinner!! Wtf! 20 mins for her to swipe my card but came back with the bill and not the card... Thank god there is a ton of other restaurants around here as we frequent Washington square...cause that was some bullsh*t! What a crap birthday experience for my daughter..
I love the Cheesecake Factory!! Always the best if there are problems the staff solves them!!

The service is bad, even non busy days. But i love the food so i gave them 3 stars. The food is amazing <br><br>Will return again .<br>We did talk to the manager but didnt help much neither but its allright because the food amazing

We aren&#39;t big fans of chain restaurants, but we have a credit card that gives $10 credit per month, so we may be stopping by monthly for a drink and an appy.<br><br>I started with a J.W.&#39;s Pink Lemonade - not too shabby.  We sat in the bar area to hit up happy hour and ordered off the bar menu.  When we received our order, our eyes popped out of our head.  The happy hour prices are great and they don&#39;t skimp!<br><br>- Buffalo Blasts - These were amazing.  A billion calories, but they actually put a fried chicken breading on the outside of the wonton!  If you&#39;re on a diet, stay away from these.<br><br>- Pork Belly Sliders - These were okay.  They weren&#39;t my favorite ever, but not too bad either.<br><br>- Spicy Caesar Salad - We thought we&#39;d try to go healthier after the other 2 artery cloggers.  I don&#39;t think we achieved our goal, but our mouths were happy anyway.  <br><br>- Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake - I keep wanting to like the cheesecake here.  I just don&#39;t think they nail it.

Well, this is not my 1st time here but for some reasons everything were salty tonight. <br>My chicken with mushroom soup came in good portion but salty. My friend had a chicken with mushed potatoes dish and she said they were salty.  Was salt on sales this week??? <br>We shared the raspberry cheese cake and it was good. The service was very good. Staffs were very nice. (And quite funny!!).
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! I&#39;ve been here about 4 times, and I have never been disappointed. The food is quality, and that damn Oreo Cheesecake will be my death lol.

I did want to post an update. I was contacted by a district manager this morning. As I told him what happened, I was still shaking mad at how we were treated. He stated he would have a conversation with the manager. I will post another note and update the stars if they make it right.
GREAT FOOD and of course BEST cheesecake!!Food is always HOT!!MUST TRY the pork belly sliders!!The sliders are always winers for me!!Great Job you yall!!Keep up the good work!!

My boyfriend and I really liked this place. The dishes were great. I even had enough to take home and eat the next day. <br><br>The service was on point too. They server checked us on to make sure everything was good and then left us alone to enjoy our meal. <br><br>Perfect date night.

Every time I come to the Cheesecake Factory, I am rarely disappointed as I always enjoy each experience! However today was kind of a disappointment.. I usually order a range of dishes depending on my mood. Today I ordered the Chicken Bellagio and I think last time I had it was back in L.A. so it&#39;s been a good 5 years. It was saucy, chicken was nice and crispy, and the pasta was delicious.<br><br>With that nostalgia and craving pasta, I decided to order it once more! However, the pasta was too dry this time, chicken was kind of on the softer side (not crispy) and I probably should have had it taken back and ordered something else but I was so starving I just dived in and by then, it was too late to return it.<br><br>On the bright side, some dishes I highly recommend are: fried calamari, firecracker salmon, pasta da vinci, bistro shrimp pasta, crispy chicken costoletta (one of my favs), hibachi steak, and ribeye steak. <br><br>Of course their list of cheesecakes is a whole different story! I will just say, hands down, I love their tiramisu cheesecake. Yum.

Very unaccommodating. Came during happy hour to enjoy a quick bite and a drink while shopping. The hostess turned us down rudely because of the lack of bar seating, meanwhile the entire rest of the restaurant was open. Trying to support businesses during COVID, but they did not want our money. Very disappointing.

I don&#39;t know why we keep coming back here.  I think we have the notion of getting dessert after dinner but then after dinner, we feel so crappy that we don&#39;t.  I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s the feeling that we just got ripped off for what we got or that we refuse to accept that this place used to be good and now they just suck.  <br><br>$16.00 for a burrito that is mostly filled with rice.<br>$16.00 for a Cobb salad that isn&#39;t worth the $2.00 pf produce on it.  The chicken had the consistency of a tire.<br><br>The servers are friendly but they are just too busy to keep up. <br><br>The floors are so slippery I feel like I&#39;m walking on ice. <br><br>This place is fine if you are a grand parent and you want to take your kids out someplace nice while they are still naive.  <br><br>Unless that&#39;s your plan, go somewhere else.

Had a reservation for 2 PM it wasn&#39;t very busy. It&#39;s  very nice and clean environment. Food was great the only reason I did not give 5 stars because server did not check in on us to see if we need to refill our drinks.

Portion sizes are huge and the cheesecake at the end of your meal always seals the deal. <br><br>The calamari batter seems off, it&#39;s very brittle and falls apart when you stick your fork in it, so you end up just eating the squid. <br><br>The burgers are thick and juicy. Decent pricing for the size and sides you get! <br><br>Really wish it wasn&#39;t so dark.. I could barely see what I was eating

Can never go wrong with a classic visit to the Cheesecake Factory! I ended up ordering a: A <br><br>1. Veggie Burger: made with Brown Rice, Farro, Mushrooms, Black Beans and Onion. Served on a Toasted Wheat Brioche Bun with Melted Fontina Cheese, Lettuce, Tomato, Pickles and Mayo<br><br>This was one of the most aesthetic burgers that I could of eating, but due to the fact that I was so tired after running the Portland Marathon, for the first time I was just too tired to eat. I ended up just taking my photo and passing out in the booth haha

My experience at the Cheesecake Factory was exactly like how I&#39;d describe the mushroom burger I ordered for dinner, tasteless. And I know what you&#39;re thinking, he&#39;s being dramatic. But nay, sir or madam, that would be an unsafe assumption. Tonight, for the first time in my life, I understand what people say when they describe food as &#39;tasteless.&#34; Maybe it&#39;s like the legend of Bigfoot - only those who have seen it can believe those who have also seen it.<br><br>So yeah, super bland and actually tasteless. It was pretty weird because usually when I go out for a burger I eat the whole thing and feel crappy, afterward. This time, because it was basically just stomach filler, I ate until I was no longer hungry and stopped. I didn&#39;t crave another bite as it would give me no satisfaction. Tonight, I experienced food on a purely functional level for the very first time. 2 stars!

Okay, I keep trying to see if I&#39;m going to enjoy something other than the Ahi appetizer from the skinny menue. Smh<br><br>So I coke here, same song and dance. Nice customer service, the ambiance is nice. Same set up as the rest, dim lighting, etc.  Now to the food:  I of course got my appetizer that never fails (lawd don&#39;t let me get sick off all this raw tuna).  I decide to keep it simple and do the lettuce wrapped chicken tacos and the dynamite shrimp.... MAJOR BUST.  The tacos were okay... but I only entertained eating the inside of the taco. The lettuce itself gave little enhancement to the dish and felt like I just ate lettuce straight from the bag.  The contents didn&#39;t help the lettuce tie into the whole dish.  The shrimp appetizer was a disaster.  I pretty much felt I was eating dough engulfed shrimp bites.  It seemed like there was more batter than shrimp . Worst part is as soon as I ate one whole I had to return the dish because I felt like I literally ate uncooked dough trying to eat the shrimp.  I&#39;m already on a strict lost of things to eat so if the food isnt worth it, I will send it back... and I did.  <br><br>Cheesecake factory... I&#39;m very disappointed. It seems that cheesecake is the saving grace and your ahi tartar dish is entirely too small when it seems to be the only amazing dish on the menu. <br><br>I&#39;m afraid to try again.

All in all the hype around Cheesecake Factory is a little bit much. The decor and the colors do take down the appeal of the place. <br><br>Now to the food. The appetizers and the drinks were good. Hence the 3 star rating. However the burgers and the main course left a lot to be desired. The burger was dry. And the flavor was lacking. The fries hardened after only a couple minutes making them worse than most if not all fast food chains. <br><br>The service was good. Our server got our food in a timely matter and was nice and seemed to care about her customers. Which was nice to see. <br><br>All in all the average ness of most of the food backs up the 3 star rating.

Such a disappointment. Strawberry  cheesecake was ice cold inside and taste horrible. It was mushy not creamy and not solid. The strawberries were not fresh. The texture  was not consistent as what a true cheesecake should be. It was mush the consistency of oatmeal with 0 flavor to it. The Oreo one wasn&#39;t any better. That one was frozen too. It was more like frosting and less CC.

I went here out of desperation because I had a hungry tornado child. I shouldn&#39;t have been surprised or disappointed. But I was. The food took forever, but they apologized without me saying anything (admitting the messed up the order and would comp it). Points for service but the food was cold on both plates . The salad was old tasting like the leaves had gone off (bitter). Lipstick stains on the water glasses. Gross! I want to give 3 stars for trying to make it right but it&#39;s just so forgettable. They should axe their ridiculous menu and try makes a shorter menu that are actually good. And fresh.

Love happy hour here. Portions are huge and made for sharing. The three of us ordered the salad rolls, chicken sliders, and nachos with chicken off the happy hour menu, and got the salad wraps off the dinner menu.<br><br>Happy hour seating is first come first serve, so try to get there when it starts as it gets packed pretty quick. You can also order off the dinner menu in the bar area.

Stopped by after our shopping spree at about 5pm and were seated after a few minutes. Got a happy hour drink and app for $7 each the pork belly sliders were good. Our server was really awkward and unprofessional. Every time she left our table she stood and talked to a guy sitting behind us for about 10 minutes each time. She did that the whole time we were there it was pretty annoying. I wonder if she ever got his number. I ordered the Mac and cheese burger which was one fried Mac and cheese ball on a burger that did not taste fresh. Boyfriend got the bang bang chicken. We each ate less than half then didn&#39;t eat the leftovers. We don&#39;t have one in Alaska where we are visiting from but I&#39;d come here for happy hour and not more. Was disappointed overall.

Great service in the bar area! My friend and I came here with her mom after shopping at Washington Square on her mom&#39;s birthday. We had already had a bite to eat earlier, but the shopping really takes it out of you! That being said, we each ordered an appetizer to share and enjoyed the sunset through the windows. The bartenders that tended to us were both sweet and we didn&#39;t feel rushed at all. Sometimes when I eat at the bar I feel like the staff is trying to get as many people in and out of there as possible, forgetting that we are humans and not robots. <br><br>At this location we were treated with the utmost respect and relaxed until we were ready to head home. This is definitely the best food option at Washington Square - with over 10 pages in menu items, I mean really, how can one go wrong? My summertime favorite is the skinnylicious artichoke (halved, and served with aioli). This was not the first and surely won&#39;t be the last time we eat at this CF location.

The service was great today, not bad for midday on a Saturday. I had the lunch portion alfredo with chicken (which was huge) and always a favorite, avocado spring rolls were on point. <br><br>I didn&#39;t order cheesecake because I was stuffed, now I&#39;m regretting that decision slightly but the restaurant did offer a cute little birthday Sunday treat that I shared with my daughter.

The menu reads like a novel.  While I appreciate the choices, I&#39;m more partial to the &#34;here are five items, pick one&#34; system.<br><br>Portions are huuuuuge.  Really, a &#34;normal&#34; person can finish a four taco platter the size of my torso and a milkshake the size of my head in one sitting?<br>This is a place to experience with others, or be a fan of doggie bags.  <br><br>Almost everything is better than average.  Today our party of 13 enjoyed a plethora of dishes.  Standouts: spaghetti and meatballs (simple, but effective), Avocado Toast, Huevos Rancheros (wish they offer refried rather than black beans), calamari, carrot cake, one of the cheesecakes (only 50 to choose so just guess), and fish tacos.  <br><br>Average: cheese burger, fries, bread basket, Mac n Cheese, shrimp pasta and crab dip.  The Sangria was good, but very ice heavy.  Server did a great job, especially as we had seven kids in tow.  Food arrived fast.  It&#39;s a chain, it&#39;s in a mall, but the old formula still works.<br><br>Given the portion sizes and taste, it&#39;s definitely value.

Came here on a Friday night for my brother-in-laws birthday. <br><br>Service was fine. Food was not so great. My ceaser salad had practically no dressing. My clam chowder did not even taste like clam chowder. My brother in laws cheesecake had a piece of plastic in it. Which they comped it once we brought it to their attention. It&#39;s loud and dark inside. <br><br>I&#39;m not crazy about the place.

I felt kind of bad giving two stars at first, but per Yelp this means &#34;Meh. I&#39;ve experienced better.&#34; Which to me, kind of sums up The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>It is, by no means, terrible food. I&#39;ve always found everything I&#39;ve had to be fine. But has also never been more than mediocre. With so many other dining options around, I don&#39;t really understand why people still choose to eat here. <br><br>I will say, their cheesecake is pretty good. I would put that a star above the rest.

The waitress was great minimal service but kept our drinks full. I order the chicken pot pie, and let me tell you it is not a chicken pot pie. It is more like soup on a plate and microwave croissant. My partner  ordered the shepherds pie and the sauce broke so instead of Rich mushroom gravy They had oil. The cheesecakes were semi dry and we didn&#39;t finish them. The bread on the other hand was very good and I&#39;m glad that they sell it at Freddys so we can buy it

This review is a few weeks late. We came here for a birthday and the service was good but not amazing, I took that into consideration since it was a Friday night and we had a party of 12. There was a bit of a wait since we were a pretty large group on a weekend. I ordered the salmon with asparagus and mashed potatoes. It was awful! The mashed potatoes tasted like it came out of a box (I&#39;m sure it did) and the salmon was so bland and dry, the asparagus was partially cooked. Hospital food is way better than the meal I had gotten. We took bites out of the different meals friends ordered and they were all awful. I won&#39;t be coming here anytime in 2019 unless I hear about a menu change.

$$$<br>Huge servings, amazing service, tasty drinks.<br><br>Always pleased with the food and the people here, they also have beautiful architecture inside, I enjoyed thoroughly.<br><br>They make sure to bring water, bread, and butter as soon as they can. Food doesn&#39;t take all to long either.<br>Most entrees cost between 24-22 dollars. Drinks are not cheap either. Very easy to leave with a $70 bill.

Be prepared to wait long to get in here.  Their estimation for timing is way off.   1hr and 10 turned into 1.5 hours then another 20 minutes max.  I&#39;m ok with long waits if they are real about it.

Excellent service and incredible food.  I started off with their beet salad. Nice fresh beets, mixed with baby arugula, candied pecans and rich, creamy goat cheese complimented with a nice light balsamic dressing. For my entree; I decided to go with the Southwest Chicken Sandwich.  First, the sandwich is huge; served up on an absolutely beautiful French baguette. Grilled chicken, avocado, and a tad of jalapeño pepper for a little kick.  A very nice sandwich I&#39;d gladly order again. Everything we ordered was excellent and I&#39;d highly recommend their pineapple Moscow Mule.  I&#39;m not usually a &#34;Chain&#34; fan but the Cheesecake Factory has always delivered regardless of which restaurant I&#39;ve dined at around the country.

We did a pick up order of a chicken, basil, tomato pasta dish tonight.  Take out is never the same as straight out of the kitchen.  The taste is great, but what did you do with the chicken?  I&#39;ve never had chicken that I couldn&#39;t chew unless it has been reheated in a microwave.  I needed a knife to cut it.  I did not reheat after I got home.  I was not satisfied at $16.95.  I sure hope the lemon strawberry cheesecake is not as disappointing.  Actually I only came, because I had received a $50 Cheesecake Gift Card.

We stopped by on the way back from woodburn outlet mall. Cheesecake factory is one of our all time hangout places. Great ambience and serving.<br><br>As usual, was served with warm fresh breads and butter. We love their complementary brown breads over white ones. <br><br>Ordered couple of dishes:<br>Spicy crispy chicken sandwich - good, came with potato fries. Really liked their crispy chicken breast, yum yum.  Requested for mayo on the side as well. <br><br>Spicy chicken chipotle pasta - good, very delicious. Love it. Out favorite pasta here. Other than that, minor, We had to add pepper n salt. <br><br>Finally we ended with 30th anniversary cheese cake, as always simply mouth watering, cant stop eating it. <br><br>Overall, another enjoyable experience.

Always enjoy this location! Love going to the bar. Bartenders are very attentive and makes sure your order is correct. Any large food chain has its issues but overall this location has been consistent with the quality of food &amp; service!
My favorite restaurant at Washington Square. The team works really hard to keep things moving. I have so many favorite treats to eat  - one day I&#39;ll grow up and really explore the menu!

Was wanting to try this place for a while, and when we finally did, there was little to disappoint me. The place was crowded, but that&#39;s a given since it was a massive mall. Service was great, and our server was very friendly and informative. For appetizers, we ordered the Thai Chicken wraps and the Avocado Egg Rolls which were in my opinion the best on the menu. For my main course I got the Alfredo Pasta, and a side Caesar salad. They were fairly good! The best thing by far of this place is the large menu. There are over 10 pages of endless choices. The waitress told us that they change up the menu every six months to keep things fresh. If you are in the area or in the mood for trying a new place, this is a great option.

Extremely disappointed today! It had been several years since we had gone back to the Cheesecake Factory, food was amazing. But after taking 2 bites of my meal and feeling some rough object in my mouth. I spit the second bite out to my plate and come to find out it was A piece of metal bristles. My waitress came over and said let me get the manager, manager came  and she said she sorry that had happened, I did not ask for anything in return hoping they would resolve the issue. She comes back instead of taking care of our entire bill takes one meal off and gave me a gift card. When our bill was $100. Extremely disappointed, if I had swallowed the metal object, I&#39;d be in the hospital and my doctor bill would have been thousands of dollars. And for a high-end restaurant not being able to cover my $100 bill, I was very very sadly disappointed. What has happened with our customer service in this era?

For the ones who like healthy food, after workout this is probably the best meal for u guys. <br>&#34;Almond-crusted salmon salad&#34; has inside avocados, cranberries, quinoa and so much more . <br>LOVED IT!

The service was decent, slow but friendly. Our waiter got our orders wrong along with a few other tables too. When we asked for our correct dish (chicken alfredo) we waited 20 minutes all for her to bring a small bowl of warm bland chicken to throw on top of my already cold and gross pasta. This place has awful food, I got very sick after eating the Chicken Madera and started throwing up. We had to completely send back the chicken alfredo because that was just awful.  I will never go back to this place and would definitely recommend to people to never try this place either.

3.5 stars. Not great, not bad, nice interior, friendly staff, huge menu. <br><br>Came here to just grab a few beers and ended up getting some food towards the end. All-in-all, our waitress was really nice and responsive, checked-up on us the right amount and was prompt with getting us service. The place is nice on the inside and has a bit of an oceanic feel to it with the decor and lights. <br><br>I got a chipotle chicken sandwich, which was HUGE. It was only $13, but I swear it was an entire chicken breast, so I&#39;m glad I got the salad on the side. The sandwich (it had a burger bun) was actually really good; the chicken was super juicy and the chipotle sauce gave some nice kick with the breading, and the vegetables (tomato, lettuce) were fresh. Other than the sheer size of it (which can be good or bad depending on how hungry you are), which made it a bit hard to eat, it was enjoyable. <br><br>The salad was a bit disappointing. I ordered blue cheese and when it arrived it looked soggy like it had dressing on it, but there was practically nothing on it. Seemed like they put a drop of salad dressing on it then mixed it up. Odd. I asked for some more and they gave me extra dressing so it wasn&#39;t a big deal but it was a bit confusing if they actually thought it had dressing on it. <br><br>The menu can be a bit daunting to parse through (Ramsey wouldn&#39;t approve); maybe they can consider breaking it up or using different menus for time of day.

I have always been a fan for the chain restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory (mostly for the dessert)! <br>Today I took my family out to brunch at a busy time on an early Sunday afternoon.<br>The party of the four of us sat down within 5 minutes of walking into the restaurant and we were served quickly and efficiently. <br>Even though the restaurant was packed by the time we had finished our meal, the service was fast and the waiter was friendly and attentive. <br>Definitely would come back here!

Bad customer service. Everytime I&#39;m at the counter to order food I have to wait for employees to finish talking about their beach trips or whatever is more important than you&#39;re paying customers. People will go better places if you&#39;re employees are too preoccupied with themselves.

We ordered cheese cakes for desert after dinner, but we were too full and couldn&#39;t eat it.  We asked the waitress to box it. And it is very disappointed that she just threw the cake in the box upside down.  If she couldn&#39;t do it right, she could have just given us the box to do it ourselves. Very very disappointed and made me concerned how they prepared my food
The kids fettuccini alfredo was awful. It tasted more like butter sauce than fettuccine. :( got cheesecake too though and that was really good. Kids meal was just so disappointing...

I love the Washington Square location, but was disappointed with our time at this location today. We ordered two appetizers. After waiting 15-20 minutes, the manager came to our table to say that one of the appetizers was messed up &amp; they were re-making it which would cause it to be 10 more minutes. Both apps tasted great once they arrived. After we finished, it was another 30 minute wait for dinner to arrive. We had three chicken Madeira entrees, one chicken fettuccine &amp; a black pepper shrimp entree. Everything looked good, but all three chicken Madeira entrees were barely warm. The cheese couldn&#39;t even melt it was so cold. After waiting so long we didn&#39;t want things to be sent back to wait even longer. The manager returned to our table to say he&#39;d buy us all dessert. It was a nice gesture, but I expect The Cheesecake Factory to do better than this. I want hot food, especially when I pay $140 for it.

Really disappointed. Spent over $90 and our food came out cold and looked like it had been sitting under the heat lamp for awhile. Would have said something to the waitress but we had so many servers it was hard to know who was at fault. Won&#39;t waist our money there again.

1/4/19<br><br>We typically avoid Cheesecake Factory due to the crowded atmosphere of Washington square mall, but we were craving some good cheesecake! <br><br>We waited about 40 minutes on a Friday night to be seated. They do not take reservations to be ready to wait a bit.. <br><br>I had the impossible burger and man was it GOOD! They give you the chance to assemble it at the table which I don&#39;t mind at all, food service didn&#39;t seem like it took forever, and the staff was very friendly. The ambience of the restaurant is dim/ candle lit but it&#39;s also kid friendly. <br><br>Plethora of entrees, cheese cakes and cocktail drinks to choose from.

Sadly, DoorDash delivery apparently allows Cheesecake Factory to skimp on quality. Ordered wellness salad with salmon. Looks like a 1/2 bag of greens from the grocery store with an unappetizing piece of salmon on top. Very tiny bits of broccoli, no pears and a few grapes. <br><br>Disappointing to have received such a substandard meal from CF.

Our favorite place for any occasion to celebrate . Awesome customer service with very good food and delicious cheese cakes.<br>the wait time is usually 20 mins , we have been there on several occasions both on week end and week days mostly had to wait even on week days.<br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2F1.My&amp;s=1f5c5bf135f2e1e07158e6ed671ba76d7699d6d1089cfcb5500f26f7a2c2cbcd" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">1.My</a> husband all time favorite is steak and salmon combo, I dont eat steak but tried their salmon. wow so good moist and the sauce is amazing.<br>2.We also go for crab cakes on all our visits, its simply awesome.<br>3.California club chicken sandwich- very good and the fries comes wit hit is awesome too. try the sweet potato ones .<br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2F4.My&amp;s=1d96b6717e7bf2cd899be02caad41f311e480606e34e144b8ec25e84b4f39b01" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">4.My</a> son loves the mac and cheese with chicken.<br>5.Louisiana  chicken pasta - flavorful but pasta was slightly on dry side.<br>6.Spicy chicken chipotle pasta- not so spicy but flavorful.<br>7. Baja chicken tacos- not a right place to  try tacos:)<br>8.crusted chicken Romano- yum i loved every bite, my sons favorite too.<br>9.Chicken marsala with mushroom- i loved the sauce on it and the chicken was so juicy.<br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2F9.Fish&amp;s=148f716173ef414c3b046e858d9e45d69b3ad4bdfba1069f0b30907424720880" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">9.Fish</a> and chips- had better fish and chips on other places so wont go for this one here again, was bit oily and nothing outstanding.<br><br>Few dishes i have tried mentioned spicy was not spicy at all.But they have few awesome signature dishes that make me to go there.<br>i am not a original cheese cake fan but i love other ones especially the Oreo cheese cake, so rich and yummy , also their triple chocolate cake.

I&#39;ve been here many times. This is the first time I feel unwelcome. They close at 11pm. We came in at 10:05 and it was two of us. It took about 25 minutes to get my food to ours table. The server didn&#39;t come back after bring our food to the table. I have to ask for cheese to put on my pasta. I have to look for the server to put my food in the box. He didn&#39;t pack the food for us. We have to pack it ourselves while he got nothing and walking back and forth. Wanted announce our servers name. But my friend stopped me. BY the way, the manager of the night was really nice.

They weren&#39;t very busy on this day, and for a party of two, the wait at 6pm was very short, only a few minutes. But once seated we seemed to be forgotten. <br><br>There were two of us, and also parties of two on either side of us. Even though we were seated and ordered first, they both received each course long before we did. We had the same server as one side and a different server than the other side. <br><br>I&#39;m not sure what would have caused the delay, it was just strange sitting there so long after two sets of customers came and went while we were still waiting for our food. The food was very good though, as always. Service was friendly too. I&#39;d forgotten that they box up the leftovers for you, they don&#39;t just bring you the box. The box and bag both leaked horribly though, even though I was VERY careful to keep it perfectly level. So the leftovers had to go straight to the trash. Had I boxed them up myself, I&#39;d have left out the sauces, especially the one I clearly hadn&#39;t touched (why would I want to take that one home if I didn&#39;t care to eat any of it there?)<br><br>Still, it&#39;s a nice once-in-a-while treat. I enjoyed the food and atmosphere. I&#39;ll forget all about this experience before I go again next year.
I&#39;m a cheesecake factory fan girl for sure, but this one was really toos! Best chicken Madeira I&#39;ve ever had!!!!! Great hospitality at well! Thanks!

3.5 Stars. I have a love/hate relationship with The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I love that they have a extensive menu option for everybody to love. They choose from burgers to pastas to steak to salads. You name it. They start you off with complimentary (unlimited refill) of bread (sourdough &amp; pumpernickel). Service was pretty good too. Water refills were on point. Food was pretty delicious, if you pick the right dish (I had chicken bellagio- chicken was a dry for my taste). Presentation was on point though, however the dim lights makes it hard to Instagram.<br><br>I dislike the long wait. A party of 7 had to wait 1 hour and 45 minutes before seated. Someone did keep coming to update us regarding the wait, however the way they said it sounds like they ONLY HAD ONE table that can accommodate our large party (they had to wait until that party to leave....)  The Cheesecake factory is a pretty big restaurant and you&#39;re telling me that you only have one table big enough for our party? dangggg, if it wasn&#39;t for a birthday gathering, I&#39;d have left years go. Once we were seated and ordered, it took 48 minutes before our food to arrive. <br><br>Recommendations: Do not come hungry. Do not come with a party more than two. Bring a snack while you wait.

It&#39;s okay. I don&#39;t think a twenty page menu is necessary. It&#39;s busy, loud and there is always a long wait. I won&#39;t be coming back because I prefer a peaceful environment and a lower caloric menu.

The spicy chicken chipotle pasta (hold the chicken) has gone downhill in flavor over the years. I also asked for no peas, but the dish came out with peas. One time I got the vegetarian &#34;burger&#34; and the taste would cause a meat eater to think vegetarian food is gross. From what I remember, the appetizers were good the times I did get them. However, the price of an appetizer is the same as an entrée that I would get elsewhere at a decent restaurant. The cheesecakes are always a bit too sweet for my liking. The item I love most is the complimentary bread!<br><br>Regardless of food quality and taste, the service is always excellent. I admire these people for the work they do in this hectic environment. The ambiance is alright if you don&#39;t mind crowds of people.<br><br>The fact is, CF will always get good business even with a low Yelp! rating. People love this kind of stuff. I don&#39;t intend on coming back here anytime soon. The price you pay is just not worth the food you get.

It&#39;s been years since I&#39;d gone to the Cheesecake Factory and they didn&#39;t disappoint my memory. My party of 5 was seated quickly even without a reservation granted it was a weekday. I tried the chicken bellagio and it was delicious. The combination of thin breaded chicken, arugula, and prosciutto was so good it will definitely be a reorder next time. However, next time I may ask for extra sauce or parmesan since I found the noodles to be a bit bland and on the dry side. The food did take a while to come out but there was bread to snack on while we talked so it wasn&#39;t a big deal.

I&#39;ve never had a bad meal here. I love pretty much everything on the menu. Fried cauliflower is my favorite with that really tasty Korean sauce. Menu is fairly expensive, but portions are large and food, again, is delicious.<br><br>I&#39;m sad they discontinued my beloved pineapple upside down cheesecake.<br><br>Curbside service is not super great. I waited 40 minutes over my scheduled time, which made me late back to work. I won&#39;t be doing that again. Going in, wait times for pickup are often lengthy, and it can be awkward waiting in that LONG line for takeout. I do wish that had an express line for orders that have already been called in. I&#39;ve waited in line so long behind people just ordering, that by the time I get my stuff, it&#39;s cold.

Love this place and their Mac and cheese balls! The thing that&#39;s frustrating about this place is that it&#39;s not handicap friendly. My son is on life support and we can&#39;t come here because there&#39;s no tables for his voyage kid kart (it&#39;s a pediatric wheelchair). I wish there was a table or two for families with medically fragile children. It&#39;s been really hard eating anywhere nicer. I really miss the cheesecake and those deep fried Mac and cheese balls of heaven.

This is a solid Cheesecake Factory.  It&#39;s consistent with other Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to in various other states, with an extensive food, drink, and, of course, dessert menu.  The portions are large, easily shareable, and the cheesecake is delicious. <br><br>The service we received was top notch. Our server was friendly, honest, and efficient.  We were a large party of 7, and he did a great job checking in on us and keeping the meal rolling. <br><br>I would come back to this Cheesecake Factory, and recommend it to others.

I have been waiting 15 minutes in the bar for service!! Finally got to order a drink. But after 10 minutes had to go to the bar and get one myself!!!<br>This place has gone so downhill!! Very poor customer service. Too bad:(

If you go to the Cheesecake Factory, I encourage you to take at least TWO credit cards. I just got soaked $35 (with tip) for lunch. Some friends and I took out a friend for a birthday lunch.<br>I had fish tacos ($16.95), a diet coke ($$4 - is that even legal? We aren&#39;t in Kansas anymore - or McDonalds - albeit not in the same class, where it&#39;s $1 for a HUGE diet coke, with free refills). I also ordered a slice of pumpkin cheesecake to celebrate ($8.50 a slice, at first I thought I must be buying the whole thing!)<br>Next time, I guess I&#39;ll have to bring my calculator - because, I had NO idea a drink would be $4, or I&#39;d be paying for the whole cheesecake!<br>I will say - the service was very good - but, how much of that do you think went to the hourly wage of the server?<br>I&#39;m going to see if Cheesecake Factory is publicly traded, and by stock in it!<br>I left what would have been a Happy Birthday lunch feeling ripped off - they must have seen me coming - it ruined my whole day. Thanks Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ll close, so I can check the New York Stock Exchange and BUY stock - so I can afford to eat there. <br>Never again - once, shame on you, twice, shame on me!

We came here at 4 on a Saturday hoping to beat the long wait time but there was still a 40 minute wait. We ordered the everything pizza with a salad to share as an appetizer. The pizza crust was soggy so we had to eat with a fork. The salad came with no dressing on it or on the side. For our main course we ordered the chicken taco salad rolls and the bacon bacon cheeseburger. The lettuce for the salad rolls were too small so you couldn&#39;t eat them like tacos and had to use a fork. The flavor was good though. The bacon bacon cheeseburger was delicious! The burger patty was large and there was two type of bacon on it. <br><br>I think our servers name was Leon. He was friendly and energetic.

Arrived to a packed bar at about 630. Started with a drink and the avocado egg rolls which were delicious.<br><br>I had the chicken and shrimp pineapple dish for dinner which was delicious as well. Service was top notch and the bar emptied at 7pm when happy hour ended.

I purchased a slice of the gharideli chocolate cherry cheesecake yesterday and although it was very tasty, what I received was a very minuscule slice compared to what I saw displayed in their showcases.  The piece I received in my container was not even half the size I saw in the showcase. I dont know if the glass used in the showcase magnifies the size of the cakes or if the cakes in the display case are real or not, but the size represented in the showcase is much larger than what was received. At $8.50 a slice, I was very disappointed and felt ripped off.

THE LOCATION<br>Perfectly situated at the ginormous Washington Square Mall, this restaurant is located in the Northwest corner of one of the top grossing malls per square footage in the US. It makes for a excellent pit stop to refuel and recharge before tackling the remaining acreage of the stores. <br><br>THE PARKING<br>Endless and ample free lot parking surrounding the entire shopping center. <br><br>THE ATMOSPHERE<br>The last time my husband and I visited a Cheesecake Factory was many many years ago. It was the one in Waikiki where it&#39;s always crowded, dimly lit and so noisy that you can&#39;t even hear yourself think. This location in Tigard was a pleasant surprise. As soon as you enter the restaurant, there&#39;s enough space in there to ballroom dance. The charming decor, elegant lighting, soothing color tones, exaggerated high ceilings and well-spaced tables make for a comfortable yet grand feel. <br><br>THE FOOD<br>Even though it&#39;s typical Cheesecake Factory fare, it&#39;s consistent and done really well. <br><br>---Teriyaki Chicken $16.95---<br>Sure it&#39;s not the best teriyaki chicken, but it&#39;s a good healthy alternative though it contains way too much sodium for someone on a low sodium diet. As usual, the portion size is generous. However, my husband didn&#39;t have any trouble polishing off the chicken and mashed potatoes plus 1/4 of my salad. He left the accompanying sautéed plantains untouched. I ate the sautéed pineapple chunks which came with his dish. <br><br>---Sheila&#39;s Chicken &amp; Avocado Salad, dinner size $14.95---<br>I love salads and this one certainly satisfies without high calorie ingredients like bleu cheese and bacon. It contained a generous mix of romaine lettuce, mixed greens, cubed avocado, a sprinkling of cashew nuts and some sliced chicken breast. The honey peanut dressing was requested on the side which was flavorful but turned out to be slightly too sweet for my taste.  <br><br>THE SERVICE <br>Extremely professional, courteous, attentive and prompt. <br><br>THE BOTTOMLINE<br>We would definitely return to this location again.

This is one of the slowest restaurants in terms of service in the Portland area. I am writing this review from inside the restaurant and I have been waiting for over 45 minutes and I still haven&#39;t received my food.

Solid place. <br><br>Good desserts, as the name suggests, and decent food. In chains, you know what to expect and get what you expect. <br><br>Here I appreciate the consistency of the food and good service. <br><br>I wish the location was larger and there were more seats because my complaints are that the wait is long to get a table and that it&#39;s too loud.<br><br>It&#39;s so loud that the first time I brought a friend in, we walked in and out in under a minute. We couldn&#39;t tolerate the sheer volume. Perhaps, some soft sound dampening panels or curtains could be added? The only time it&#39;s not crazy loud is rare because the restaurant isn&#39;t full... which doesn&#39;t happen frequently.<br><br>Maybe the corporate higher ups haven&#39;t been out to this location and experienced the decibel level of this location. Or maybe they like loud restaurants.

I&#39;m usually a fan of Cheesecake Factory but I&#39;m writing a low rating for my experience the other day. My friend and I ordered the salmon. Mine was cooked perfectly and my friends was under cooked half raw. She already ate from it but when she realized it was under cook she let the waiter know and requested a new one. The weird thing to us is that he took only the salmon off her plate to have them cook it more but left the mashed potatoes and veggies. We just kinda think it&#39;s strange that they would take something undercooked that she ate off of and re cook it instead of offering a new dish. Don&#39;t think that&#39;s a good example of food safety and sanitation. Yikes!

OK, I&#39;ve got a story or you.  A short time after this virus shut-in business started, I called and placed an order for take-out from this once beloved  restaurant of mine.  I gave my order to the person on the phone who sounded pretty young and had an accent.  As I am handicapped, I told her I would be parking in the spaces that are provided where the staff brings the food out to the car.  She then asked for the make and model of my car which I gave her and she reminded me to call when I arrived.  Once there, I made that call and told her exactly where I was parked, then I waited.  I waited 20+ minutes (not including my driving time) and asked this same woman where my food was.  Once again I told her were I was parked.  About 15-20 minutes later, she called me wanting to know if I still wanted the food!!!  I went ballistic.  I hope I made her cry.  The manager soon arrived with my food which I told him was too old at this point, but which he assured me was fresh so I took it (big mistake)!  Then he gave me the excuse that the stupid order taker misunderstood my first name and so they couldn&#39;t find me.  What!?  I saw no one roaming the parking spaces looking for anyone by any name.  And, when I told him he should be wearing gloves, he told me his &#34;cute&#34; little story about how he had recently had to pick up some friends who just arrived from one of the quarantined boats.  I will NEVER go there again!!!!

Tried this for the first time today! To be honest, I only wanted to eat here because I have heard the name so many times on the Big Bang Theory tv show. But I was pleasantly surprised by the taste of the food! I got a pasta dish that was on the little specials list. Great price of $14 with yummy spaghetti noodles, mushrooms, meatballs, pepperoni, etc. It was delicious! Half of it filled me up. The menu is gigantic, I kind of want to go here to just try everything. <br><br>The atmosphere of the restaurant is very nice, it&#39;s mood lighting (but not too dark) inside with beautiful decorations. We got sat after two minutes on a Wednesday at 6pm, but it was at the tables where you&#39;re sitting pretty close to other people. A little loud inside and definitely funny when the people next to you can hear everything you talk about! <br><br>Our server (if I can remember, I think his name was Charlie), was very nice! Checked in on us, refilled drinks, and happily asked if we wanted more bread. It was great!<br><br>I didn&#39;t get to try the cheesecake or any cocktails, but definitely will next time!

Fast counter service if you&#39;re just picking up some cheesecake.  Service was attentive and friendly but kind of... cold?  They did what they needed to bit it was like being read a script, no real care behind it.  Oh well.  I ordered a couple slices of cheesecake and they were sloppily thrown into containers, bagged and given to me.<br><br>My cheesecakes were smashed and cut so that I was actually missing a good chunk of the ends. At $8 a slice you better give me the whole slice and I don&#39;t want it smashed up against the containers so I have to wipe it off in order to eat it

I went for happy hour thanksgiving eve. Ordered the steak medallions and they arrived lukewarm. I requested for them to be reheated, waited 10 minutes and they came back exactly the same temperature. By this time, I was really hungry. The bartender asked if they could start from scratch with the meal, I declined. But suggested perhaps a credit, he notified the manager and she credited my meal. So the end result,  I was pleased with the bartender and manager. The food, not so much.
Mine and my boyfriends first time! The most amazing food, and great service! Definitely recommend to anyone.

Ordered some food to be delivered to my elderly aunt. Ordered a side of mashed potatoes in addition to a sandwich. I specifically added that I wanted a separate container of white gravy for the mashed potatoes. My aunt received NO GRAVY, even though it was noted on the receipt that was attached to her delivery!!

For a national chain restaurant, this place is pretty great. There are plenty of options. In fact, sometimes it&#39;s takes us a little bit to figure out what to eat. They cover just about any kind of dietary restrictions, and offer quite a bit of ethnic style foods as well. For the price, portions are generous. They also offer many seasonal items as well. <br><br>Everything I&#39;ve eaten here so far has been good. And, of course, the cheesecakes are the big reason why people come here. <br><br>The big drawback for me is the wait time to be seated. Do not, I repeat, do not come here if you&#39;re in any kind of rush as wait times can be over an hour, or longer on weekends.

Atmosphere is always nice and calm. Great date night place or even somewhere to come with the entire family. The many, many, many varieties of delicious cheesecake options are endless! Tonight we had the truffle honey chicken with mashed potatoes and asparagus, shrimp and chicken gumbo, crazy carrot cheesecake &amp; raspberry lemon cheesecake! I have no complaints!
Worst Cobb Salad in town.   Indifferent service.  Long waits.  Extremely noisy.  This is a good place to get cheesecake,  but most of the food is mediocre.

Just very unpredictable.<br>1 hour and 20 minutes turned into almost 2 hour wait. Went up twice to ask about seating and they said 30 minutes and it eventually turned to 45 minutes..we have been waiting so long our pager device was dying, kept flashing Lo...not a fan.

You gotta love Cheesecake Factory. Consistent in their menu, most items are good, but not great, but that is what happens when you have a ginormous menu. However, I do really like their food! The best part is the cheesecake though. No matter what Cheesecake Factory you go to there is always a wait, so make sure to plan ahead and at least you can kill time by walking around the mall! Great customer service here too.

My friends and I had lunch at The Washington Square Mall Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ll say the food was excellent. What made the experience even more special was the wonderful service that we got from our server Angie. Thanks you Cheesecake Factory for having someone so special on your team! Angie You are the best!

We&#39;ve been sitting on two gift cards for a long time, so Husband &amp; I treated ourselves.  We ordered an appetizer, cocktails, dinner, and dessert. <br><br>The always-delicious avocado egg rolls were great and my margarita was good. I got a turkey burger sans the bun and I thought it was really good (the garlic aoli was amazing!).  My husband, though, got the beef dip without onions. It came with the onions, but they were large enough chunks that he could easily pick them out. Unfortunately, he said it just wasn&#39;t very good overall. The cheesecake, however, was perfect. <br><br>Our waitress was darling and the manager came by to apologize for the onion goof.  The only thing I don&#39;t like about The CF is the noise level. Because of that, my elderly folks can never go here. Boo!

My daughter requested a cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory. So my husband called in an hour before to reserve a strawberry cheesecake. Most of us are lactose intolerant and therefore requested a 6 inch cake. Lucas confirmed over the phone they had it set aside for us. <br><br>I went in to pick up the cheesecake. I had to wait in line and when it was my turn, Lucas knew exactly who I was and told me the 6 inch strawberry cheesecake was no longer available. There were a few 6 inch plain and one strawberry in the front case. I asked if I can get one of those. He told me they are not for sale, although I saw someone pull some from the front case. I asked him what is the smallest cake he had and he told me a 10 inch one for double the price. Since it was my daughter&#39;s birthday and she specifically asked for it, I went ahead and bought it. Lucas told me they were ready made. I was very surprised to see him go in the back area and put strawberries on a plain cheesecake, then charge the higher price. <br><br>I had to wait over half an hour for Lucas to make the strawberry cheesecake. He did not apologize for the wait or say thank you. Will never go back nor recommend this place to anyone. <br><br>After reading a few other reviews, it is highly recommended to never pre-order a cheesecake here. <br><br>There are too many good restaurants and better bakeries that do a great job and get the orders right without the wait.

My family and I love coming here. Unfortunately today was probably the worst experience we&#39;ve had at a Cheesecake Factory. For the sake of keeping it quiet and sweet, I will just say that our server was switched a few minutes after we were sat, and our new server was pretty awkward. He was not friendly at all. <br><br> Our food took 40+ min and all we ordered were a few appetizers. One of the appetizers we ordered were sliders with cheese. They must have forgot to add the cheese. So we asked the server about it, and he took them back to get them &#34;fixed&#34; and brought back the sliders with a cold piece of cheddar on each one, and still charged us for adding cheese. By than the sliders were cold too, they were pretty gross, we didn&#39;t end up eating them. <br><br>Service and food sucked today.

Came here for a birthday lunch with my mom since our birthdays are a day apart. I ordered the Fettuccini Alfredo with Chicken. My mom ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. The alfredo was delicious!! It was so creamy and buttery! I would definitely order it again. The service was great. The food came fast and he offered us some bread and butter as an appetizer. I also got a free ice-cream sundae as a birthday treat! It was also really good. We finished our lunch by ordering some cheesecake to go. Whenever I go to The Cheesecake Factory, I always order the Chocolate Mousse Cheesecake and it never disappoints. I definitely recommend it. I always have a great experience here and I love their food!

I live in France and I&#39;ve been visiting The Cheese Cake Factory each time I am in US (hopefully on a regular basis). The food and recipes are excellent (even comparing to well known French cuisine). <br><br>That time we again enjoyed our meals and obviously the Cheesecakes as deserts. Find some photographs here attached ...<br><br>Service was great thanks to Megan and this is usual here ... everything perfect once again.

From the beginning, I expected something really unique that I&#39;ve never seen before.<br>I got exactly that.<br>I enter, and the decor, lighting, etc. was just so amazing! I was very impressed on how everything looked. I was also very impressed on their selection of cheesecakes (which you can see towards your right as you enter).<br>I ordered the Chicken Marsala with Mushrooms, mostly because it was my favorite dish at Olive Garden, and was curious to see how they would taste.<br>Sadly, I wasn&#39;t impressed by the taste, for it was very sour all throughout the dish. The rest of my party said that it tasted fine, which indicated that it wasn&#39;t entirely the restaurant&#39;s fault, since I was stuck with Olive Garden&#39;s taste in my mind XD.<br>But when it got to the cheesecakes, I was BLOWN AWAY!!! We got the tiramisu, mango key lime, and ultimate red velvet. I only got to try the red velvet once, but I completely finished the tiramisu slice in two days. I believe the rest of the people in my party that ate the mango key lime really liked it, but I absolutely LOVED the Tiramisu. It actually tasted like a regular tiramisu!<br>I&#39;m giving this review 5 stars because of many factors which I absolutely adored, such as their REALLY BIG menu.
