Like, you will never get bored of one dish ever at their place! And even though I didn&#39;t like their Chicken Marsala, it wasn&#39;t entirely their fault, so I won&#39;t hold it against them. The rest of the restaurant (service, decor, selections, etc.) was top-notch, and I would really like others to go there, which is why I&#39;m giving The Cheesecake Factory 5 stars.

I&#39;m still giving the 3 stars, but feel I need to update my review.<br><br>Let me start with hostess: super friendly and efficient.   Cheesecake counter at the entrance: obviously way too much choice which is an absolute luxury.  Excellent cheese cake. <br><br>But things inside the restaurant seem to have changed.   After we sit down service isn&#39;t as attentive nor friendly as it used to be, maybe a bit rushed, maybe not so interested, but it actually annoyed me the last time.<br><br>I&#39;ve had 3 different cocktails during  my last visits and they were all SO sweet: please, mr or mrs bar tender, slow down and take it easy with the simple syrup... This isn&#39;t funny anymore.   Sending it back didn&#39;t exactly help.    So you&#39;re losing me on this one. <br><br>Food wise it&#39;s consistent.  No complaints there. <br><br>It&#39;s just the waiting staff I&#39;m underwhelm with.

The situation was NOT rendered. The employee is worse than ever. Clearly no training was given to this young lady. She continues to have a horrible attitude, rude and very unprofessional. You&#39;ve lost my business as well as all my colleagues and family&#39;s.

Been to The Cheese Cake Factory in many cities and I honestly I don&#39;t get the big deal people make about this place. I only come here because the people that I&#39;m with insist on coming here. Apart from the desserts, the have food is just average for the amount of money you pay. This location at Washington Square is particularly the worst that I&#39;ve been to. Yes presentation is nice, but what&#39;s the point if it doesn&#39;t taste good. On a slow night like it was there shouldn&#39;t be any excuse for food to come out as tasteless as it was. Barley any seasons on the meat, fries taste okay but not fresh and hot (been sitting under the heater for a while), fish and chips mediocre, first bite from both ends is just batter with no fish, coleslaw and sauce tasted good. Service was okay. Waited a while for food to come out.

I love the cheesecake factory and come here almost every time I visit Washington Square Mall.<br>They have so many food choices and almost everything I&#39;ve tried turned out to be successful! <br>My most recent visit was during the lunch hour so I was able to get lunch portions, the full portions are HUGE!<br>I had the Thai Cashew Salmon.. I believe it was? I loved thai curry and I wish it had a little more sauce to go with my brown rice(white or brown rice option) but I had too much rice anyways.<br>The salmon had good flavor, only I think it was a little on the dry side. Again, I think more sauce may have made the dish a little better.<br>I usually get their pasta dishes, and was a little hesitant trying out something new but I&#39;m glad I did!

This is a difficult review because I don&#39;t necessarily like chain restaurants and the automated nature of them. So here is as unbiased review I can write. <br><br>1. I&#39;ve been here twice and there&#39;s an ungodly wait for lunch. Why people would wait 45 minutes to eat at a chain attached to.a mall I don&#39;t know. <br><br>2. Service was very good and no complaints or issues.<br><br>3. The food is decent for a chain restaurant. I had a sandwich which was good but nothing special. GF had a salad which looked good. Tried several apps which were good. Overall, maybe a notch above an Applebee&#39;s food.<br><br>4. Prices seem decent but not great. <br><br>In conclusion,  not a place I would go on my own but good enough if dragged to for a birthday celebration.

My family has been going here for awhile now, and it seems like each time the service is going down. Don&#39;t get me wrong, the cheesecake is delicious, but that&#39;s about all that&#39;s very good. Everything else is way too overpriced and is not worth it. <br><br>Our last experience, the waiter brought over a list of items that were no longer on the menu because they ran out. It was my dad&#39;s birthday, and we asked told the waiter. He didn&#39;t even bring my dad&#39;s food, but a different dish that he did not ask for. It took forever to find out that they ran out of what he wanted in the first place. They didn&#39;t even sing happy bday for him or do anything, they just did not care but did it for one other customer, when we heard the singing. <br><br>The line is extremely long, have to get there at least 40 min-1 hour early to get seats when you would actually like to. In all, take the cheesecake to go and that&#39;s it.

I was planning on eating here but found out that The Cheesecake Factory does not support our police officers. How a general manager kicks out police officers tying to eat is beyond me. Will never eat here again.

I ordered the Mexican lettuce wraps for lunch. They came with small chunks of lettuce with a spoonful of toppings sitting on top, in wax paper. Apparently they don&#39;t know the definition of the word &#34;wrap&#34;. There was no way to pick this mess up and eat it, nor was there room on the plate to dump it out of the holder. Luckily I still had my little bread plate which I put it on, to eat like a salad. If I wanted a salad, I would have ordered one. There was no salad dressing just a little salsa, so it was terrible. My lunch guest didn&#39;t like her pasta and left it. A very disappointing meal!

This was my first time here and it was awesome! It was very busy, there was a wait when we got there, always a good sign! There was an incredible amount of choices on the menu. From appetizers, to food, specialities, drinks, and dessert. It was so hard to decide. I had the bacon bacon burger and it was pretty tasty, it&#39;s huge by the way! The appetizer we had was a grilled cheese sandwich with bacon strips and it was cut into four squares. The description of it, for some reason made us think it was going to be mozzarella sticks.. and it was not. (Our bad) but they were average, not something we&#39;d order again, very plain. I had a alcohol blended drink, it was all peach and it was SO good! Now the drawbacks, the restaurant is very dark, and VERY loud. And by loud I mean the music was just blaring. Our waiter was very nice, but he came by our table at least 30 times asking how everything was interrupting our conversation and it got to be annoying. We were fine, enjoying our food, eating, drinking and having conversation. We felt like he was sort of trying to rush us out of there. Overall, great food, great choices and I would Recommend!

Ordered (to go) a variety of meals for the family for a special night of celebration. Salmon, pasta, burger, steak, salad and 3 slices of cheesecake. <br><br>For such a big order, everything was ready, hot and correct when we picked up. The gentleman taking to go orders at the bakery was efficient and knowledgeable. He manage to send my order in to have it out for a later 6 pm pickup - called at 5 pm.  He even asked if we wanted bread/butter - Yes please! <br><br>Not only was this order ready, it was by far superior to another Cheesecake Factory location that we have stopped going to. I ordered carne asada medallions and they were cooked a perfect medium  and so tender! I usually never order steak because it&#39;s risky in the quality. <br><br>The cheesecake - what can I say more - yummy! Tuxedo, peanut butter ripple and salted caramel. <br><br>Job well done from start (phone call) to finish (leftovers!) Such a nice change to get quality and portions that we expect from Cheesecake Factory.

Thought we&#39;d try this location after shopping at Washington Square on a Saturday afternoon.<br><br>The restaurant was clean, however wasn&#39;t much seating for the 30 min wait. They were passing out samples of Pumpkin Cheesecake which I loved, and we were called about the given wait time. <br><br>Our waiter was a late 30&#39;s, early 40&#39;s woman which black hair. I wish I could remember her name, because she was phenomenal! Very sweet and attentive to my son, had his food out first, and made sure we were taken care of.<br><br>If you haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory, your missing out. The food is phenomenal and is a great price for the large portions they give. Plus their French bread is my favorite! <br><br>Favorite Dishes:<br>- Chicken Mediera <br>- Habachi Steak<br>- Fish Tacos<br><br>&amp; don&#39;t forget to try Chris&#39;s Outrageous Cheesecake while your there!

FOOD: Good. It&#39;s the kind of food you&#39;d expect from a chain restaurant but better. I do believe that they&#39;re menu is far overwhelming, but I kind of believe that what makes this place so great when you have a group that can&#39;t decide what they want. We ordered an appetizer, a kid&#39;s meal, and my fiancé and I split an entree. We started with the crab bites, which was a small plate, and it really is just a little food. They come out with six, little balls and dipping sauce. It seems more like a personal appetizer, but it was good nonetheless. The kid&#39;s meal was grilled chicken and vegetables, and it was pretty good and looked pretty good for a kid&#39;s meal. My fiancé and I split the adult version of chicken strips, and it came with mashed potatoes and corn succotash, which was all good, too. I would&#39;ve given this place four stars, but I had to take off one for:<br><br>SERVICE: Meh. Our server had absolutely no personality whatsoever. The service was blah. The bare minimum a server would have to do to get a tip. No smile. Monotone. Least amount of words a server could say.

Sidelined by a wait for service at one of the shops in the Washington Square Mall, my mother and I ate dinner at The Cheesecake Factory on a Tuesday afternoon.  The place was decorated like Las Vegas&#39; idea of Egypt&#39;s Valley of the Kings, replete with sphinx faces at the top of the soaring columns throughout the restaurant.  Very colorful and creative and the place is enormous and grand in every respect--a work of art, really from the light fixtures to the copper vinyl seating that matches the copper spiral in your menu.  That comprehensive menu is rivalled in length and scope only by very few.  Very hard to decide.<br><br>As an aside, the restrooms are spotless and smell great, too!<br><br>We were seated right by the kitchen which made the establishment&#39;s high-end service a breeze.  Mom had a hamburger after learning that her first choice--the Madeira Chicken--had a breading that she couldn&#39;t eat.  The staff were very attuned to food allergies--it&#39;s detailed in the menu--and they also recommended that she avoid the french fries because of possible cross-contamination with the oil in which they were fried.  Extremely thoughtful and we both appreciate it!  <br><br>Her burger was juicy and rather large, even with just a lettuce wrap.  The salad she ordered was huge and of a high quality with lots of assorted leafy greens.  As a dedicated beef connoisseur, I had the Steak Diane and it was one of the top five steaks I have ever eaten.  The six surprisingly lean little beef medallions (I ordered them Rare--perfect!) were succulent and worthy of the best five-star steakhouse, with a rich sweet wine reduction loaded with peppercorns and a blend of shitake and crimini mushrooms seasoned with garlic and a small amount of beef tallow to add even more flavor.  Mashed potatoes made from scratch were a masterful side and went great with the sauce.  The Best.  <br><br>My only regret was being too full to have dessert.  <br><br>Next time for certain.

Great location and great restaurant as always. Have been to the Seattle location several times in the past few years and first time trying here in Oregon. Food and service is awesome! Love the cheese cake, steak Diane and pasta here!

I&#39;ve been here twice.  The first time, a friend treated me to the Baja Fish Tacos.  The tacos were fine, nothing exceptional, probably a 3-star rating because the flavor was just sort of blah.  I doctored them up with the salsas that they provided, and that helped, but it was just an adequate meal.<br>Then I had a client in the mall.  I bring my lunch on this sort of trip, and realized that I had forgotten to bring crackers or bread for the soup I had brought for lunch.  Ah!  Cheesecake Factor offers such things.  I marched over there, told the server stand that I worked in the mall (which I did at the time), and asked to buy some crackers or some pieces of bread.  No dice.  I would have to buy an entire baguette from them.  Really?  Even as a courtesy to a fellow mall employee?  I got my sourdough baguette (it was also blah in flavor), and had my lunch soup with salad.  Meh!<br>I often have clients in this mall, but I will do my best to never step foot in that that restaurant again.  I just don&#39;t understand why they have such a huge menu that has mediocre food.

There for birthday , brought our kids food than ours came 45 min later , my steak was cold , and they brought my wife&#39;s wrong dish and hers took another 30 min after that we just canceled it - manager didn&#39;t care ( this is the 4/5 time Cheesecake Factory just blows all over the states

The food is no good. My shrimp and angel hair pasta was very bland, they rushed the noddles, and they are very low with the pasta sauce. My pasta was very dry and lacked seasoning. My daughter got the shrimp scampi , IT WAS BRUNT!!!! My friend ordered the chicken Parmesan, the chicken was also dry and burnt. The only thing that is saving this place is the damn CHEESECAKE!!!!! I will NOT be coming back. I went home and feed the left overs to my dogs.

The service is fine, but for the price the food is rather meh. It tastes like over priced food aimed for my mom&#39;s pallet and the names are such that you don&#39;t realize you are walking into bland city.  <br><br>The beets were cute huge and tasted like more sugar and less vinegar than I typically desire. <br><br>12 dollars for crappy salmon rolled into an egg roll served with mai Thai sauce out of the bottle? No thanks.

We went on a Monday night at about seven and got seated after eight thirty. The service was incredibly slow to the point where we left at ten at night. It also took the servers quit some time to even notice us even though it wasn&#39;t that busy. Other then that the food was very delicious and I&#39;m happy we came. I usually come to Cheesecake Factory and the food was very good so I rate it a three stars. I would very much recommend this restaurant but not if your in a hurry.

The thick Cheesecake Factory&#39;s spiral-bound menu has more pages than War and Peace.<br><br>Decisions, decisions! Copious selections of appetizers, entrees, drinks and desserts leave me dizzy! <br><br>These factory workers must love and never tire of their jobs.<br><br>Nothing resembles a cookie-cutter assembly line here.  As far as restaurant chains go, this one takes the cake.  The cheesecake.<br><br>The robust Chicken BBQ Ranch salad rolls off the conveyor belt loaded with romaine lettuce, avocado, grilled corn and chicken, black beans, cucumber; tossed with moderately spicy ranch dressing then topped with soft yet crunchy deep fried zucchini rings. It is worth its weight in cogs and gears. <br><br>The dessert shift ramps into high gear and must be on double-time.  <br><br>Our entrees find us too full with no room for dessert. At the Cheesecake Factory; a dessert emporium no less, the notion of walking away with no dessert is pretty much an oxymoron. <br><br>Countless choices fill the display cases. As we mull over the cheesecake appendix to the menu, I envision thousands of cheesecakes stacking up on the the factory conveyor belt. We MUST stop the bedlam and choose a slice to go or cheesecake carnage will ensue. <br><br>So many choices!  We select a piece of cheesecake so thick and filled with gobs of milk chocolate, gooey caramel, crunchy peanut butter; topped with about five silos of rich, dense whipped cream, why a dedicated dessert conveyer belt alone must deliver this decadent dessert to our table.<br><br>Sorry Willy Wonka.  This factory stole our hearts.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake too many times to count, and I&#39;ve always ordered the same drink. However this time my drink had no flavor. As I told my server he was consistent on telling me I was wrong and the bartender was the best. I&#39;m utterly confused as to why any waiter would feel so entitled to belittle my complaint? I could understand if I was complaining about undercooked food or something he can visually reprimand. I convinced him to add &#34;extra&#34; orange in it but it was just awful. I couldn&#39;t get him to help me! Not to mention my food came cold. The lady who put it down said &#34;careful it&#39;s hot&#34; but I dug in right away only to find it COLD. Not freezing but it wasn&#39;t the slightest bit warm. I felt like I couldn&#39;t ask them to reheat it. I should also mention I came to this location once before, and had AMAZING service from a female server. I&#39;m debating on if I should ever go back, and just request a female server. I&#39;m not giving up on Cheesecake, but this location should have a talk to their servers about this situation and why it should&#39;ve never happened. I&#39;d feel way better, and I&#39;m sure everyone else who has had a bad experience would too.

I am actually in shock that I have not written a review for you yet Factory of Cheesecake. You see we met years ago when you first opened. Everyone for some reason wanted you so badly they were waiting in line for HOURS. A friend decided to have her birthday at you and were willing to start the wait (even with reservations) for an hour. We arrived after they had been waiting, no joke, for an hour and a half and then we waited, again...no joke, another hour. We waited forever for ok food, crap service and an insane bill at the end. <br><br>I swore I would not go back...until I did...reluctantly. No line...really tasty food and a crazy long menu full of tasty looking suggestions. Ok, warming up... I went back with my husband once and had another wonderful meal.<br><br>After everything though the other night I met Mike. After working 14 hours I was exhausted and hungry and wanted something non-takeout like. So I called and met Mike who was beyond helpful and friendly. You know how most places you call for takeout make you regret calling. I was in shock as to how easy it was. Then I went to pick it up and Mike brought it to my car with a smile. I got home and everything was packed up perfectly - they gave us tons of extra bread and butter, napkins etc which a lot of places don&#39;t do even when you beg them.

Atmosphere amazing, food was great, service lovely, and our waitress was best of all.. Thank you Katherine! ;) Kept checking on us and making sure drinks were filled and everything..best waitress I think I have ever had anywhere in my personal experience and opinion. ;)

Probably more of a miss day at the Cheescake factory. The wait staff made up for the over cooked dry black pepper shrimp (normally my favorite). They were packed when we came in at 8:55 with a 45 minute wait. We decided to sit in the bar instead, which was fine but certainly doesn&#39;t make it as amazing of an experience. I feel like Staff we&#39;re just really busy and not that happy friendly atmosphere I expect though when our food came out they were responsive and fixed it immediately. Will give it another try just not soon.

Decent food, this place is always packed. 30 min wait on a weekday. Their cheesecakes are obv good. Also like their lettuce wraps and Thai coconut chicken curry. Their avocado roll is decent as well as the pasta Napolitano. Their veggie pasta is horrible. Big plates but not so big portion sizes. Overall I&#39;d say 3.5 stars. Service was good.
Had the best fried chicken sandwich I&#39;ve ever eaten from a restaurant. A huge piece of fried chicken with a delicious chipotle mayo. The fries were a little old, but they weren&#39;t the worst.

Lousy seating service for the small happy hour seating. No sign instructing to check in with host, although go to sit they come running to tell you you cant sit unless checked with them. Empty tables all over wth? Thought the price was excellent  for the food choices.  Service from Deb was excellent.. food very good. And the cheesecake selections, WOW just wow so many choices.

I come here not because I&#39;m in a hurry.<br><br>I come here to relax get excellent service for the most part and get decent food.<br><br>For me I love the small plates menu. It has an excellent choice of items that are low calorie for restaurants.<br><br>Personally I love the lettuce wrap tacos Asian style. It&#39;s a lot of food for cheap.<br><br>On the even lighter side the Greek salad and beet and goat cheese salads are pretty tasty.<br><br>Tonight I had Daniel N. For a server and he had a huge table to take care of and I never felt like I had to wait so he deserves recognition for pulling that off.

I&#39;m typically not a fan of chain restaurants but the Cheesecake Factory really hit all the marks. We sampled various appetizers and absolutely loved the Thai lettuce wraps.  Service was quick despite being a busy Friday night.  Drinks were nicely done, the waiter even asked if we wanted specialty liquor in the drinks.  The ambiance was a bit loud, and the decor is over the top, but the menu is extensive, the service was superb and the food was excellent.  What more could you ask for?

This would have been a 5 star if it weren&#39;t for the rude manager. The food was top notch  our waiter was a gem. <br><br>Went there with my family. My husband is disabled and in a wheelchair. She kept glaring at our table. I ask the waiter who she was and why is she staring. We felt very uncomfortable. He told us that we weren&#39;t the first people to complain. She walked behind my husband while he was adjusting his wheelchair and under her breath she said &#34;watch it&#34;.   We left and while in the car I called the corporate office. I truly believe she did not take well to people with disabilities. <br>Our complaint was addressed and took seriously. She then wrote an apology note via snail mail. We are fans and frequent the Honolulu and San Francisco locations.

I hardly think I need to actually review the food here... I am a Cheesecake Factory snob... suffice it to say I drove 2 hours to be able to eat here for my birthday because there isn&#39;t one in Eugene... I used to live in San Diego and visited one at least once a week. <br><br>Here are some food suggestions -- Lemon Chicken Costoletta (sp?), Chicken Madeira, Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps (yes its an appetizer and yes its big enough for an entree), Buffalo Chicken Blasts, Cajun Chicken Littles, Steak Diane, BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad, Boston Salad -- the list actually goes on and on -- but these are some of my favorites!<br><br>So this visit was a bit disappointing ONLY due to the fact that we waited 2 HOURS to get a table.  After driving 2 hours though I wasn&#39;t going to leave (which I believe the hostess secretly wanted actually). It was just too insanely busy though and it was rather disappointing to know that they were severely unorganized at the hostess stand.  Some people waiting near us had been told that they were out of pagers and to return in an hour to see where they were in line.  They came back in an hour and were told their name had already been called -- then after some insistence were told it would be only another 10 minutes and 30 minutes later they were called -- NOT OKAY - <br><br>Once seated, however, service was outstanding!  I love the food and drinks here.  I even took an extra entree home for lunch for the next couple of days.  Just be prepared for quite a wait... <br><br>LOVE this place -- definitely get the bread basket -- you can get it at lunch if you want just ask... dinner they should serve it automatically.  Also try the ranch they make it and it is  FANTASTIC!<br><br>Cheesecake -- well I am not a sweet lover -- but you can&#39;t go wrong with their cheesecake -- really any of them -- I am on a mango key lime kick -- but others have served me well over the years.

Love the food and server was the best ever there. The lady at the desk almost made me leave with her very poor attitude. My lovely wife talked me into staying . the cheese cake recommendation was out of this world.

The wait staff was very nice and accommodating but the food was just really bad. After a long wait,  our food arrived and the smell of one of the dishes was off-putting - we determined it was my wife&#39;s shrimp scampi.  I was looking forward to my steak Diane, unfortunately the mashed potatoes were lukewarm, at best, and my steak just tasted weird. My son&#39;s 4 cheese pasta was also served barely warm and just looked gross after 5 minutes because of the congealed oil/fats. I sent my steak Diane back and was hesitant to try anything else but reluctantly decided on having the spicy cashew chicken with rice. I could only stomach 3 bites and my rice was served cold on this dish as well. <br><br>The only thing I liked was my tiny dinner salad, it was good, and the chocolate cake. Sadly, my family barely ate any of the $77 worth of food we ordered. My son did not want to take his leftover 4 cheese pasta, I ditched my doggy container with the rest of my spicy cashew chicken because it tasted like chemicals. I really cannot believe how poor the food was. Cheesecake Factory has no clue what they&#39;re doing with food, maybe cheesecake, but surely nothing else. <br><br>I would not go back, even for a comped meal.

I used to love this place. I went back for the crispy spicy beef, and they didn&#39;t have it anymore. Actually, you&#39;ll be hard pressed to find anything on their &#34;specialties&#34; that is beef. 23 out of 28 specialties were CHICKEN! Maybe they should rename their restaurant Chicken Factory. We ended up ordering the Cashew chicken. It was good, although hardly had any cashews. And it had so much garlic that&#39;s the only taste in our mouth for the rest of the night. We were disappointed with the menu and food, however, our server (Gabe) was really quick, friendly and fun.

This place is not just cheesecake although that is awesome as well. <br><br>We have to drive a ways to get here since they don&#39;t have one in Portland but it is well worth the drive. <br><br>The inside is huge and has dim lighting which is perfect for a date or really any occasion. <br><br>The food is top notch and the nachos were probably the best I&#39;ve had. The chicken was like actual breast and the cheese was real. My girlfriend always gets the orange chicken. I had a bite and it was great.<br><br>The price can be spendy but that is to be expected with such great food. Overall I thoroughly recommend!

Michaela and Daniel are always amazing when I come in.  They always come thru with the brown bread and are so nice no matter how  busy they are.  I dont come here often but when I do I only sit at they bar because of how great they are.

Curbside is slower than finding a parking spot then going inside ordering waiting and eating in restaurant. Wont be eating or using curb-side anymore. The &#34;dedicated&#34; phone is not a dedicated number. I shouldn&#39;t have<br><br>Update 5/12/2018 my wife wanted some orange chicken to eat. We got togo and decided to goto a park to enjoy the sunshine. No f&#39;ing fork/napkins WTF! Cheeseshyt<br><br>Update 11/23/2018 ordered Steak tacos. Came cold with no chipotle sauces. My experience each time is getting a bit sadder.

Always a horrendous wait because no reservations or call-ahead seating accepted. The restaurant forces customers to sit and wait in its lobby for often 2 hour waits. Why?<br><br>Once you finally get in after your 90-150 minute wait, the food is fantastic.

I&#39;m extremely dissatisfied. We were sat at a table where they could not even fit our food on it ! We felt cramped and uncomfortable. Brought us our cheesecake before the appitizer. Felt rushed never want a miserable experience like this again.

This place has so many workers in there, but those workers are really lazy and slow! Seems like they don&#39;t really care to get the orders going faster. Every time I come here I wait 30 minutes for order to go. They need better workers here, someone who will be more responsible! I work for door dash and I every time I see that Cheesecake Factory is busy I try to stay far away from this place not to get any orders from here. Because every time I get orders from here I&#39;m always late on delivering to people and my rate always falls down because of this place!

Before we walked in we saw customers with the digital callers waiting for a table. Not a good sign. Walked through the restaurant door and 30 plus customers sitting, standing, and waiting to get signed up for a table. We headed straight to the bar hoping for a shorter wait. <br><br>The bar area is quite large with many tables and a long bar that must seat 20. Everything was full  except two chairs on the end of the bar. It was being cleaned off and we did not see anyone waiting. Lucky us. We snatched it up. <br><br>The bartender greeted us right away and asked if we are having cocktails and/or food. We took our time to order food since the menu is quite extensive. It was very difficult to read the menu due to the very dim lighting. We really like the atmosphere. The lighting made it quite intimate  even though the restaurant was packed. I guess this is when one can use their phone for additional lighting in reading the menu. I know my dad would not have been able to read it even with glasses.<br><br>We ordered the bar size Asian salad and the Cuban sandwich with sweet potato fries. My daughter and I share everything. Even with the smaller salad we could not finish it all. We thought the salad had a good combination of chicken and vegetables with some mandarin oranges and dressing. The Cuban sandwich  was on a baguette with a assortment of meats and a few pickles. Very simple, very filling, very large. The sandwich was brought to us with a side salad not the sweet potato fries as we ordered. I was surprised that the server took the salad of the plate in exchange for the fries. Not that we would have room to eat it anyway but most places just leave it and also bring the correct item. We waited for a good 10 minute for the fries. Got charged for them too. 10 minutes was a long time.<br><br>We did not have dessert which I am sure going to The Cheesecake Factory and not having cheesecake is a crime. Maybe next time if we have a lighter lunch. I blame it on the bread and butter they offer after we ordered drinks.

I knew there was a reason I hadn&#39;t been here for ten years. Went to brunch with 3 others. My egg dish was dry, over cooked and flavorless. The rest of my party were equally underwhelmed.<br><br>Guess I&#39;ll wait 20 years this time. Nice server, though.

I was actually really disappointed with my first experience here.<br>The shrimp scampi was recommended to me, since I&#39;m a fan of seafood. It arrived, and the pasta was cold, the breading on the shrimp was soggy, and the sauce was a bit sour. <br>The server brought me mashed potatoes to make up for it. I ate one piece of shrimp, and maybe two bites of pasta. Extremely disappointed. <br>Will not recommend, and will not be coming back.

Took my daughter for a Birthday dinner! There were 6 of us, 4 out of the 6 meals were wrong! My Impossible Burger was impossibly charred to a crisp, one hamburger ordered well done came out Rare the pasta came out with the wrong ingredients in it. The Birthday girls chicken sandwich was ordered with no cheese and yet came out with cheese on it. All of the frozen French fries were still frozen. It&#39;s not like it was fast either 20 tables in the restaurant and still took almost an hour for our food. No thanks

Ordered vegetarian omelet the first bite I got burned potatoes the second bite I got a mouth  of bacon in my veggie omelet they reunited my brunch date with my wife by having an upset stomach all day long  <br>Their cheesecake all have pork gelatin a warning to all the vegetarian, Jewish and Muslim friends out there<br><br>Update:<br>After speaking on the phone with their manager I do stand behind my bad review comment

So when did the cheese cake factory hide the fact that the cheesecake now add Cake to the cheesecake !!!!<br>So damm disappointed.    We got the celebration, lemon raspberry and lemon cello.   Cake inside. <br><br>This is wrong and misleading.  If I wanted cake&#39; I would of made it myself.   Ripoff and misleading

The eggs with Monte Cristo were blah no flavor.  Otherwise it was good.<br><br>Chicken &amp; Waffle Benedict was good but waffles and hollandaise luke warm.  The chicken was hot.  Seems like they could work on everything being the same temperature.  The breakfast potato&#39;s were very good.<br><br>All the being said, the server was very nice and I didn&#39;t mention the things above to him.
I am currently still waiting for our dishes, i shaved this morning but I think a mustache is growing out during this period of waiting for our food and it feels embarrassing
NEVER COME HERE!!! They told us 20 minutes and it was 2 hours. Wishing we left to go to McDonalds and hour ago. The food is definitely not worth the wait, it was actually really disgusting.

Today was not the day for Cheesecake Factory.we were a big party and instead of seating us at open tables we were squished in booth.  <br><br>Service was so slow. Bread was stale. I had to ask for cream and sugar for the coffee. Food was slow to come out and when I asked the response was because we ordered too much food all at once. We ordered a sandwich and 4 appetizers. <br><br>It was not a good impression for our visiting guest so we left without ordering full meals. <br><br>Adding insult to injury, management couldn&#39;t care less.

I love this place !!!!!! Another great chain restaurant steppin up their game ! Fried mac n cheese balls are literally heaven. The guac is fresh and huge chunks of avocado which I LOVE. Happy hour (if you can manage to get a table/bar seat) is so beyond reasonable for the quality of food you get. 4-6 m-f get there early because this place BECOMES A ZOO AFTER 3/3:30pm. Drinks on HH as well are fantastic and reasonably priced. I have yet to eat off the full menu but I&#39;ve gotten almost every single food option off the HH menu and haven&#39;t had one thing I dislike. CHANEL IN THE BAR WAS FANTASTIC ! Thank you for the couple going home and enjoying some cheesecake for you (; your service was awesome specially seeing you just kiiiiilllllll the game like a champ ! Super friendly and awesome at her job, kudos to that gal she deserves a round of applause and then some ! Get it girl !<br><br>THANK YOU !!!

This five star rating is specifically for Victoria. My family dined here the other day since we had a gift card given to us by the manager because our previous meal was less than great. Our lunch on Sunday was delicious and definitely better than our last visit but the experience was 5 stars because of our incredible waitress. She immediately greeted us and brought my two year old her own plate of sliced bananas and bread. It was so thoughtful. She checked on us regularly and was just so kind and authentic. Amazing service!

Tonight was my first time at the Washington Square Cheesecake Factory and it was quite a disappointment. The food was blah and took way too long to arrive. The service was worse than the food. The server never checked on us., despite being seated right next to the waiter station. When the food did arrive it was for only one of us. Finally the second meal arrived and the waiter said,  &#34;The chicken was raw, so they had to recook it.&#34;  That will make you want to bite into your chicken dinner!  The chicken was over cooked this time. Even getting the check was a hassle. On the way out, we decided to use up  the gift card I had and get some cheesecake to go. The cheesecake was delicious, but again, the service sucked. We waited in line and ordered. How long does it take to put the cheesecake you can see in the display case into a box?  Apparently forever. We waited and waited and finally had to ask why people who  came after us had their cheesecake and were long gone. Turned out they put our order back in the fridge!  No apology.  Just here it is. I hope I never receive another gift card to the Cheesecake Factory. What a disappointment.

My favorite sandwich was the Navajo, but is no longer on the menu.  So I was forced to order a Cuban instead.  Was not disappointed.  Haven&#39;t eaten a Cuban since we left Florida for Oregon. Perfect balance of pickle, mustard, cheese, and meats toasted to perfection.  Great service. Friendly and pstient staff.<br>Lovely ambiance.  Overall great return to this family favorite.
You get what you expect. American chain restaurant. A lot to choose from. Excellent desserts

slow service, it took them more than 30 minutes to have our food ready from the time they took our order. the server spilled the lemonade juice I ordered and didn&#39;t bother cleaning it up or replacing the juice. They gave us bread to start with along with the Factory nachos that we ordered for appetizer (5 star for the food) 1 star for the service. 1 of the fork was not properly washed and still have food residue left on it

So disappointed. The Cheesecake Factory used to be one of my favorite places. I would even go there for my birthday for lunch. Tonight, I had a completely different experience. I am giving it two stars because the service was good and our appetizer the fried Mac and cheese was good. Our dinner however left a lot to be desired. My fiancé&#39;s fish and chips tasted like fish sticks you can buy from the freezer aisle and even the fries were coated in salt. I have never seen him leave food behind and he left half of his meal. Then my plate, the shrimp fettuccine. I asked them to sub the chicken with shrimp which they forgot to mention would amount to an additional $9!! The sauce was so bland that after adding salt, pepper, and lots of Parmesan it still tasted awful. The shrimp was the worst part of it all. It literally tasted as if the shrimp was just boiled in water and thrown on top of the pasta. Flavorless and disappointing. I was so mad, I left without dessert and that&#39;s saying something for myself.

Some notes from our two visits to this Cheesecake Factory located at the Washington Square Mall in Tigard, Oregon.  Both times, we ordered at the counter to get cheesecake slices to go.<br><br>1.  Very dark inside.  3 stars for atmosphere.<br><br>2.  Snickers cheesecake was disappointing.  Thought there would be some snickers candy mixed into the cheesecake, but there was not.  There were just some nuts on top and some pieces of snickers bar on top of the cheesecake.  2 stars<br><br>3.  Caramel pecan turtle was delicious 4.5 stars<br><br>4.  Dutch Apple Streusel Cheesecake is delicious 4.5 stars<br><br>5.  White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Cheesecake is yummy 5 stars<br><br>6.  Service at the counter was great the first night.  Not so great the second night.  3 stars for service.<br><br>7.  $7.50 for most slices including the four we tried.  Most of the cheesecakes were so good.  All of them are overpriced!<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory restaurant was not one of the better locations we have experienced for this chain.  3 stars overall.
I ate here on 5-7-18.  The waitress did a great job, quickly waiting on me.  The Burger was okay to good.  Overall, I will come back again but probably order something else.

I&#39;ve been here a number of times and never been a fan so I&#39;ve always ordered a drink since my daughter would drag me here,the last time we went she got food poisoning from the salmon and my sons chicken was so dry we sent it back,the service was ok but not great.Their Cheesecake is amazing but recently they had some false advertising on the radio for half off cheesecake day,I went in to grab some and it was only for dine in..I heard a number of people complaining about it since the place was full,on top of everything they got my order wrong but I was already back home won&#39;t be returning.

My wife and I had the day to spend together and we thought, why not treat ourselves to lunch at the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Service: main reason for less stars.  It was not busy, but yet they made us wait 10 minutes to be seated.  Then seated us right by the kitchen with what sounded like a dish throwing war going on!  We asked to be moved then they put us right in the center completely in the open.  Lol.  It felt like I was eating on stage. <br><br>Food: It was decent.  Portions were small for the price and ratio of food was not right.  Flavor was there though.<br><br>We&#39;d go back, but we&#39;d be more selective as to what we&#39;d order, etc...
Too loud, Very cramped, food was okay and it took them an hour to seat us after they told me 20 minutes.

One word, GROSS! Everyone&#39;s dish at my table was cold and disgusting. I ordered the spicy cashew chicken and it was unbelievably salty and not spicy at all. It took our food a really long time to get to our table. It was especially concerning to watch people seated after us get their food before us. When I asked our server twice about this I was met with, &#34;It is on its way.&#34; To add insult to injury, I was incredibly nauseous about 35 minutes after eating only a few bites. Save your money, your time, and your effort because the food quality is not worth your money.

I have went today to Cheesecake Factory in the Washington square and it was great experience after along time that I didn&#39;t been here. <br>The service was great, that food was delicious and the waitress was very lovely with my nephew!l. I am sure that I will be back again

Very busy. But expected it. Shopped and waited with our pager. The service was average, but the food made up for it. Love the Margarita Pizza. Friends ate light to enjoy a slice of cheese cake for desert. No one went home disappointed. Downgraded due to high ceilings. Difficult to hear conversation. Waitstafe returned only once for water/tea refill. Busy place requirs servers who move with additional stave. Food was good. Took a little longer to get out to us than usual.

Just wanted to pop in and write a review, and I normally only do this when something noteworthy happens. Anyway, when we walked in, the hostess we approached was really friendly, and we were lucky enough to be seated right away (was surprisingly packed for a Monday). Our server was nice and served our drinks quickly, and once we ordered our food, we sat around waiting for a while. I didn&#39;t really notice how long it was, and I didn&#39;t mind too much since I know what it&#39;s like in the service industry. I just figured they were backed up. However, a man, who I believe to be the manager, approached us and apologized for the wait and asked if we needed anything. Although I wasn&#39;t bothered by the amount of time it took to get the food, I really appreciated that gesture! In the end, the food was great, and the cheesecake was delicious as usual. Thanks, guys!

I got the combo shrimp scampi and steak plate for $21 and it only came with 3 bite size pieces of steak and 3 pieces of shrimp with about a measuring cup full of mashed potatoes. Seriously under portioned for just about anyone besides a child. I left hungry needless to say. Also the waiter was unprofessional and argumentative, oddly he walked around with his shirt untucked and his pants below his butt as he waited on tables. Not really impressed by the overall experience. Make sure you don&#39;t order the combo plates if you come here, unless you&#39;re just looking for a snack!

This place was freaking awesome!!!!! Edna our server was actually the best part of the night believe it or not. She was legitimately happy and wanting to make sure our night was perfect. <br><br>The wheat bread they bring out is unreal. <br><br>Come eat here and you will be a happy camper!  Ask for Edna!!!!!!!

This is probably my best experience in any Cheesecake Factory, I literally wanted to kiss the chef! Me and my family was literally loving every bite. Awesome job guys and the waitress Lucy was awesome. Thanks for such lovely food.

Food is probably 4 stars but their service is 2, therefore I&#39;m rating them 3 stars. They are the slowest EVER. Especially if you&#39;re getting a to go order. Typically people order to go because it&#39;s quicker than dining in. But not in this case. I&#39;ve ordered to go 3 times now, and every time for two salads it has taken at least 35 mins. I would understand if they were busy, but whenever I&#39;ve gone in to pick up they don&#39;t look busy at all.

I love coming to Cheesecake Factory it&#39;s really pretty inside. Went on Sunday so it wasn&#39;t busy at all and got seated right away. The menu is huge!!! There&#39;s so many food to choose from. Our server was super friendly and our food came out at a good time, didn&#39;t have to wait too long for our food. The portion was really big but worth the price we paid. The food we got was really good and tasty and flavor just perfectly. Was super full after lunch but we still had room to share a piece of cheesecake. It&#39;s a must to eat a piece of cheesecake when coming here since their know for that. Just like the food menu, the dessert menu for cheesecake is crazy huge too. So many flavors and options of cheesecake to choose from.
The pasta was filled with oil you could fill a glass of it. The hamburger was burned and had a bad oder. The cheese cake we orderd was frozen inside of it. Too expensive for bad bad food. Sorry!

Curbside is slower than finding a parking spot then going inside ordering waiting and eating in restaurant. Wont be eating or using curb-side anymore. The &#34;dedicated&#34; phone is not a dedicated number. I shouldn&#39;t have<br><br>Update 5/12/2018 my wife wanted some orange chicken to eat. We got togo and decided to goto a park to enjoy the sunshine. No f&#39;ing fork/napkins WTF! Cheeseshytfactory!

The greeter gave us a handheld buzzer which would alert us once a table opened for seating.  She said we had about a 20 minute wait.  Once the buzzer went off we went to the greeter to be seated as promised.  Instead of seating us, she told us to stand there at the desk and wait for a waitress.  The area the 3 of us were standing in was a narrow aisle for customers and the wait staff to walk through.  So the whole time we kept moving from side to side and apologizing for being in the way.  After standing there for 10 additional minutes I told her we were tired of waiting and would be leaving to eat somewhere else.  She shrugged her shoulders and started talking to a person that had just recently walked in to review a menu. <br><br>What gives?!!!  Correct me if I&#39;m wrong, but I thought the whole idea of the buzzer ringing was to tell the customer when their table was ready.  Not to have them go from wait-while-sitting to wait-while-standing.  What&#39;s even more ridiculous is that she didn&#39;t care how we felt.  Their business will continue to diminish with service like that.

Came to celebrate my friends birthday ...arrived and was welcomed greatly ...for a group of 7 we received our table fast..... Once seated our server was not great...didn&#39;t seem to care for us or make any conversation. .The place is not even that busy..<br><br>When we told him it was my friends birthday he brought a dessert and said he was not going to embarrass us by singing and still had the decency to charge us for her dessert even though it&#39;s free on your birthday!!  Didn&#39;t wanna embarrass us ...whatever!...plus when speaking to the ladies in front..The lady was just as rude ...not happy..

Our water glasses were dirty, we had to get new ones. The darker colored bread tasted like a brick. It was so hard and old and dry. My cheeseburger was burnt and we had to wait 45 minutes for a burger and a sandwich. So terrible and awful!

Ordered the grilled fish tacos, they came out cold!  Literally cold!  Said something the waiter said that shouldn&#39;t be cold said he would fix, brought back new set and you guessed it two of the four were cold and the others barely warm and the rice and beans both cold! He states I took it off your bill you can keep it!  I don&#39;t want a cold grilled fish and he didn&#39;t even offer to get me anything else he just ignored me the rest of the groups meal!  Poor excuse of service!

We are used to amazing quality and generous portions for dessert in the past here. Ordered the tiramisu to go as usual, but it was half to 1/3 the size and put into a small container. Not sure I will come to get this again.

While I love the food here, I was very irritated yesterday when I put a gift card and cash in the book with my bill and the server used the cash up and gave me the gift card back with $10 left on it. Clearly the gift card was meant to be used up and the cash to pay the small overage. I would have had him re-run the bill but it was super busy and we were all leaving and he&#39;d disappeared. For future reference servers, if you are not clear about what the customers intent is, ask - because now I have a bad taste in my mouth, whereas my shrimp dish should have left a good one.

Always satisfied! And very pleased that I exercised strong willpower to walk right past the raspberry white chocolate cheesecake I adore so much!<br>I always try to plan my shopping trips just before lunchtime and got to malls that have a Cheesecake Factory. <br>Until next time!
I love this place I&#39;m here twice a week . I came today with my boyfriend and we order pizza with some toppings and it&#39;s was so good and fresh

I&#39;ve been to a few Cheesecake Factory locations around the country. I&#39;ve lived in far too many big cities to not have been to a few. At any rate, this one seemed a little sub-par. The wait was ridiculous. I get it if there aren&#39;t any tables, that&#39;s not what I mean. What I mean is, after our one hour wait for a table, we waited more than 40 minutes to get a server to acknowledge that we were there, and another 40 minutes before our food came out. TWO people ordered food that they were &#34;out&#34; of. I&#39;ve always thought that Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu was ridiculous and couldn&#39;t imagine what it takes to be able to offer basically EVERYTHING on their menu. It&#39;s not a problem in other locations, but what are the odds that TWO items aren&#39;t available because of a missing ingredient? INCONCEIVABLE! Or poorly planned/managed. I doubt they&#39;ll ever go out of business because of their location, and the food that we had was amazing - but the whole &#34;experience&#34; of dining was a bust this time.
Superb food and customer service!  I have been coming here for years and I have never had a problem.  I am a very happy repeat customer.

This is a standard American Restaurant. The portions are huge, so definitely share. Appetizers, salads, entrees, doesn&#39;t matter - all are enough for two people!<br><br>I usually only come here for the Cheesecake. It&#39;s the best. So many yummy choices and all of them are delicious. My favorite&#39;s are the Red Velvet, S&#39;mores, and Oreo.<br><br>Expect a wait if you have more than two people, though.

I don&#39;t HATE it here.  I don&#39;t LOVE it here.  I just go here because it&#39;s convenient and needed relief from shopping in the mall plus everyone and their dog knows where it is and lastly,  they can serve everybody something edible.  The atmosphere is expansive and though I gather the CHEESECAKE is the thing to rave about, I don&#39;t want their humongous portions, so I just order off of the small plates menu and forget the cheesecake until they can make a smaller (like 1/5) size.  On the plus side - they have excellent quality wait staff - speedy and professional.<br><br>FYI:  Almost always a wait for seating in bar or dining room.

Is it okay to write a review and critique the patrons next to you rather than the establishment itself?<br><br>Anyway, I popped in after some shopping anxiety.  I wanted a quick ale while I waited for some jeans to be sewn at Nordstrom. <br><br>This place was sooooooo packed, people lined up with their beepers on their lap--waiting for their table to buzz them.<br><br>I got the last seat at the bar.  I was very impressed with the bartenders efficiency, while it was so busy.  I could have easily gotten ignored, bypassed, or overlooked with how busy they were.  I didn&#39;t eat here today, but their menu is enormous and I know they have a good rep.  I think I had happy hour once and it was solid.<br><br>I think the couple next to me might have been on a first date.  This woman wore a wild, but kind of cool jumpsuit with vibrant flowers all around.  Very cool.  The dude was typical Portland, flannel shirt, puffy vest, and my biggest pet peeve a BASEBALL CAP....on a first date, in a semi-nice place.  Good Grief!!??  deal breaker.  Their conversation, I couldn&#39;t help but overhear some of it....was pretty boring, but the gal was getting her drink on!!

Very disappointed today with quality control in the kitchen. My son&#39;s burger was very rare almost raw in places. Kitchen told the waitress that it was because if they put the grill on lower for the chicken so it does not over cook. Instead they under cook the hamburger meat. We also ordered the crab and artichoke dip and the crab was very very fishy. We had to send it back.  Waitress was fantastic and completely understood and spoke to the kitchen two different times. The cheesecake is always the best!!! Hope they work out their quality control in the kitchen.

My fiancé and I came in on a Friday night for a special occasion. Wait was about 40 minutes. We got sat in what I thought was the bar but it was little 2 top tables/booth things. The gentlemen helping us was great. Drinks were never empty and appetizers came out fast. Avocado egg rolls were amazing! After our apps were delivered we were ready to put our order in. The server was patient with us and never did we fill rushed.  I got the cheesesteak with sweet potato fries and It was great. My fiancée got the The chicken Alfredo, it was really good too! We only ate half to save some room for dessert, again the server was extremely patient and gave us plenty of time to make our choices. <br><br>There was a busser working this shift. Holy smokes. Watching him clean a table and set it up was a show in it self. It&#39;s cool to see and experience people passionate about their jobs. <br><br>This was an awesome first experience, I&#39;m excited to try this place again!

The ambience here is classy and sophisticated and you expect the menu prices to be high but it&#39;s very reasonably priced with a great menu selection. My boyfriend and I shared the fried cheese and I got the chicken Riesling. The food was amazing! We had such a pleasant experience and our server was very professional and attentive. He really made our experience an great one too. We ordered cheesecake to go and it was so light and fluffy  I can&#39;t wait to come back here again.

Came here for a birthday dinner. It was all four of our first time here. Waited about 10 minutes for a table. We drooled over the Cheesecake display case while we waited. Menu is HUGE. There is something for everyone,  including my vegan husband. We order and about 30 minutes pass and I notice other tables getting their food before us. No biggie, we were all having fun in our conversations. Our server came over and apologized for the wait for our food, he accidentally forgot to put in my order correctly. Manager came by about 5 minutes later and once again apologized. <br>My husbands food comes out, as well as both my daughters. 5 minutes go by, still no food for me. Manager comes out with my food finally and she has the look of fear in her eyes. She apologies again profusely and tells me that my meal, along with my husbands app would be taken off my bill. I tell her that wasn&#39;t necessary but she insisted. She thanked me for not yelling at her like most people would.<br>Why the 5 star rating?  Accidents happen. Food gets dropped, an order put in wrong, a ticket getting lost...<br>My server kept my iced tea full, our water glasses were never empty, and they were honest about the mess up. My Steak Diane was absolutely worth the wait. Vanilla bean Cheesecake was outstanding! We all enjoyed our food and service.

I have ordered food from the Cheesecake Factory 3 times using Grubhub and each time the order was wrong.  This last time they promised a replacement and 3 hours later it still has not been delivered.  I guess I should have given up after the first time getting incorrect items, but thought maybe after having called the restaurant that they would pay more attention.  My bad.

Dont call in to pick up!! I was put on hold - transferred and put on hold again. 20 min later I was standing in line still on hold, 27 min later I showed the clerk my phone- was told sorry and it would be another 30 min to get order. I was ordering a salad. <br>Asked for manager- she did get my salad out to me in about 15 min, but acted like I was an inconvenience rather than a customer that had been treated badly. <br>My suggestion if you work at Washington Square call and get your salad at Nordstroms!!

You should kinda know what to expect since this is a big ol&#39; chain. It&#39;s &#34;pretty,&#34; it&#39;s overpriced, the food is fine but nothing I&#39;d go out of my way for, and they have really delicious cheesecake. <br><br>My daughter likes this place so I find myself overpaying at this establishment from time to time. The staff can vary not just by day, but by who happens to be delivering something to your table. I&#39;ve had really great service and I&#39;ve had incredibly bad service. It is what it is and I go here knowing what to expect, the bar isn&#39;t set high. <br><br>What I learned in my last visit is that they tend to always try to seat you in the lounge area unless you state a preference. This is a bad idea for you as a diner. The lounge is busy, it&#39;s loud, the tables are tiny, you&#39;re so close to your neighbor you might as well just share food, and almost every time I&#39;ve had a bad service experience it&#39;s been in the lounge. So heed my advice, just sit in the dining room where you don&#39;t feel like a sardine in the middle of the stock exchange (seriously, where do all these food runners come from?? Where do they store them in the back?).<br><br>I&#39;m bumping them from 2-stars to 3 only because the cheesecake is so good and they have so many kinds. So basically they&#39;re 2.5-stars.

I&#39;m not a big reviewer, but I was blown away with our experience here tonight. <br>We had a reservation and were seated right at our requested 5pm. Our server, Mark, was Incredible. He was there in a minute asking about drinks and just trying to make us as comfortable as possible. He kept our drinks full and was very knowledgeable and even let us order for our crazy kids first while we were still trying to decide,  which was awesome and helpful. His waiting was a breath of fresh air for sure! <br>Our food was amazing as well. I&#39;ve never been disappointed with a meal here and tonight was no exception. The cooks were on their game. :)<br>A wonderful night, and I will continue to use every excuse I can to come eat here.
We had a group of South Korean students dying to try a variety of cheesecakes. We were sat fast and served even faster. Our server was extremely gracious and the food was the best of our trip.

This is a fun place to be for any celebrations. Great menu, with lots of options, love this place any time I am there. The down part, they don&#39;t take reservations, so you have to wait, I usually always find a place in the bar with same menu and service! Thank you. :)

Alyssa was very attentive our food took too long and she was very accommodating and Polite. We definitely will be coming back again, the team here looks and presents themselves in extremely solid, friendly and professional manners
Largest menu in the world! :)They have an option for any type of appetite. Legit! Good food! I highly recommend. Also a very good atmosphere for late night dining!

There&#39;s not too much to be said in a Cheesecake Factory review, to be honest. The decor, the overwhelming business and sound, the twenty+ page menu, it&#39;s all very...dependable. <br><br>I&#39;d been to this location in the past and the food wasn&#39;t all that great - it was very clearly frozen. They seemed to have improved, though, as my visit tonight was very enjoyable! <br><br>My guy and I, on a date night using a gift card we received for Christmas, had the avocado eggrolls, a veggie burger with fries, and the falafel salad. All VERY good. I would highly recommend the cucumber lemonade! <br><br>Our waitress was friendly and efficient, keeping us moving through the dining experience quickly but not rudely. We were lucky enough to be seated in a dark corner for our date-night, which really added to the enjoyment. Social anxiety + those awkward tables that are too close together along a long booth DO NOT MIX. <br><br>I typically only make the trek to the only Cheesecake Factory in Oregon when it&#39;s on someone else&#39;s dime, so I&#39;ll definitely be back...next time I receive a gift card!

COULDNT GIVE 0 STARS SO I GAVE ONE. SO disappointed. Got here at 2:45, waiting for a table of 8. Got seated at 5:10, BUT got a small table for AT MOST 6. Ridiculous. We asked for another table, since a bigger one was opening. They said sure &amp; offered us another chair. When we asked about moving tables again, they said we couldnt because we added a chair. Terrible service and management. Go somewhere that accepts reservations. A loyal customer that&#39;s NEVER coming back.

I was very disappointed came in ordered some avocado rolls as an appetizer never even got the appetizers and tell the dinner was ready then upon leaving they couldn&#39;t get the pies ready it took an extremely long time as a waitress needs more training also the lighting was so poor I could barely even see the menu and it was extremely hot in there will never come back as much money as I already spent what a shame

We came here to have a birthday dinner yesterday, it&#39;s our first time here after we had a good experience in the LA restaurant. Yesterday was awful, we ordered pasta and a hamburger, the pasta (Shrimp bistro) was soaked in oil... the shrimps were fried to death. The hamburger had a ridiculously thick layer of melted cheese and was cooked to death as well... we preferred to take the cake and eat it else where and found out they also didn&#39;t include the whipped cream with it. Our first and last visit here ...
The food is good and of course the cheesecake is great. However,  I found the noise level to be incredible.  I came out not wanting to go again just because of that.
Love the Cheesecake Factory! My favorite would have to be the Pasta Carbonara and the carrot cake cheesecake is the BEST.<br>Also, shoutout to the best server, Danielle Perkins!!

Who doesn&#39;t like this place? I&#39;ve been many times but I think on the spendy side, especially if you get booze. DH ordered a couple of Nkasi&#39;s and a burger. I had the SkinnyLicious™ Shrimp Summer Rolls that were Delicate Rice Paper Rolled Around Asparagus, Shitake Mushrooms, Carrots, Rice Noodles, Green Onion, Cilantro and Shrimp - Served Chilled and an order of the  Ahi Carpaccio Thin Slices of Raw Ahi Tuna, Wasabi Pesto which was pretty interesting to say the least. Not quite what I was expecting. <br><br>The salad rolls came on these little puffy rice noodly things that, I&#39;m sure were Ok to eat but they were messy- almost like long rice crispies. I think this  place is complete fluff. In other words is great for the ambiance and area, but way over sold and the value isn&#39;t good here you are getting way less than what you&#39;re paying for. That tuna stuff I had? It was 12 bucks.. you could go broke off the appetizer menu alone. <br><br>On the plus side, it was a great intimate place for me to have lunch with the DH.. had a some great conversation and  this place allows you that. It does afford you that it&#39;s not so loud you can&#39;t hear yourself think.

I love this place most everything is delicious.  I am commenting about the service at the bar.  Today was the last straw. I literally got up and got a table. The bartender was just plain rude!!!  I don&#39;t care how busy you are, you can at least be courteous.  Barking at me, slamming dishes, acting like you are  too damn busy to hand me a menu and water?  Really?   2 nights ago I was in for happy hour. The girls are really sweet, but they are so busy chatting with each other they ignore customers. I Had to ask for water, then a menu then silverware, then a bread plate and finally interrupted them to ask for a drink. Come on!!! This has been going n for a very time and I finally need to say something. I am a regular, and now I&#39;ve gotten to the pint I don&#39;t want to come in. Btw I&#39;ve never had an issue with a server, ever. Hence 3 stars

We come here regularly and it&#39;s always good. It&#39;s usually busy with no room in the lounge, so you almost always have to wait with the buzzer. In the lounge if you find a spot you&#39;re lucky, but that doesn&#39;t include the middle tables and back booth tables so it&#39;s most just the bar stools and a couple side tables. They don&#39;t take reservations. But it&#39;s worth the wait. The menu is huge, many pages long. The waiters have always been nice. The drinks and food are well done. The ambiance works, dimly lit and chandaliers, but a bit noisy because it&#39;s so busy. Their menu offers low calorie options, not sure about gluten free.

The server was really nice and helpful but the drinks took a really long time, the appetizers took long and the food was not fresh tasting. I got the chicken riesling it was really sweet tasting so I added crushed red pepper and it made it better. The bread they served was absolutely delicious. We went there because we had a gift card. I don&#39;t think I will go back again.

Went here soon to close, this is what we got <br><br>Thai lettuce wraps-- so good, order it, it&#39;s worth it. <br><br>Crab and artichoke dip-- it honestly tasted fishy, not crabby, didn&#39;t find any lumps of crab it was mostly artichoke, and I would never order this again. <br><br>Chicken taquitos -- again another miss. Verde didn&#39;t taste like verde, the Pico was old, you can tell right away when the tomatoes don&#39;t have any integrity, mushy, and also if you look at the skin of the tomato it ends up turning white.<br><br>If you go, just get the Thai lettuce wraps. And then you feel bad for saying the crab and artichoke dip and taquitos are not Good. Maybe it was just an off day..... <br><br>Great, happy service, but the food did fall short. Super short.... (Besides the Thai lettuce wraps) <br><br>:(
I love this place !!! They have great staff, amazing food and atmosphere. I also love how the staff goes above and beyond. Not to mention, their Cheesecake and desserts are to die is for!!

Good portion, bit pricy for the quality of food. Slow, indifferent and memory-impaired staff. Unbelievably, latte is served in a tall glass, very funny. Not bad for few hungry souls on Black Friday night, but would never come if any other places near by is open.

Food was yummy.. Our waitress Stephanie was fantastic! Cheesecake...to die for!!<br><br>I&#39;ve never been here before but it was well worth the trip. Being a vegetarian can make it hard when you dine out but they were willing to accommodate our needs.<br><br>Don&#39;t hesitate making a stop here!

Pretty bad customer service. From the front to the general manager who clearly doesn&#39;t care about customer satisfaction. Have been to wayyyy better Cheesecake Factory&#39;s across country and have to say, people are usually pretty nice but not here. Didn&#39;t want to help pack out to go boxes, was asked to &#34;go wait in the lobby until I was called&#34;<br>And food was cold. Wouldn&#39;t come back.

Cheesetake! Our waitress was fine not her fault. Waited for table for 20 minutes with toddler. No problem. Buzzer rang went to counter waited another 5mins. Told someone took our table. Sorry have to wait 10 more minutes. As someone walks in fresh and ask how long the wait is and is told 10 minutes. Ok. I can be patient, wait more and get table. Sorry we don&#39;t have any bread (they usually give you a small bread basket). Ok. I will have a club sandwich. My son children chicken and milk. Wife quesadilla. 5 mins later. Sorry we are all out of club sandwiches. (I have to wonder Is the food still frozen and has not thawed yet or did the refrigerated truck have an accident on its way to deliver the food to the chain restaurant). Order Hamburg. Food arrives. Hamburger and patty is tiny and burnt to a Crisp with about five tiny shreds of lettuce. My wife is wondering if they brought her an appetizer by mistake and my son is burning his mouth on the grease fried batter balls surrounding a small amount of chicken. As for size the kids meal was not much smaller than what we had. I should<br>Add we are Not people who expect or want a pile of food, but we do want food. Milk never arrived. Probably sold out. All this at 7pm. Paid and were relived to get out of the place. In past years this place was ok and fair. I do not go there more than 1-2 times a year, but it has really gone down hill. Can&#39;t believe there is a wait. Not again. This was the worst chain restaurant meal and experience I have had. I will consider our bill a consultation fee on where to go (new din sum restaurant) the next time we are at the mall.<br><br>I

Cheesecake Factory is one of our favorite restaurants between me, my sister, and my mom. The three of us would travel down from Portland OR to Washington Square just to eat at Cheesecake Factory. However the downfall to this is that me and my family tend to visit during their busy hours ( past 7-8 pm on weekends ) which usually have us waiting between 40 minutes or an hour just to get our table for 3 people. Depending if the mall is close or not, my family just buys time by shopping around the mall till the buzzer, buzzes us up. Service quality is quite nice but sometimes we would get a server who&#39;s not really on task. A man once forgot to give us our bread till our main course came out but he was giving other people their breads and helping them but did not bother to check on us and when we asked him to, to-go our cheesecakes he said he already told the front desk to have them in their boxes, but then they ended up bringing the cheesecakes in their plates and not in boxes. <br><br>But besides that one server who wasn&#39;t so great towards me and my family, the others who served us were great and nice. The restaurant serves many different type of food from salad, salmon, pastas, and sandwiches. Their cheesecakes, of course, are greatly made and taste very delicious! You must have one before you go.
I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory several times and have always enjoyed it. The food is good, though a little over priced. And we can&#39;t forget the Cheesecake ... YUMMY!

The Food is always super yummy here! The service is always good! The reason for no five star rating is the loud echoey atmosphere. It&#39;s actually a challenge to have good conversation if you are not in a booth. The seating is off for me here! The miso salmon and avocado egg rolls are excellent! Beyond! I want some now

Food was really good steak was nice cooked well and potatoes were good, calamari was good and was a good portion, cheesecake was really good too service was good as well table was a big cramped up only complaint

Some cheesecake staff forgot my order of whole cheesecake that was supposed to be defrosted by the time i went to pick it up. However, manager tried his best to track it down and when he couldnt, he offered free slices of cake worth the same cost as compensation. Service worth five stars.

When I came here, I experienced some of the best service I&#39;d ever had. The place was incredibly busy, but our drinks were refilled every single time they were emptied. The food came out incredibly quickly, and was delicious. This was amazing to me, especially with it being the most busy I have ever seen it. THE best place to go in Washington Square, and even though the wait may be a while, it&#39;s worth it. Highly recommend! <br><br>TL;DR: The best food you&#39;re going to find inside a mall.

We normally love Cheesecake factory. I am sure our recent experience was an anomaly, but worth writing about. <br><br>We called on Friday and asked about pre-ordering two cheesecakes for pickup late afternoon Saturday. They assured us this would not be a problem, took our name and number ans said they would be ready. <br><br>We showed up as planned the next day and went to the front counter and told them we were there to pick up our order. They scrambled around for about 15 minutes before finally telling us they were out of the key lime cheesecake size we ordered. How can a cheesecake factory be out of cheese cake, especially when it is ordered ahead. They offered to give us half a full sized cheese cake for the same price (it was supposedly more cake than the smaller one we ordered). Fortunately, it wasn&#39;t for a special event (it was for father&#39;s day, but my dad loved it in ANY form). <br><br>I was just disappointed the way they handled the situation (the staff were nice enough). <br><br>Not sure how to avoid this problem in the future. <br><br>For as much as it costs to go to Cheesecake Factory to eat, or even get cheesecake, you would think it would be more organized in how it is run.
One of the best cheeseburgers I have ever had. A bit skimpy on the fries. TERRIFIC service. The cheesecake is quite good, too.

My friend and I stood in line at the bar awaiting a bistro table to open up. The bar seats and bistro tables are available on a first come first served basis.  When one table became available, three people proceeded ahead of us and claimed the table bypassing the waiting line. I approached and asked them to move as we were just giving the patrons their privacy to enjoy their dining experience without someone hovering over them. Our pleas went unanswered.   We were expecting two other friends to join us.  I complained to the manager (Ryan) who seemed empathetic but inexperienced. He said what they did is unethical by jumping the line but since there are no rules, he can&#39;t move them but was going to talk to them. He was suppose to explain to them the unwritten rule of open bar seating but never returned to our table until about 20 minutes to only make the situation worse.  Rather than explaining to the three people the unwritten rule as he promised, he confirmed that the table is theirs because they sat on it first.  At that point, we started moving toward the table he secured for us only to let him know how poorly he handled the situation. We dine weekly at this location but not anymore and not until their management learns how to treat customers fairly.

Always a treat to go to this restaurant. Been working my way through the menu over the past few years and have not had anything that was bad. One of my favorite appetizers are the fried Mac and cheese balls. You must get dessert after dinner. Or just come in for the cheesecake.

We tried The Cheesecake Factor for the first time this evening. <br>We arrived at dinner rush so I expected there to be a wait but not a 90 minute wait. Oh well not a huge deal as it is attached to the mall so we walked around while we waited for time to pass.<br><br>When we were seated they brought our two year old a complimentary plate with bananas and bread on it. I wish more placed did this!<br>Our waiter then came took our drink order, he returned right away with water and a coke but forgot my strawberry lemon-aid and then disappeared for 10 minutes still not bringing it when he came back.  He did eventually bring it but it took much longer than it ever should have even with them being busy. <br>We ordered tomato-basil pizza, shrimp scampi (served with angle hair pasta), and a side of french fries to share. <br><br>The portion of the fries was huge! Three to four people could definitely split this and not feel like they got cheated out of fries. <br><br>The kitchen messed up the pizza and they brought out a tomato-basil flat breas by mistake and just comped us that. This was good, the bread was thin and crisp the edges were not burnt nor were any of the toppings. It was light but better as a shared appetizer than a meal.<br><br>The shrimp scampi was not 100% what I was expecting but it was good. The shrimp was large and was breaded and sautéed, no sauce on it. The pasta had a light garlic cream sauce which was very tasty but more sauce was definitely needed.<br><br>Finally the pizza was brought out. I had them take it back and boxes up to take home so I cannot comment on it.<br><br>Lastly we decided to order a dessert. We chose the Linda (?) cake it was very chocolaty and very rich between the two of us we did not finish half of it, but it was so good.<br><br>So aside from the horribly slow un-attentive waiter we had it was a good first experience.

4* Cheesecake Factory <br>Tigard<br>The food at this chain is consistently good <br>Love their salads and house bread<br>Have to save room for the wonderful desserts<br>Tried the lemon meringue cheesecake it was a killer<br>Nice wines by the glass<br>Good food service<br>Have a happy hour

Ordered three meals and two were horrible.  Cold food mushy cat fish.  It was a long wait and the food was bad.  I never send back food but two of the three meals were gross.  Even the vegetables were not cooked correctly.  This was my first time here.  You know what they say about first impressions.  Obviously very disappointed.  I won&#39;t even be staying for the cheesecake.

It was my birthday and I was determined to have a wonderfully tasting cocktail and a delicious entree from my favorite restaurant. I got there at 7pm and the wait was an hour, after the hour they said another one would be needed. I was getting impatient and finally 2 hours passed. I was talked to by a manager and gave me my birthday dinner for free, with a slice of cheesecake!<br>The waiter we had was on the ball and very happy and made me smile a lot! Overall I had want I wanted and I appreciate the effort of the staff! I can understand how big parties can be frustrating on a Saturday night!  :)

Omg, I have always had a very good experience at until today.<br>To set the stage we were a party of 8, for of which were kids ages 6-10 all hungry.<br><br>1) we where informed that it would be 20 min to be seated, after 45 min we were finally seated.<br><br> 2) we were informed that there was no bread in the restaurant after being seated.
