With 4 hungry kids this is now a melt down after a 45min wait.<br><br>3) the bathroom was disgusting dirty, paper towels on floor and water everywhere.<br><br>4) we ordered the kids drinks to come with the meal. All kids were finished with their meal prior to the drinks arriving.<br> <br>5) I ordered an old fashion cocktail, it was horrid!Tasted like the alcohol used had dirty socks in it. Gross<br><br>6) manager comes over and apologize for lack of bread. . . .  .  And leaves, would have been nice if he would have asked a few more questions.<br><br>I come to the Cheesecake Factory with friends and family for relaxing Meal with no drama. What a failure tonight.

I&#39;m from Arizona and love Cheesecake Factory the orange chicken is one of my favorites and is worth every penny.... there. I&#39;ve been to this location twice now and both times it has been awful and over priced for the sloppy job the kitchen does on the usually yummy recipes. The orange chicken was soggy, small, over battered prices of chicken. We also got the chicken Marsala which at $20 a plate is spendy considering it was essentially a box of bow tie pasta, one chicken breast and a few mushrooms, there was no sauce and no flavor to speak of. Save your money and skip this place for sure! Just get the Cheesecake to go and hit up Panda Express it will cost less and taste better!

We have been going to The Cheesecake Factory a few times a year since they opened. We have always had great service until tonight. We waited forever for our meal and was never checked on. Then a manager came out and apologized for the slow service but we still had to wait another 10 minutes for our food. We were not offered any kind of compensation for our long wait. So very disappointing!!! Plus our food wasn&#39;t even that good!

Great food and excellent service...in the bar. We started out with a 20-30 minute wait for 2 on a Sat night. Got lucky and found a seat at the bar, and settled in with drinks to wait. Beeper started going off about 10 minutes in, so we closed out our tab, and left our seats to be seated in the dining room. Host then told us that it was a mistake, as the batteries were dying in the beeper. He gave us a new one and sent us away with a promise of 15-20 more minutes. We managed to find another seat st the bar after a short wait. We alerted the host that there were 3 two top tables open in the bar, and we&#39;d be happy to sit there. The host told us they were being combined for a larger party. Then, promptly had them cleaned and seated 3 different couples at them. An hour and 10 minutes after we had arrived, our beeper went off again. By then,we had already decided to just eat at the bar, since the bartender, Jessica, was awesome. We took the beeper up and requested a manager. Told her the issues with the host, the timing and the lying to us about all of it. She comped us one drink. Never had such crappy organization and management at a Cheesecake Factory. Pitiful. Go to the bar or go elsewhere would be my recommendation, even though the food was great.

One of the worst dining experiences I&#39;ve ever had. Waited an hour for spaghetti and fried fish. Waiter only checked on us once. Other diners arrived, were seated, ate and left while we were still there waiting for our meal. Food was definitely not worth the wait. Should have canceled our order and gone to the mall food court instead. When we complained about the wait he offered to take a grand total of $6 off our bill. Skip this place and hit the food court instead!

Went only once when it first opened. The waitress pressured me to get the southwest egg rolls (it&#39;s been years but I belive that&#39;s what they were called). I didn&#39;t really want too, but she was very pushy so I figured they must be great. Nope! Full of HOT AVOCADO. I love avocado but it takes a real sick person to eat it hot inside of an egg roll. Couldn&#39;t eat it. The waitress saw that I didn&#39;t eat it and never said a word. She should have asked if I liked her reccomdation that she pushed on me and offered an exchange. I think they were $8. I simply never went back. Pushy service and GROSS food. I felt ripped off.

We had visited another Cheesecake Factory location a few years ago really just because of the hype. It had just opened in our former city and everyone was still in love. We left unimpressed and not in any sort of hurry to visit another location again. <br><br>Fast forward a few years and now my husband won a gift card from work. We&#39;d had it for a while and found ourselves with some unexpected free time, no dinner plans, and near this place. So, pretty much the perfect storm for dining here. <br><br>Oddly enough the wait wasn&#39;t that long. We were quoted 15 minutes, but didn&#39;t wait that long. Our server was lovely and nice. I just can not get over those menus, you know. I&#39;m a fan of a one page menu and these give me some sort of anxiety. I even dissect the organization of sections. The novel-like menu turns me off like you wouldn&#39;t even believe. I seriously lose my appetite. <br><br>The food was &#34;eh&#34;. It was really good, it wasn&#39;t the worst. It just tasted like any other chain that doesn&#39;t really stand out. I couldn&#39;t even remember what I had until I really thought about it. I had some sort of burger, my daughter had some type of pasta and I can&#39;t remember what my son and husband had. The kids had to have one of the cheesecake slices after the meal. I only had a little taste but found it to be too sweet. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory never leaves me feeling like I can&#39;t wait to come back. With so many other dining options available, I suppose the only way I&#39;d go back is with another gift card.
Make time to review the menu because it is gigantic! A really fun place to have dinner. The portion sizes are large enough to share and there is something on the menu for everyone!
So glad I came for lunch today. Breakfast all day long. Bread is fabulous, breakfast potatoes are the best ever. Boxed up half my meal for dinner. Service is outstanding.

Ordered the Bacon Bacon Burger with a few changes to make it epic! Ditched the two cheese options that came with it and instead asked for bleu cheese crumbles!<br><br>Without a doubt, the best Bacon Bleu cheese burger and sweet potato fries I&#39;ve ever had! The topper to this epic meal was my raspberry lemonade. It was just the right amount of tart and sweet with sugar around the rim!<br><br>First time eating here and it&#39;s clear that I&#39;ll be back!

We waited for a long time, our server was mostly silent and didn&#39;t have any warmness, and the food was not worth what we paid. The atmosphere is nice, but we were squished as a 2 top between a 2 and a 4 top and it was apparent that we were not remotely cared about. Even after trying to be nice and communicate we appreciated all the waiter was doing, we got a short thanks and a cold shoulder. We won&#39;t say others haven&#39;t enjoyed it, but we won&#39;t be coming back.

Amazing experience here. Our server Krista G was sooo nice. Arguably one of the best services I&#39;ve had in a while. She hooked us up pretty well, was very welcoming and happily smiling and full of excitement. We came in for lunch, to celebrate my cousin&#39;s birthday. I was feeling a bit down/tired when we got in, but she lightened up the mood with her smiles and happy comments. When we placed our orders and the complimentary bread came in, I expressed my joy for the wheat bread of course, and she noticed it, and got us two more orders of he complimentary bread before came out. Now for the food, I had the southern grilled chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries. The mashes avocado was so much goodness :), oh and the sweet potato fries, heaven; really well cooked and salted. I also got a strawberry smoothie which was really good and refreshing too. Come time for desserts, we mentioned it was my cousin&#39;s birthday and she was like oh nice, they do have complimentary sundaes for people celebrating their birthdays and that they would sing too. And so more servers from the restaurant came in and we all sang cheerfully for him. Such a great experience. We also got some order of cheesecake slices to, and she made sure to pick out the biggest slice for me :). Of course I got the Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar Cheesecake. It&#39;s usually my favorite. Great great experiences at this Cheesecake Factory in Hillsboro. I highly recommend. Ask for Krista too :)

the service at this cheesecake factory location was outstanding.  our server was pleasant and funny and happy and checked in on us 3 times during our stay for lunch. at other cheesecake factories i have been ignored with slow service and servers who were definitely not happy to be at work. one nice thing about chain restaurants is that one can expect consistency in the dishes. i was not  disappointed at this location.<br>my favorite Old Fashioned Burger was delicious as usual with the signature charbroiled flavor and the green salad with house dressing was exactly the same as in seattle and lynnwood and spokane. <br>other favorites at cheesecake factories are the lettuce wraps and the huevos rancheros.

Super mediocre experience and we left asking if we just ate fast food? There was nothing romantic or personalized about this place. Our dinners came out at different times. We probably won&#39;t be back

The food was poor at best. My wife&#39;s order of Marsala chicken was tasteless and incorrect- it came with potatoes and she asked for pasta.  They forgot our appetizer and, once seated -we waited more than 30 minutes just to order.<br><br>I ordered chicken and biscuits.  The chicken was over cooked and dry.  The chicken was pounded so thin ( 2-4 mm thick) it barely resembled meat.! The gravy was tasteless and was slight more viscous than water.  The only other Cheesecake Factory that I have eaten at was in Honolulu and I enjoyed it.  I would never return to this particular location again!

We ate here late. So our waiter was on it. I wish I could say something bad about it, because 5 stars is a lot I know for a chain restaurant. First time eating at a CF, they didn&#39;t have where I&#39;m from. The salad, the roasted mashed potatoes and filet was perfect! Just like I ordered. The filet was literally so tender I could have cut with a fork. Too full for cheesecake. Our waiter was so nice. He asked us if we wanted to take home a couple pieces for all of us to share that they could not sell because they got a little mushed on the corner. My niece and nephew loved it when we got home. I was surprised how good everything was. I mean I&#39;d heard good things but their steak and cheesecake are terrific! There are so many good sounding things to try on the menu that it would take  forever! All the different items would take forever to try.

The cheesecake is good--as it should be since its the speciality. However the food is mediocre. I&#39;m scared to go back after ordering biscuit and gravy chicken meal that was sweet. It was disgusting. I don&#39;t know who wants sweet gravy and biscuits in a savory meal. Puke. The advertisements in the menu are weird too. I&#39;m sure they make enough money. The place is always packed.
Food is good. Super NOISY! Air us not do great n long wait at times even just to order a piece of cheesecake to goz
Food was amazing very nice atmosphere but what stood out the most was the service  desnond has a funny personality and makes you feel welcomed .will definitely come again !

Kudos to the team for handling a very challenging customer this evening! <br><br>This restaurant was busy and quite full on a Saturday evening. I chose to wait for a spot at the bar which ended up being a thirty minute wait. No problem for me, perfect time to do some people watching while my husband shopped in the mall<br>I witnessed a lady get very disgruntled over the fact that some low tables in the bar area opened up and she was told she was not able to sit there. The staff member informed her super politely that these tables were part of the restaurant seating (which there was an hour wait for at this point) not bar seating. In her defense it isn&#39;t super obvious that this is the case while waiting for a spot at the bar. However my personal tactic would be to say okay and continue to wait for what is the bar section to open up. Not this lady! She proceeded to stop most every member of wait staff who walked by and engage other patrons in her frustration. Someone (I&#39;m assuming a manager)came over and with wonderfully disarming body language and polite words she somewhat settled the lady. Fast forward another five minutes to getting a seat at the bar (where I got the distinct honor of sitting next to this gem). She was still berating the employees for the seating policy and all three of the people behind the bar were so respectful to her. She had some challenging requests like a not very sweet MaiTaiand she didn&#39;t like the lighting. I watched a waiter bring her a candle. Mostly the point of this ridiculously long post is to say well done staff! You all showed a lot of kindness and genuine care to someone who wasn&#39;t so easy to handle. I left this experience admiring all of you. Thank you!

This place is so over priced and horribly managed. Spent over 30 mins waiting for 3 slices of cheesecake that was pre sliced. They had so many people just standing around talking not helping out customers. I won&#39;t ever go back here.

After living right by this location for almost two years, we finally dined inside the actual restaurant. We&#39;ve gotten takeout several times and it&#39;s always a nightmare. No matter what time of day you go, there are lines spilling to the door, the wait is long, and just trying to pay and pick up your food can easily take 20 minutes. <br><br>Nonetheless, we felt adventurous and thought perhaps going on a Monday at 5PM might help our chances. Nope. We walked in and stood in line for about 5 minutes to put our names down - 40 minute wait for a table for 4. We didn&#39;t feel like going anywhere else so we stuck with it. My parents went shopping and my husband and I somehow found a spot at the bar. Super friendly and attentive bartenders, and the happy hour menu was enticing just because of the value, but we figured we would wait to have food until being seated. We were seated after about 45 minutes, and were given a nice booth. <br><br>Our server was fine, nothing special. We ordered our food and it came out fairly quickly. Everyone was satisfied with what they ordered. However, my mom ordered the Chicken and Avocado salad, and it came with no avocado. The restaurant was so dark that I used the flashlight on my phone to get lighting so we could see if we were just crazy. No avocado in a salad that has avocado in the title? We thought maybe it was just at the bottom, but no, there was none. Simple mistake. However, when we told our server he looked at us like we were from another planet. He assured us there was avocado in the salad and left. My mom took several bites and there certainly was no avocado in her salad. We got him back over and he looked at us as if we were trying to pull something on him, so he just said he would bring her a side dish of a sliced up avocado. It was a weird exchange. I also had to remind him to bring me my side of fries, twice. I usually order the chicken salad sandwich because it&#39;s just that good, but this time it was bland and missing something. It seemed a bit dry and tasteless so i was disappointed. <br><br>Overall, it was a lackluster experience. I don&#39;t expect much from chains, but everything just seemed a bit disorganized and as if they didn&#39;t really care about their guests. Oh well. Perhaps we&#39;ll stick with the bar next time since they were the friendliest and most attentive?

Great drink selection and appetizers.<br><br>It&#39;s best to go for Happy Hour but we were 30 minutes too early so we got seated right away in the bar. My husband and I shared the french dip sandwich with fries and we also shared the lemon raspberry cheesecake. <br><br>Everything was amazing, but there are way too many choices! It takes forever to decide what you want!

Stuffed mushrooms and Pear Martini are to DIE FOR! OMG!<br><br>It was nice that yes, it was packed on a Tuesday night but we didn&#39;t wait long to get a table.. Althoe we then asked for the next avalibale booth and never herd anything..<br><br>Complimentry bread and butter.. Blue berry mojito and stuffed mushrooms... and the wait.. Lets just say I wasn&#39;t hungry by the time my dinner came..<br><br>I got the Salmon dish on a bed of cous cous w tomatoe, green peas and artichoke w/ pesto or cilantro sauce.. Very good! <br><br>I can wait for a table and wait for food but for that kind of a resturant.. Higher prices etc I did not appreciate sitting aside strangers in a crouded space.<br>Next time I will ask and wait for a booth.<br><br>Pros: There food is amazing! The drinks were very tasty!<br><br>Cons:<br>The wait for food and how packed it is.. Not so fun.. Mm I guess it was a bit dark and the people beside us were purty noisy.. Also our waitress could have done a better job...

I used to be in hog heaven when it came to going to Portland and stopping here to get the cashew chicken, and some cheesecake! My guy tried to warn me that the food has really gone down hill, but I was dreaming of the cashew chicken!  We stopped in yesterday and he was right! The rice was drowning in sauce, and the flavor was just not as heavenly as it used to be. It wasn&#39;t bad, but it surely does not have me begging for more! I will most likely either come back just for drinks and cheesecake but that is about it because the food is about average for the price, and I am a foodie who would rather have a good meal while I am in Portland!

We give it a four because of the dessert...Key Lime Cheesecake.  My husband gave the Jumbalya 3 stars, I&#39;d say 3 stars for the fettuccine Alfredo.  The Alfredo sauce had a good flavor at first, but noted way too much sauce. As it congealed it became thick and inedible.  And I do love Alfredo sauce but I think they need to rework the recipe. <br><br>On the positive side we were seated within a few minutes.  Our server was very friendly and accommodating as were the hosts.  We&#39;ll go back because we like to eat there while shopping at Washington Square. (We&#39;re from Albany)

This had to be one of the worst dinners I&#39;ve had eating out in a sit down restaurant in a long time.<br><br>I ordered the meatloaf entree. The mashed potatoes were barely warm, the green beans flavorless &amp; the meatloaf was burnt on the bottom side! When I mentioned it to our waitress, she tried to offer me new pieces of meatloaf to go or for eating there. When I asked her if there was anything else they could do, then she finally says they can take the meal off the bill! Yes, take the meal off the bill. I&#39;m glad I didn&#39;t have to pay for it.<br><br>My son had a regular hamburger &amp; fries. The fries weren&#39;t hot &amp; the burger was again, burnt. He didn&#39;t complain much thou.<br><br>We don&#39;t live in Portland, so it&#39;s been a few years since we&#39;ve eaten at that particular Cheesecake Factory. I seem to remember that it used to be good. We&#39;ve also eaten @ the one in Seattle also &amp; thought it was good.<br><br>The service was OK, but I was a little disappointed that our waitress didn&#39;t even apologize. Wow. We will not be returning.

I came here with my family last night for dinner, there were 9 of us. It has been at least 2 years since I have been here.<br><br>We ordered a few apps for the table. I had strawberry lemonade-great &amp; the mac and cheese burger-fine. I also ordered a slice of cheesecake to go. My family overall seemed to enjoy their food. They were out of several desserts. The service was as expected.<br><br>This was a really difficult restaurant for a group. It was crowded, loud and the restaurant was dark. Some of my family were using cell phones to light up the menus. This was a problem. <br><br>With the crowds and wait times, I don&#39;t get the hype. Everything was just ok, ambiance below average.
Yum! Big shout out for Deborah  great service, funny lady, she&#39;s the best. I got the spicy chicken chipotle pasta and it was amazing.

l don&#39;t like this restaurant. I ordered a pasta-chicken dish. It included  marinara sauce. The food arrived cold and there was no sauce, just a couple diced tomatoes that tasted like store-bought styrofoam tomatoes.  My wife ordered a complex salad with many ingredients including broccoli, grapes, sliced almonds, avocado. But her salad was all lettuce, with very little of these added ingredients, e.g., a couple tiny cubes of avocado, a couple beat-up broccoli stems, no grapes.  When she complained, the manager pointed at one tiny stub of broccoli and said, &#34;There, I see broccoli!&#34;  Pathetic. You have to beg to get the ingredients that are listed on the menu. And it happens every time.  We&#39;ve been to other CFs, memorably in Burlington, Mass, and that experience is always far better, they are not so damned stingy with ingredients. But not the Tigard CF. This place really sucks.  We&#39;ve given up.

Cheesecake Factory is always such a love/hate relationship. Their food is good don&#39;t get me wrong but there always seem to be consistant issues. <br>Forgotton orders, food poisoning of a co-worker, cold food, etc. <br><br>What brought me back? They have a skinnylicious menu now thank goodness. Their nutrition menu would always make my jaw drop....literally. If you eat here often, don&#39;t look. <br><br>The mexican salad on the skinny menu is quite good but I would ask for salsa or extra dressing. As a person whom doesn&#39;t go for the cheesecake they have a plethora of other options both food and dessert.

I know it&#39;s a chain, but I truly am never disappointed with the cheesecake factory. The bread they bring out is good, there are an unbelievable amount of choices, and the food has never been bad (granted I&#39;m writing this as someone who has only been to about 3 different Cheesecake Factories... and only that many times). The cheesecake is always so fresh and good! My favorite is the key lime. But the red velvet is also amazing! Food wise, I&#39;ve been happy with salads, the shepherds pie, chicken parmesan, and I was super surprised at how great even their nachos were! The only downfall is that they are pretty expensive. As in $15/person, even for salads. And sometimes its crowded and you get stuck at small tables really close to other (chatty) people. But I still love going there!

Jennifer the server dropped my food in front of me while going to box it to go. She promised to have another re made. She came back within 3-4minutes. I said &#34; wow, that was fast&#34; and she said she took someone elses order out of the window... now when my food came out originally it was so hot. I noticed this food was very cool to the touch. I lifted a piece of zucchini and there it was.. my half mushroom from earlier. She had indeed boxed up my food from the floor and waited a few minutes and gave it to me. I confronted her and asked that it be taken off my bill. I told her why. She wasn&#39;t even slightly embarrassed. ??? Gross. Then she had the nerve to ask if I was sure the kitchen couldn&#39;t remame me another. Three times a charm? No Way! I will NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN. YUCK! See photos for my receipt. I had to take a picture because there was not a duplicate given. Shady and Nasty.
I think the food is overrated here honestly but the cheesecake is to die for!!So many different flavors and choices,it&#39;s delicious!

Nothing impressive at this location.. It was a super slow lunch hour and our waitress was super slow. Service was super slow. I saw so many customers who just looked completely annoyed because the waitress never showed up until about 5 minutes after they sat down, unacceptable, especially on a slow day. <br><br>My boyfriend had the french dip sandwich and his bread was super burnt and crispy, very hard to eat. I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and my bread was drenched in grease. I didn&#39;t realize they were going to grill my sandwich bread in butter. I will say the actual chicken salad part was good, but the bread just brought it down. <br><br>I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going back.

Not impressed. No wait getting in midweek. We took our kids in to have lunch, they forgot about us after seating us. Had to get up and ask for service, hadn&#39;t even gotten water yet. Our kids were hungry, and we put their orders in first. Rather than get the kitchen to put the children orders out first on a rush, the kids got served with everyone else. At least we could fend them off with bread. From seating to paying, our dining experience at lunch took 2 hours. The food here is not the best in the world, but it was convenient and we figured we could have a bite before hitting the road after our mall trip. Probably would have been better to go across the parking lot and eat at Red Robin or Noodle Company. Definitely not a two hour dining time for a lunch mall trip. Probably won&#39;t be going back.

Always a pleasure to come into this business. If you don&#39;t mind the chatter, the sound of rustling feet and dishes being places around you. <br><br>None of these bother me, and I&#39;ll tell you why. <br><br>Our food is ALWAYS delicious, hot, well prepared and given with a smile. Our waitress Justine, I believe, was by far the kindest. We watched her bust her rear to get everyone food, drinks and refills. <br><br>I don&#39;t mind the little wait we had because of such a pleasant informative waitress. <br><br>You will be seeing me here again.

Parking is horrible trying to find a space to go into restaurant. our waiter seemed more attentive to the bigger tables or tables that he assumed he was going to get bigger tip you should really not go on appearances because he was going to get a big tip I guess he assumed he was going to get a bigger tip with them. he wasn&#39;t even prepared to take our order he said hold on he had to go get his ordering pamphlet. Next I said medium well on my steak and it came back it was so raw that it was actually cold inside it was just blood everywhere and the green beans were to raw they needed  to cook them just a little longer gets a slight crisp and my steak had no seasoning on it whatsoever when I told him that that my steak was wrong it was medium rare not medium well he apologized took it back and when he brought it back it was so long that I said just pack it up there was no seasoning on it at all like they wiped it off it was a bland steak still tender though and he said I&#39;m sorry so I ate 1/4 of a steak that was a $28 meal. He didn&#39;t offer to take anything off at all a manager just happen to be going by asking how everything was and when the manager came I told him everything that happened and he to take off one of the cheesecakes at seven dollars my meal was One of the more most expensive meals and I got to eat 1/4 he sure only charged me 1/4(15%). I know this meal inside and out because this is the only meal I get when we go to the cheesecake factory though we always went to the one in Glendale California they use brown butter for the green beans and awesome crushed black pepper but here it was raw and maybe had olive oil on it or something totally night and day all though the portions were a little bigger at this location in Oregon but still I know this meal inside and out and I know how it should&#39;ve been prepared with more care.

Came in on July 22, 2018 around 4pm and I ordered the &#34;Chicken Riesling&#34; &amp; it was my biggest mistake !! An hour later after I left cheesecake I was having nausea &amp; stomach pain, and the pain continued until 2Am which was the time I ended up falling asleep from the stomach pain discomfort. I&#39;m very disappointed !! What&#39;s the point of having a big menu and serving mediocre food !!! Disgusting, my food looked like dog stew straight out of a can !! Cheesecake should give me a money refund for getting me sick!!!!! Never eating there again .

This location opened quite a few years ago and I&#39;ve only been there three times. I&#39;ll tell you why...and I was reminded AGAIN, why tonight....THE WAIT. Are you kidding me? I waited 1 hour and 15 minutes for a table that they told me would take 40 minutes. I had two little kids with me and by the time we got a table we were cranky and starving. While waiting, I could see several tables open. So I ask, if you are ALWAYS crowded then get more staff to wait on tables rather than leaving tables open for us to stare at while we are waiting. To top it off, the food is not worth the price. I swear, I am NEVER going to this restaurant again (for real this time).<br>PS: An apology (sorry for the wait!) would help...but you never hear that from any of the wait staff.

My family and I have been going here for years and the last two times we have gone here (today being one of them) and none of us were at all impressed. The service was fine but the food was terrible. I ordered the orange chicken (that I&#39;ve been ordering for years) and it came out looking soggy and old and had some sauce on it that wasn&#39;t normal for orange chicken. It literally looked like they scraped the leftovers from someone else&#39;s plate earlier that afternoon and put them on my plate. I gave it a shot and tried to two pieces of the chicken and I ended up sending it back. My boyfriend ordered a breakfast sandwich with potatoes on the side and his potatoes were old and overdone and his sandwich was soggy. My mom ordered a Cobb salad and it didn&#39;t even come with any avocado (if you eat these, you know it&#39;s a crucial part of that salad). Last time I was there a few months ago, I ordered a burger well done and it was basically raw when I bit into it so I ended up sending it back. Bottom line is, until they step up their food quality, especially considering the cost of the meals at this restaurant, I would not recommend the Cheesecake Factory at Washington Square to anyone. My family and I will not be returning.

Made a quick stop at Washington square for lunch. Lunch was okay but our server was great. After I left my cc went back about an hour later to get my cRd and they couldn&#39;t find it. The manager apparently had to leave and took my card. After waiting 45 minutes I finally got my card back and a piece of cheese cake by default. I was less than impressed with the food usually much better.   Not the best experience from what I expect!

I feel bad for the wait staff having to serve the sub par food at this establishment. This was my second time to this location this year resulting in the same opinion of the food. Although my 1st visit did not receive a review, this one does. <br>My food came out warm(ish) and acceptable however my guest was not as lucky. Her tacos were ice cold and the (semi-soft) tortillas were cold and brittle. Sending the order back resulted in a 15 minute wait and an awkward eating arrangement as I had a plate and she did not. The replacement order of chicken tacos were slightly better and appeared fresher. However the portions of chicken in each was poultry. (Pun intended). If these are predetermined portions, someone needs a raise because they are saving The C.F. a ton in food costs. The meal was terrible!<br>The manager on duty stopped by to offer his apologies and acknowledged that the replacement order was taking an inordinate amount of time as did our embarrassed server. <br>OK, here&#39;s the kicker.....$65.00 meal, cold food, measly portions and one returned entree. Not one item was comp&#39;d, not a slice of cheesecake, glass of wine, beer.....nothing! I don&#39;t enjoy complaining or sending an item back and certainly don&#39;t make a habit of it but when I do I expect some form of compensation for the ineptitude of the kitchen staff. There are too many excellent places to eat in this town to have to suffer this places poor form again.<br>The Cheesecake Factory should be ashamed of requiring their servers to present food like that! I doubt that I will return and hope that readers of this review choose other quality places around there like Nordstrom Cafe, Thirsty Lion or even Orange Julius for that matter. <br>Thanks for reading.

Been a big fan of cheesecake factory. The portions are a good size and the food is excellent. The atmosphere is casual. And if you love cheese cake there&#39;s no better place. Today I had Thai lettuce wraps, and my husband had the salmon on the lunch menu.

Beautiful design and wall paper .very clean and <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwelcoming.do&amp;s=bf60cf9a6663944c5d9c0c352074bdbea575b8beaeb014a50cf0ab4afe230019" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">welcoming.do</a> not like the seating I think it should be up to the customer if they want beer seating or private seating. Having a date night sitting side by side like 4 couples I&#39;d not a romantic type evening we expected..<br>Besides that customer service was amazing and very friendly and helpful and taste amazing..<br><br>Didn&#39;t like the strawberry shortcake with ice cream dessert was not out taste.but looked wonderful.<br>Had to send that back.<br>Cheesecake was very amazing and enjoyed it.<br>I day for a couple spending 53$ for dinner and desert and drinks is an amazing way to spend an evening priced very well and big portions worth your money and wait

We love eating at the Cheesecake Factory--the food is delicious, although terribly inconsistent, but the service--and in particular, the FOOD DELIVERY time is a HUGE deterrent!  I timed our dinner tonight:  we waited 40 minutes to be seated, 8 minutes to give a drink order, another 7 minutes to receive our tea and sodas. We had placed an appetizer order with the drink order--fried zucchini--it took over *20 minutes* to arrive at our table, and it came AFTER my salad, which I had not ordered until we ordered our entrees!  Our entrees took **40 minutes** from the time we ordered them to reach our table!  And THAT is why this restaurant is always on a ridiculous wait!  Then after our meal we ordered cheesecake to go--another 20 minutes wait!  Insane!  It took 2.5 HOURS for us to have a simple dinner!  Something is terribly wrong with the management at this restaurant!  We have lived all over the country and have eaten at the Cheesecake Factory in every location. And I must say, the Tigard, OR, restaurant is in dire straights and falls well below the standards they have set throughout Texas and New York!  I sure hope someone in corporate sees this review and pays attention and send somebody out to straighten out this restaurant. It sure would be a shame if we had to quit going there because of the horrible time investment it required due to mismanagement.

I ordered 3 meals for curbside service for my daughter&#39;s birthday dinner.  She ordered a Barbeque Ranch Chicken Salad.  It was supposed to include sliced cucumbers.  When I got home we discovered that they had omitted these. We called the restaurant and spoke to the manager. He offered to give us cucumbers if we picked them up (30 min. trip).  We asked if he could give us an allowance or rebate on our next order.  He replied that they would get it right next time.  There will be no next time.  The curbside service is prompt and good. The customer service is not.  This establishment is highly over rated and over priced.  I will not be going back and will share this with everyone I know.  <br>Not So Fondly,  James M. Hesla, DMD  Beaverton, Oregon.

Pros:<br>1. Best place to eat at WA Square<br>2. Consistent quality and service<br>3. Large menu <br>4. Comfortable seating<br>5. Provides kids with complimentary app&#39;s (diced fruit, bread, veggies, etc).  Great way to keep them occupied<br><br>Cons:<br>1. Long, long, long wait<br>2. Crowded<br>3. You&#39;re eating in a mall
Consistently good.  Great service even though it&#39;s always crowded.  My go-to meal here is the garlic butter noodle accompanied by a virgin... long pause... okay...  pina colada.

Loved the place until I found out their Cheesecakes aren&#39;t vegetarian and neither is their mac and cheese. I&#39;ve been at least 4 times and ordered the same thing, the macaroni and cheese burger sub a veggie patty. The server said that she could do that, but that the macaroni and cheese balls contain meat broth as well as the cheese sauce that they put on it, so I may not want to eat it if I was a vegetarian. I am a vegetarian and I was incredibly upset that I hadn&#39;t been told the previous 4 times I had ordered this same meal. If you add meat to something that is generally meat-free, it should be noted on the menu and your staff should make it known to people who are specifically ordering their meals to be vegetarian. My boyfriend and I ordered an appetizer while I looked for something else, but I wasn&#39;t really in the mood to eat there after that. I started looking at the desserts so we could get something to go. Our waitress noticed and informed me that the cheesecakes are made with animal based gelatin, which is completely unnecessary. Not only is there plant-based gelatin, but as a baker, I have made cheesecakes that didn&#39;t require gelatin and were the same rich consistency.<br><br>TL;DR - Staff should make people aware of meat that is in dishes that are typically vegetarian, especially if the customer is altering the meal to replace meat with a veggie patty. I am incredibly upset that 4 servers didn&#39;t do so.

My Wife and I had the herb crusted salmon salad, it was the worst salmon i have ever had.  It appeared to be some farm raised bland no flavor variety. Would not recommend that dish.  The service was very good, and quick even though it was very busy the day after Valentines.   Overall pretty disappointed for waiting an hour and 40 minutes for really bad salmon.  Ultimate margaritas were very good though!<br>Seating arrangements led me to feel a little like a sardine.  We were in s hurry to make a 9:15 movie so the fast service was appreciated, although in hindsight it now appears we were being rushed, likely to increase turnover on tables.  Will not go back if spending my own money!

It&#39;s really awesome there. I enjoyed spending my time with my family there. The people who work there are so nice and just so nice to be around. They made sure we liked everything. And especially the food. It was delicious. It was the best thing I tasted in my life. I recommend it to anyone.
Kearra was great tonight for my family 12. On a super busy Saturday night with a large family  you know you&#39;re going to have a long wait. But once we were at our table she really took care of us.

If you read my reviews, you can see I&#39;m a foodie with a distinguished palate.  I have a 90dB hearing loss which heightens my other senses.  But, I&#39;ll be the first one to say that a dining experience isn&#39;t just how the food/drinks taste and smell.  So tonight I have the pleasure of writing a recommendation for a restaurant that I&#39;ve enjoyed many times, but mainly for the quality of service:<br><br>I have a 17 year old daughter with IBS. If she eats gluten, dairy or a small list of &#34;FODA&#34; forbidden foods she will be sick for SIX WEEKS. Yes, imagine your child crying and in pain for six weeks for one bite of the wrong stuff -- this is our life.  My wife took our daughter out for a special mother-daughter shopping night at the mall, and they decided to try to eat at Cheesecake Factory,  My wife came home praising her experience!  Two managers, Daniel and Cathy (sp?), sat in the booth discussing the menu and my daughter&#39;s allergies, to insure she would get a safe meal.  The chef apparently did their best to use separate equipment etc.  The waitress was extremely understanding and communicative.  My wife could not be more impressed. We used to love this place just for their happy hour and the experience my wife and I would have on our own, now we&#39;re just amazed at how supportive and caring the restaurant staff is.<br><br>P.S. my food and service has always been good here -- obviously you&#39;re not getting fine dining, but very good food and prices and selection. I personally love the hot dog happy hour option, served on mini wood cutting board.

This was awful. Genuinely and honestly awful. the service was pretty good our waiter was friendly and prompt. The space was over crowded and loud. The food was simply bad. I got fish and chips a simple meal should be relatively edible everywhere. Not here. It was over cooked I&#39;m pretty sure it wasn&#39;t seasoned. The tartar sauce was pretty much just mayonnaise. The fries were good but honestly if you can&#39;t make decent fries you shouldn&#39;t be allowed near kitchens. This was terrible experience. I will never and I mean never return can&#39;t believe we spent so much money on that swill.
The shrimp scampi with steak Dianne combination doesn&#39;t come with pasta. So, there&#39;s 3 small steaks on your plate with 3 breaded fried shrimp Mash potatoes.
I can&#39;t imagine life without cheesecake! :)

What can you say about a successful chain of restaurants that serve pretty darn good food and an amazing selection of desserts with a heavy emphasis on the cheesecake variety in an atmosphere that always seems to be up to date with above average service?   <br><br>On the rare times that I go I say, Yay! I&#39;m a fan!<br><br>Things we like to eat at CCF:<br><br>Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta<br>BBQ Chicken Salad<br>Chinese Chicken Salad<br>Romano Crusted Chicken (my personal fave)<br>Corn Fritters (tried for the first time tonight and decided I could definitely eat them again, and again, and again...)<br>Avocado egg rolls<br>Mashed Potatoes<br><br>Cheesecake of choice: Adams Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple or Godiva Choc.

We came just for the Cheesecake. Never been to any cheesecake factory before. Service was good, I think our server was Greg, but not sure. I got the raspberry lemon, my boyfriend got the salted caramel.  Both were AMAZING! Not to sweet.  This was 2 days ago, and I&#39;m still thinking about it.  We will stop here every time on our way to the coast. They&#39;re food looked really good too, hoping to stop in for lunch one of these days... and if it&#39;s as good as it looks, I&#39;m hoping to up my review to 5 stars.
Kale salad and the dressing it came with tasted amazing!
Thanks to this companies refusal to serve law enforcement, they lost my business.

How people can come here, receive mediocre food, and pay upwards of $70 each time is beyond me. I ordered the loaded potato bites and the first bite was ok, and the second was still completely frozen in the middle, which is exactly what you&#39;d want from a $7 appetizer. Any self respecting restaurant probably shouldn&#39;t sell food that was once frozen, and the only step afterwards if throwing it into a fryer. I&#39;m sure I could buy an entire box of these at Fred Meyer for $5. I had also ordered a cappuccino. The best cappuccino I&#39;ve had was actually at Powell&#39;s and this cappuccino was it&#39;s evil twin brother. You know when the cappuccino is so bad, it just looks like a translucent gray-brown color? like the color of eraser shavings. oh and the chicken Alfredo with chicken and broccoli was $22 f***ing dollars. And wtf is up with their theme? like seriously what is it? fake water stains on the walls, Egyptian like face sculptures, Disney ride-esque painting designs on the pillars, and high vaulted ceilings? It also looks like they bought their drinking cups in mass quantities at the dollar tree. They&#39;re knock off, plastic beer stein cups that they made sure to scuff up before serving them.

The Cheesecake Factory is always good. Their lunch specials are reasonable and are usually a large portion. I&#39;ve been to this location 5 or 6 times and it&#39;s been good every time and the waitstaff is always great. <br><br>I do think $8 for a glass of house white wine at lunch time is ridiculous.

I only leave one star reviews for dishonest businesses or absolutely horrible experiences - this one is for the latter.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake factory location a few times, and have been underwhelmed each time.  But my visit last night takes the cake, no pun intended.  <br><br>Before I get to last night, I&#39;ve been to quite a number of Cheesecake factory locations and this one by far is the worst I&#39;ve been to.  For starters, they seem to have somehow packed in way more seats than they should have - you&#39;re literally bumping elbows with the people sitting next to you.  Not pleasant.  Next, in my opinion, the food at this location is not as good as the other CF&#39;s I&#39;ve visited. <br><br>So last night, I happen to be close to this location and for some reason decide to stop here for a meal.  I go up to the reception area, told that it&#39;s a 10-15 minute wait, say that&#39;s fine, handed a pager, and I have a seat and wait.  Pager goes off, ushered over to my table (which is about the right size for an elf) yet the table hasn&#39;t even been cleaned yet.  So I patiently wait until it&#39;s cleaned and sit down.  No menu, so as soon as my server comes over, I kindly ask for a menu.  She then has the audacity to ask me where I came from and did I come from up-front - clearly implying by her words and tone that I had somehow cut in front of everyone else waiting and just plopped down at this table. I&#39;m thinking really? did this person really just ask me that question?<br><br>Given the elbow to elbow seating, I waited for the people sitting next to me to leave before I spoke to my server - as I didn&#39;t want to embarrass her in front of those people.  Yeah, I had a little more respect for her then she had for me. So the people next to me leave, and I tell her how inappropriate it was to tell a customer that, clearly implying they&#39;re some dishonest schmuck who can&#39;t wait in a line.  She goes on to say something along the lines of &#34;well we have a problem with that&#34; - people just sitting down apparently.  And how that&#39;s my problem, I&#39;ve yet to understand.  Total lack of accountability and I think my telling her this sailed right over her head.  If this location has a problem with people sitting down at tables, perhaps they should look into fixing their seating issues, but treating customers like criminals is totally inexcusable. <br><br>Needless to say I won&#39;t be going back to this establishment again.  Even despite this unfortunate event, this particular Cheesecake factory isn&#39;t worth waiting in line 30 seconds for.  <br><br>PS: The manager, at least it seemed to be the manager, was going from table to table like some Disneyland automaton asking each person the exact same canned question if they were enjoying their &#34;experience&#34; or something along those lines - with as much genuine interest as some Washington DC politician.  He didn&#39;t even seem to pause long enough to hear someone&#39;s answer :) Priceless. No wonder this place is running like it is.

Came in about 3:15 PM to dine @ this location- it was still very busy during that time frame. <br>We were greeted promptly &amp; received our beeper and were told we would have a 15 minute wait. We went to the restroom, came back out to sit in the waiting area and a hostess came over and directed us to an open table at the bar. Our wait time was then less than the 15 minute that was our estimated time!<br>Anastasia was our server and she was a-tentative to our every need.<br>Had the Louisiana Chicken Pasta (didn&#39;t realize it was a &#34;bow tie&#34;pasta ) and when it came; I asked to have it with the fettuccini pasta and they made that accommodation happen for me. When they brought it out, placed in on the table: the portion size was HUGE and a very generous amount of the Parmesan Crusted Chicken Breasts.<br>In our party of 3- We also ordered the Catfish which was amazing and the Chicken Chipotle Pasta which had wonderful flavor and tasty. It&#39;s served a top a Penne Pasta.<br>We ended our meal with the fabulous White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake that is just Devine!<br>Pricey, but great meal and great service.<br>Treat yourself to the Cheesecake Factory when you can afford it. It&#39;s a wonderful experience and the wide variety they offer a unique and colorful menu to choose from!

Fun atmosphere, nice waitstaff. I have been getting the fish tacos for years. They changed the item and they now are 4 mini tacos instead of 4 normal size tacos. So you are getting less than 1/2 the amount of fish and toppings for the same price. The rice was hard and crunchy. This was 8 pm on a Tuesday night, next time I&#39;m just going to Chipotle.

I got a referred by a homeless man in Seattle.<br><br>My wife and I have eaten at three different cheesecake factories in three different states. They food and serves was first-rate. They get really busy during dinner but worth the wait. The menu is very extensive and will make anyone happy. My favorite is the Steak Diane and my wife&#39;s is the Four Cheese Pasta with chicken. We try to make it out a few times a year. I haven&#39;t had the cheesecake but I heard it was wonderful!

Always had pretty good service here even though the wait time could be a little longer in the weekends. Service is pretty fast and attentive. They get the warm bread to your table in a few minutes and i am a fan of their brown bread. The menu is huge and you have to spend quite sometime to figure out what you are going to have. I have tried a couple of dishes over the past few visits and liked most of them. <br><br>Some dishes i liked here: Chicken Samosas, Chicken lettuce wrap tacos, Texmex egg rolls, Pizzas are all great. Chicken sandwiches were good and also the breakfast omlettes are very nice. <br><br>Overall a very good place with good service and ambience thats not too expensive and has wide menu options. Not to forget the cheesecake here.

First time going to Cheesecake Factory. It was on my birthday. The wait sucked because we were starving, but felt pretty fast. The food was great! The cheesecake was even better! I would recommend this place.

Was hoping to eat here for my twin daughters&#39; birthdays and could not get our party of 8 in unless we wanted to wait 2 hours. Tried to split our party up but even for a party of four the wait would have been 1 hr 10 min. We arrived at 730 pm. Decided to just take out a cheesecake and eat elsewhere. We have eaten here in the past and the food has been great.

We went here because we had a gift card from Christmas (we got a PetSmart card too, despite being anti-PetSmart, so go figure). It was a long day at work so we figured we would use the card and have a nice 15,000 calorie dinner (this is not an exaggeration).<br><br>We get there around 5:40 on a Friday and it&#39;s packed. The place is fairly large and has twice as many tables than would be comfortable and there&#39;s still a huge line. We get the pager and learn it&#39;s an hour wait. Cue wandering around the mall...<br><br>We ordered the buffalo blasts as an appetizer. I have no idea what we expected. It&#39;s basically a chicken and cheese pot sticker that you dip in buffalo sauce. On my first bite I immediately noted that the aftertaste is similar to the taste you get when you throw up in your mouth. I wish I was kidding. <br><br>I got the spicy cashew chicken as an entree which was entirely underwhelming. It was much more sweet and didn&#39;t even hint at being spicy. I&#39;m a big spice fan so I expect a lack of heat, but come on. At least make an attempt! The rice was plain brown rice, not even jasmine. Womp womp.<br><br>My boyfriend got the fish tacos which mostly like tasted like the lime he out on them. I had a piece of fish (tilapia, I believe) and could only taste the lime-- pretty strange concept. Of course, tilapia is always a mild taste but a disappointing choice for tacos. <br><br>We figured things couldn&#39;t get worse so we decided to shoot for the 1,000,000 calorie mark with the Reese&#39;s cheesecake. Definitely the best part of the meal, but that bar wasn&#39;t too high. <br><br>We had the leftovers boxed up and realized once we got to the car that we forgot them. That was the silver lining of the whole experience.<br><br>+1 star for the server being quick, +1/2 for the cheesecake, +1/2 for the guy who could set tables in roughly .4 seconds

Wrong dishe delivered and salmon we ordered  didn&#39;t well cook. When our meal was redone I can&#39;t find my mesh potato. They send us a cake as apology but we don&#39;t feel good for overall dinner. So I give them 3 star this time.

My husband and I went in last night without our kids &#34;date night&#34; we ordered 2 apps and 2 dinners my husband&#39;s bacon burger and mine cheeses stake sadwich. My husband&#39;s burger was raw he ordered it well done. His dinner came out and I ate all mine. We waited and waited and no hamburger came out. So we asked for our check and left. We hold this restaurant to a high r standard, and we are shocked that he never received his dinner.
Come by and enjoy a huge selection of food! Great place to eat out when you&#39;re in the area. Would suggest it!

Even though this place is so very &#34;chain&#34;, I used to love it. USED to, that is. The food is truly mediocre at best, and worth noting that each dish is seriously 234234 calories. They do have a large, extensive menu and they seem to be known for their large portions, but what good is that if it&#39;s not even that good? <br><br>This location in a mall does nothing for their ambiance and last time I was here they totally screwed up my order. Pretty upsetting when my party was waiting unusually long for our meal to begin with, they gave me the wrong dish, and then made it again, which took so, so long. I finally just asked them to package it to go. To make matters worse, it was almost more irritating when the manager comes to our table to apologize, nice gesture, but I just wanted it fixed in a timely matter and not once did he offer to compensate the meal which would have been nice given this particular incident.

This place is great for a &#34;get together&#34;.  Love the shopping in the mall...<br>And the place is always clean.  Food is fresh,  have never received a bad meal.  Good drink selection.  If you can&#39;t fit in the cheesecake get it to go!

Last time I was here I was given the wrong cheesecake in a take out order... when I called to confirm that I could come back and get the right one I was told &#34;that shouldn&#39;t be a big deal&#34;. After a 20 min drive back I was then told by a &#34;new guy&#34; at the takeout / dessert counter that they had been out of the cheesecake I wanted since the afternoon and thats why I was probably given the &#34;other&#34; cheesecake instead of the one that I wanted... REALLY FOLKS DON&#39;T EVEN GIVE ME THE CHOICE JUST BILL ME AND SEND ME ON MY WAY WITH THE WRONG THING... come on...
Very slow service. Alfredo came out way over cooked. And I waited ten min to tell the lady I didn&#39;t want it anymore. Wish my service was great like the last time I was there.
Haven&#39;t been here for years. Amazing the service and food is just the same. Atmosphere super!!

OH MY GOD, never have I ever had such a great experience with cheesecake. The place the mood the lighting all of It was amazing. And the cheesecake oh my god... I&#39;ve never been salivating the arrival of a piece of cake before like I have at the Cheesecake Factory. I would recommend this place 1000%
Always delicious food and huge portions.  Only drawback is the wait time.  But they are usually busy so it comes with the territory.

Usually my family likes to come here for dinner, but this time we decided to order a whole cheesecake for my dad&#39;s birthday. It was our first time ordering a cake from here and it certainly will be the last. <br><br>I ordered a 10&#34; Tiramisu cheesecake with a chocolate plaque TWO DAYS before the pick up day. Went in at 8pm like I said I would and waited for 30 minute to find out they had no cheesecake ready for me, only the chocolate plaque. The lady at the front apologized but did not give me a reason why the cake wasn&#39;t ready when I asked. I was already late and short on time, so I ended up buying the 7&#34; cake since she told me they had one ready. I also told her I needed one ready-to-serve. Opened it up at the party to find it frozen. This is the first time I&#39;ve been so upset with the service. Dining there is still okay, but I would not recommend ordering a whole cake.

I don&#39;t understand the appeal of Cheesecake Factory. This location is always jam-packed, so the wait for a table is frequently ridiculously long. The menu is the restaurant equivalent of War And Peace in length. I mean, it has advertisements for other businesses, like a magazine. Once you finally make a decision on your meal, the portions come and are massive. I mean MASSIVE, to the point of complete gluttony. The food itself is just ok. With all of the amazing choices available in the Portland area that are fresh, local, independent, reasonably priced, and delicious, TCF is on the bottom of my list of choices for eating out. <br><br>On the positive: the service is very good. The few times I&#39;ve been there. The servers have been prompt, attentive, knowledgable of the massive menu, and courteous.<br><br>This is a typical American corporate restaurant - feed the people massive amounts of food and then encourage them to eat MORE by offering a gigantic piece of cheesecake.
Walkin in at 10pm to be seated in less than 5 min<br>We waited for 2.5 hrs when we went in at 7:30pm

I have eaten here only once since this is such a hyped place .Anyway, I don&#39;t like cheesecake so I didn&#39;t even try. We had a few appetizers ,soup and pasta dishes. Appetizers were good. Pasta was almost uncooked. To lighten the mood, I told my family it was healthier to eat al-dente pasta, but it didn&#39;t fly :). It was raw pasta. <br>The server and service was good.<br>I took the pasta home, cooked it and flavored it so we didn&#39;t waste the food, but have never returned to buy uncooked expensive pasta.

Well, they&#39;ve finally done it.  They brought in a Skinnylicious menu.  Thank goodness because I usually have to bring half the stuff home and while that&#39;s not a bad thing...I probably shouldn&#39;t be eating this much of their food as it&#39;s all pretty calorie laden.<br><br>I was pleasantly surprised at the smaller burger with salad for only 590 calories.  Very tasty and it looked like a hand made patty (probably because it was smaller only way to get it).  I was very pleased and just full enough.  <br><br>I skipped the cheesecake which isn&#39;t really my thing to begin with.  I actually can&#39;t wait to go back and try something else off this menu.  I looked on the internet, apparently it&#39;s been around for a couple of years but this if the first time I&#39;ve seen it.<br><br>Keep up the good work, CCF.<br><br>I&#39;ll be back again.

This place is awesome. I have been to many cheesecake factories but let me tell you this one is big it&#39;s spacious it&#39;s brand-new it&#39;s beautiful inside everything is tiptop clean the bar is awesome the service is fast and friendly the food is amazing. You are not going to walk away from this place disappointed, I promise. Aside from the fact that every time I eat here I think that I&#39;m looking around to find Penny, I will tell you that whenever am in Tuallitan I make it a point to go out of my way to come here for dinner. I will warn you though that is very busy and you can expect a 30 to 45 minute wait to be seated.

Zero stars<br><br>First     Host stand .... Go stand over there.     Next gal to seat &#34;party of three?&#34;      Yes, that&#39;s me ..... &#34;I&#39;m gonna seat this other lady&#34; (behind me in the queue)<br><br>Second    Food ..... Hello, there&#39;s a long black hair in my food.    Many apologies but here we&#39;ve re plated your food.       Um ..... I kind of expected new food.    <br><br>Third       Bill....   We comped your dinner.     This just indicated what we had to enter to get the kitchen to remake your food.   ......   Um but you still charged for the plate with the hair?<br><br>Totally reinforced why I hate chain restaurants with a gizmo. Items on the menu
An old favorite. Food is usually very good. Best strawberry shortcake of any chain I&#39;m aware of.

despite the 45 minute wait to be seated, food was same ol&#39; good Cheesecake Factory food.  got their quesadilla app (VERY good).  then a California salad (VERY bad), which tasted like pesticide and didn&#39;t have enough dressing, so had to ask for more (still wasted most of it).  main food, hubby got their meatloaf...HUGE platter of food and he liked it very much.  i got their veggie burger for the first time, and it was 7/10.  kinda weird flavor, but i ate most of it.  and finally, we FINALLY ordered a cheesecake.  it was SOOOO rich but good.  this location we&#39;ve walked by before, and it always seemed packed.  but if you only have to wait less than an hour, it&#39;s worth it...especially since you can roam the mall until your pager beeps.

I love The Cheesecake Factory, have been going here for years. I don&#39;t know what it is about this particular location at the Washington Square mall, but it was the very first place I ever had the powerhouse salmon salad which was extremely good. I have had it in Indiana as well and it was extremely good there. The last two times I&#39;ve had it here at this particular location, was put together very quickly, hardly had any of the ingredients on it that was supposed to come with it. The dressing that they put on the side was very sparse. After I expressly told the server when I ordered it that I would like the dressing on the salad, as this was a kale Salad which is a lot better when the salad dressing is massaged into it. They&#39;ve opened a new location in the happy Valley area so I&#39;m looking forward to trying it there to compare.

Cheesecake Factory is always consistent. My favorite thing about the menu is the small bites because I like to order several things and have a taste of each. And of course, you must always have a piece of cheesecake to take with you when you leave. One thing you can always expect, it will be busy and it will be noisy so if you were looking for a place to go have a business meeting or quiet conversation, this is not your venue.

Two hours in and still haven&#39;t seen food or drinks. Hour and half wait so we grabbed menus and had order ready when seated. Wait is expected for table but 40 minutes on food at ten pm is unacceptable.  Im sure food will be fine but this doesn&#39;t work.

I LOVE this place I had the bacon bacon cheese burger and it was cooked a perfect medium just like I ordered it... I asked for my burger to be lettuce wrapped and they happily obliged ... it had two types of bacon on it and I liked that... the service is always great here and the cheesecake is the bomb !! Do yourself a favor and take some for the ride home... you&#39;ll be glad you did

My party and I ordered cheesecakes and they tasted good. However, towards the end of the meal extra food was placed at our table. I was revolted. THE FOOD WAS CHEWED. How could someone be so careless. Giving food to paying customers. It is today&#39;s economy that is runining our youth. Anyone who thinks differently than is WRONG. Also it was chilly outside, decreasing my overall experience. THE FOOD WAS CHEWED.
I got chicken madiera, undercooked. I understand that it happends sometimes. The way the manager handled the situation was very impressive. I love the place and would recomend to my friends.

Instead of going to the food court we opted in to try the cheesecake factory with our two little girls it took forever to get a table forever to get our food. When the food did come the corn dogs for 2 1/2 year-old were not cooked all the way through and had a gooey center, yuck! At this point everybody is starving and the food was less than good. Wished we would have gone to the food court.

Superior to all the other cheesecake factories I&#39;ve visited around the country. They were incredible! From the moment we sat down the hostess drew attention to the server and told her we had a little one who was one year old. The server brought out some sliced up bananas and graham crackers with our waters. This was so thoughtful! More restaurants should do things like this for kids to keep them occupied and happy whole their parents order and spend money! <br><br>We had a wonderful appetizer, drinks, and them meal, and of course couldn&#39;t leave without delicious cheesecake and homemade whipped cream! <br> <br>Wonderful experience from start to finish and service that was superb! Compliments to the management and maybe they need to go train some of the Midwest locations. Staff ran flawlessly! These are the type of experiences that make you brag to your friends and family about and make you want to come back soon!!

Every thing in their minue is perfect. <br>I recommend Macaroni and cheese balls--buffalo chicken plats for appetizer. Chicken piccata--Louisiana chicken pasta--Cajun jambalaya pasta--four cheese pasta as a main order.

The Godiva chocolate cheese cake is fantastic. It&#39;s really rich so you may want to cut smaller portions. We purchased the 7 &#34; thinking it would only have a piece or 2 left over.  We were wrong.  We had 1/2 the cake left.  It is my favorite of all the cheesecakes I have tried.<br><br>I will say this... they are expensive, but well worth the money.  You can purchase single slices for around $7.50 a slice.  They are large and come with fresh wipped cream.

It was very busy and loud, but being dec 30 I guess that was expected. Long wait to order. We order 2 appitzers and brought out a wrong one. So my husband had to eat his along while I waited for mine. By the time I got mine he was all done  mai. Dish was ok. Only one basket of bread wS delivered.  Whencee went to pay we were charged for the appetizer we sent back.  Not happy

The waitress was good, her name is Kerri. The other food was good that my family got but my friend and I ordered pasta. Our pasta was cold-which was weird cause the plates were hot and the food came out quick- and the chicken was dry. The waitress was nice enough to get us new ones with even less than what we got before. The chicken was not worth the extra $3 we paid for. We all ordered cheesecake too. They were delicious (as always) except they said they were out of meringue for the topping on the lemon meringue, but didn&#39;t want to replace it. <br>This was a mother&#39;s outing for us, but my mother had the worst experience. She went to go to the bathroom and the stalls were all out of toilet seat covers. Because they were out of toilet seat covers you could see into the other stall! My mother came back surprised that there would not be solid panels in between each bathroom stall. When the waitress came back around she had the manager called over and when she explained the situation he just looked and said I&#39;m sorry and walked away like it was no problem. We all had to go to the restroom while we waited for the check so four of us girls went so we could go in pairs so that we did not have anyone peeking through the hole in the panel at us. We went and all saw the hole for ourselves. There were still no toilet seat covers in either stall (this was 20 minutes after we had complained to the manager). So we once again informed the manager and a female employee that there was no toilet seat covers and that there was a hole in the wall. We insisted that the manager fix Tue problem and we would wait for him to finish before we went to the bathroom. He rolled his eyes and sighed at us, before going to fix the problem.<br>This is a problem that needs to be fixed immediately with patching up the panel somehow. The manager was rude and didn&#39;t seem to care about any of our problems. The waitresses cheerful attitude was the only thing that went good during this experience.

Their food has gone downhill significantly over the last few years.  It used to be that when you went you&#39;d get lush, soft warm bread to start the meal, followed by huge portions of decadent well seasoned food.  Now, you get hard lumps of partially burnt bread, followed by bland, dry, overcooked and under-seasoned food. <br><br>I emailed to follow up with the company after our most recent meal, and was informed that they did not have new staff nor had they changed the recipe for their whole wheat bread (which is the type we ate).  There was no excuse for why two out of three loaves of bread we received were burnt.  Nor for why all three of the loaves were super hard crusted with barely any softness to the inside (despite being freshly out of the oven). Nor for the dry, overcooked and under seasoned steak and shrimp.  Nor for the absurdly stale &#34;children&#39;s plate&#34; they brought when we arrived (with brown sliced bananas and hard little stubs of bread that looked like turds).  <br><br>They offered to send us a gift card to try the place again (I suppose under the presumption that the staff simply had an off day), but it was for such a small amount it would be impossible for my family to try again without spending some of our own money.  And quite frankly, there are so many wonderful restaurants out there that I wouldn&#39;t risk spending money on another terrible meal here, even if half of it was paid for by somebody else...<br><br>If you need to go someplace around the mall, try Red Lobster instead (just as expensive, but the food is well seasoned and not grossly overcooked).  If you&#39;re just looking for good food in general and location isn&#39;t as important, check out all the other wonderful places Yelp has to offer.

Where do I start. The Cheesecake Factory never disappoints even if you do have to wait it is well worth it. The Tex Mex egg rolls are amazing! Drinks are made well an there is an endless amount of options of food for everyone in the family. Will always be a favorite spot of mine!
The food is excellent, the atmosphere is fun but the wait is horrible!  Way too many people and the same time, maybe because it is located in the mall.

Usual. Redundant. Typical.<br><br>Corporate chain restaurant with very large menu. Wait was 45 minute when quoted 30. Hostess was not friendly and seemed like she didn&#39;t want to be there. <br><br>Not really anything unique about it. Just another CA restaurant preparing decent food.<br><br>There is better food out there!

Food is fair. Nothing impressive, except that you might want to take a slice of cheesecake which they claim to be awesome. I visit there since I need to shop around, but definitely not because of their food or anything else.

Okay, for the cons: So busy! Waited for 45 minutes for a table...Service was slow. Utensils were dirty and had old food stuck on them. Fish was mushy. Steak over cooked. Potato soup tasted super funky. Was told a manager wanted to stop by (we never requested this and come to find out that wasn&#39;t actually the case) manager never came by. Waited 25mins for the check. Ended up being over a 2 hour event with 2 small kids...<br><br>For the pros: Amazing Lemon drops and Wonderful cheesecake (that we ended up taking home)

I&#39;m from Spokane and whenever my husband and I are in places with CCFs, we go. We like the food that much.<br><br>We were staying in Vancouver, but made the 45 minute drive (from our hotel) down to Tigard. When we got there they were out of pagers which should have been a sign, but we put our names in and were told to check back in 45 minutes (saying the wait was an hour).<br><br>We did some window shopping and returned, only to be told the wait was another 40 minutes--but that the current wait was 2 hours, as if that were some consolation. We waited...and waited...and waited. 40 minutes came and went, husband checked on our status, was told another 5-10 minutes with only 5 other couples in front of us. 20 minutes after that, I sent him in to cancel our table, and it was finally ready.<br><br>The table they took us to, in the bar, should not exist. It was up against a wall and less than 12&#34; from the couple next to us. Husband could barely get into his seat. His ass was basically in their dinner as he squeezed by. Awesome.<br><br>We are not large people by any means. We wouldn&#39;t have been able to move our arms to eat, let alone converse, in the terrible configuration they stuck us in. We finally cut our losses (that would be 2 hours of our lives we&#39;ll never get back), and bailed. <br><br>We&#39;ve gone to many very busy CCFs before, and have never had to wait more than about an hour, maybe 1:15 once. Clearly, this one has issues with slow service and/or food. We chose to leave hungry rather than endure any more torture to find out.<br><br>Update 5/30: I contacted the restaurant directly after writing this review, expressing my concerns. I got a call from the manager saying he&#39;d send me a gift card so I could try them again. 3 months later and I&#39;m not holding my breath on him ever following through.

it was a busy night, but i thought i would give it a shot anyway.<br><br>i ordered the carolina bbq pork sandwich. the menu said it came on a brioche bun, it came on a sesame seed bun that reminded me of mcdonalds. needless to say, it couldn&#39;t handle the bbq sauce and was soggy and soaked through the bottom. the bbq pork part was bland. overall the sandwich reminded me of something served in a school cafeteria.<br><br>i ordered my cheesecake slice to go, figuring that at least they can&#39;t screw that up. i was wrong. instead of what i ordered, a caramel pecan turtle cheesecake, i get the white chocolate macadamia. the lone macadamia nut was stale and soft.<br><br>maybe its my fault for always giving this place another chance. i should know by now to not believe the hype.

To go service was outstanding recently! And the food was delicious. I go here about 3-4 times a year and it&#39;s usually pretty good, depending on what is ordered. I would always recommend this place as a staple.. Yummy stuff too much to choose from!

Who would&#39;ve guessed that this place, a chain, holds a beer place in my heart. While the food was less than memorable, the bartenders kept giving me tastings of sweet, sweet beer. Mmmm. And that&#39;s when I first laid lips on Oregon honey beer. Excellent service at the bar.<br><br>Plenty of food left over, but I sure wished they could send me off with growlers of their Hood River Ales, Deschutes and others...

Not sure if we just got lucky. But our server knew the menu and made great suggestions. <br> If you go there today ask for Sam the sever. Great attitude and Awsome customer service. <br> We will be returning sooner than later. <br>Thanks for doing a great job Sam. Service like that is how you move up the ladder quickly.

CANNED PEARS in their Pear &amp; Endive salad??? Absolutely pathetic and disappointing. The chicken in the salad was dry and tasteless, the candied pecans were few in number, and the dressing was bitter. Yet another menu selection to avoid at the Cheesecake Factory!

First off the Food here is great. The servers are friendly and I love the atmosphere. But, the girls who they have working the front desk are idiots.. I can not put in words how stupid they are. First off I have been waiting to be seated for 2 and a half hours. I checked in about an hour and a half ago and they said they forgot to &#34;activate&#34; my pager. Ok kinda ticked now but not the end of the world because hey she said she would get me seated in 10 minutes. It has now been 2 hours and 30 minutes the line is literally to the front door so I guess it will take about another 20 to get to the main counter. What&#39;s interesting is that I see open seating... Beware great food sh*t hostess counter.  Bet on the plus side I am now being seated. 2 hours and 50 minutes later!

So they are supposed to take reservations, but that goes out the door when there is a holiday?!?  That makes no sense at all.  I&#39;m not very happy about this and they should put that on the site or yelp site at least.

Started out great...only had to wait about ten minutes! Bummer was, our waiter was just that. Nothing more. Took our order, brought our food. That&#39;s about it. Didnt check on us. We had to track him down if we needed anything. Dissappointing.

The first thing that you like about this restaurant (once your wait for seating is over) is the nice ambience for a restaurant jostled inside a mall. [the wait is bearable as you get a pager so that you can shop, don&#39;t go too far as JCPenney as it will not work that far in the mall].<br><br>The servcie is amazing, been there ~4 times and was always blown away by the service. The restaurant is almost always full, but they have enough servers to keep good check of all their customers.<br><br>Coming to food, their menu is quite expansive. Some items are really good... we loved the Firecracker Salmon: yummy and spicy: an innovative dish and a must eat. We ordered the Jamaican Black pepper with Chicken and Shrimp - that turned out to be really good as well, the shrimp and chicken were cooked to the right amount (nice and juicy). <br>Avacodo rolls appetizer: very good.  The sauce (cilantro based) is very good.<br>Chicken Madeira: Not so great.<br>Herb Crust Salmon: Decent to good.<br>Vanilla Cheesecake: Very good.<br>30th Anniversary Cheesecake: Awesome.<br>Tiarmisu Cheesecake: Good, but not as good as other cheesecakes.<br>Mango Keylime cheesecake: Just okay, my wife liked it however.<br><br>On an earlier visit, I ordered their Chicken &amp; Shrimp gumbo, which wasn&#39;t as spicy as expected.<br>Had these at a LA cheesecake factory:<br>Bang - Bang Chicken and Shrimp: Awesome dish: should try out at other locations as well.<br>Chicken samosas: turned out to be good as well.<br><br>Overall, very pleasant dining experience.
This place is awesome.  The people are great and the food, OMG, it is SO good!  Do yourself a favor and take the family for a really nice time out.
30 minutes since we ordered and no meal in sight. Have to ask for water refills. Not worth returning. Guess this place is for those with 2 hour lunches.

Went in for breakfast on Valentine&#39;s Day. The long line along the dessert case looked intimidating, but was moving fairly quickly.<br>A very nice breakfast menu, quite extensive.  I went with Huevos Rancheros.  Most of the time, this type of meal is quite simple, eggs with tortillas and a Mexican sauce and most of the time they taste pretty much the same.  But the sauce on this meal was excellent. Not too spicy, but not bland.  My friend&#39;s loved their omelettes and fresh fruit.<br><br>But the best part of our meal was our waitress, Angelita.  She was on top of our orders, was very polite, had great suggestions and was a very nice person.  <br>Good meal, great company and great service.  Will return.
I do the whole deal when I come here, appetizer, main course and dessert.  Everything is always great.  I always have cheese cake for dessert and they are always good.

You know why I don&#39;t have very many one-star reviews? Because I like to avoid places that suck.<br><br>Unfortunately, I have friends who don&#39;t share this aversion.
