I hate malls, but the purchase of many Apple products made a visit necessary.  After spending over an hour in the Apple store we were hungry.  This mall has very few sit down choices outside of the food court, so we settled on CF.  I really don&#39;t get the appeal of this place.  The food was mediocre:  my wilted lettuce French farm salad, Hanna&#39;s boring pasta sauce, Steve&#39;s bland caesar salad.  The service was crappy - our food, all of it, came out before our drinks, even after reminding our server that we were waiting for them.  And the ambience -- Vegas casino meets Olive Garden.  <br><br>My recommendation:<br><br>Only go here if you need drinks to take the edge off of the whole mall experience and be prepared to wait.

We actually went here because we expected a long wait for a table; had some time to kill and were hungry.<br><br>This place might have a whole lot of marks against it: gargantuan food, way too many choices, in a mall.<br><br>However, it&#39;s one of the only choices in the mall proper.<br><br>Anyhoo.<br><br>20 minutes later, we were seated. It was about noon; guess that&#39;s a good time to get seated &#34;quickly.&#34;<br><br>Our waiter was a bit too enthusiastic, but service was good. He seemed excited that I ordered the Memphis Burger. this thing was actually a normal-sized burger with...um...barbecued pulled pork, cheese, cole slaw, and pickles. It was OK. Good thing they included some sauce on the side or there wouldn&#39;t have been much flavor without it.<br><br>My girlfriend&#39;s &#34;lunch-sized&#34; salad was still gigantic, by the way.<br><br>We couldn&#39;t resist the red velvet cheesecake. It was two red velvet cake layers with the usual cheesecake. It didn&#39;t blow me away, but it was still good.<br><br>Can&#39;t come up with a end for this review other than I didn&#39;t die after eating at a *gasp* chain restaurant.

My bad experience with bad service finally broken with my trip to Cheesecake Factory. I came here with my friend and we got seated right away at 6 pm on Tuesday night. The fried calamari appetizer was excellent and my dinner combination of Salmon and Steak Diane was really good.<br><br>By the time we ordered the cheesecake, I feel full already, but I ordered that damn Pistachio Chocolate cheesecake anyway and made myself really bloated. I couldn&#39;t finish the cheesecake so I took it to go with half of my meal.<br><br>Our waitress was really nice. She&#39;s polite and not pushy. I love cheesecake factory, not only because it made me bloated, but they made me feel like a good customer. :)

We all know that waiting can be painful here specially during lunch/dinner time. <br><br>Here&#39;s a tip: Drop someone (preferrably the one member of your group who doesn&#39;t like shopping. They can people watch while waiting) by their door to get your tables later. <br><br>You can freely shop for around 20-30 mins cause that&#39;s how long the waiting time is. By the time you&#39;re done shopping, you&#39;ve already developed an apetite for The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I would recommend their chicken marsala and veggie thai wrap. Have some dessert after. Try their seasonal cheesecake aside from their classics. You&#39;ll be in for a treat. <br><br>Their servings are huge. You can even share it with the people who are still waiting or you can take it home as a midnight snack/meal. <br><br>I haven&#39;t tried the bar area yet as they are always packed.

I don&#39;t get this place, while the cheesecake is good- to wait 40 to 50 minutes for just so so food is beyond me. It&#39;s rather expensive as well.  There are better options out there. I&#39;ve eaten here 3 times and can not fathom why this place is so popular

I&#39;m not adamantly opposed to chains, but I do prefer to give my money to local businesses. (I won&#39;t lie; I could live on Olive Garden breadsticks alone.)<br><br>That being said. The Cheesecake Factory is like Disneyland or Disney World; everyone wants to go but there are far better places to visit.<br><br>Both my friend and I had never been and wanted to see what it was like. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan sandwich, which was $11.95. Portions are huge and the prices are a bit high for a chain, but I&#39;ve noticed prices are up everywhere in all restaurants, and so it goes...<br><br>The sandwich was served with the sauce on the side, so I had to dip my sandwich in the sauce, which made eating it awkward. It was good, but I wish I went for something lighter.<br><br>Warm bread is provided before the meal. If you order a drink, it&#39;s served in huge glasses and water is served in plastic beer mugs. Maybe it was me, but the food seemed rather salty because I actually asked for a Coke (I typically don&#39;t drink Coke or any soda at meals) because I needed something sweet to balance out the saltiness of the meal. <br><br>It&#39;s VERY noisy, so don&#39;t expect a romantic evening without the kids unless you like it noisy. Also, don&#39;t be prepared to linger and have a nice conversation - our waiter kept coming by after we ate to check on us. Tables are a premium.

so I love the food.....if you have not tried the avocado egg rolls..... you have not lived...not really. the menu has a little of everything and if you cant find something that sounds good then it is quite possible that you are not from this world. The only draw back is the acoustics. When it is packed it is almost deafening especially if the music is on. I would avoid coming here during peak hours as you will have a long wait..... but that is only because the food is that good. avocado egg rolls people......avocado egg rolls

Same old cheese cake factory corporate formula: nice surroundings, happy workers, food full of sugar, fats and sodium.<br><br>Pay through the nose here if you can&#39;t find a decent mom and pop restaurant nearby.<br><br>Did I mention the wait. Not worth it.

No, the food doesn&#39;t taste better if there is more on your plate than you can possibly eat in one sitting.  No, the food doesn&#39;t taste better if you paid only 20 bucks for your oversized semi-premade meal.  <br><br>Ironically, the only part of the food where the portions aren&#39;t val-u sized or val-u priced is the cheesecake itself, despite the fact that this place is called the CHEESECAKE factory.  It&#39;s disgusting to imagine anyone actually having room for dessert after they finish an entree here anyway.<br><br>I won&#39;t be going to this place after my sole venture, but I&#39;m sure there are enough people out there happy with suburban-corporate ambiance and mid-scale mediocrity, as proven by the many 4-5 star reviews I see here.

long wait time.....as always here!  We waited about 40 minutes to get a table for 2.  Once seated our server, Jasmine, came up and took our order for drinks and apps.  I ordered a Martini and the wife a raspberry martini.  We asked for reccomenditions on apps and our server was VERY helpful and offered MANY suggestions.  We ended up getting the chicken Samosas.<br><br>Our appetizers ended up arriving before our drinks from the bar.  The appetizers were DELICIOUS! After our appetizers and bread arrived our server came back with our drinks from the bar and asked if we were ready to order..... We were.   I ordered a chicken mazarella dish (sorry can not remember the name but it was the first one on the menu under the chicken section).  My wife had a cobb salad. <br><br>After a short wait our food came and it was outstanding as well!  Good flavor and textures, not much to complain about here!<br><br>I would have to say the only thing I would have to complain about is the prices were slightly higher than I would have thought.  I know the prices are posted on the menu and the portions are generous.  However, when my bill came and our martini&#39;s were $10.50 each that raised my eyebrows!<br><br>All in all a good experience and great food.
My son and daughter took me to lunch it was very elegant and good food service excellent .waiter was very attentive

I&#39;m giving three stars...nothing spectacular but nothing bad either.  If it wasn&#39;t for the decor and location, this would be a so-so place to eat.  The menu is vast, and the food was pretty good.  The place is too busy for it&#39;s own good, and the decor screams &#34;I&#39;m trying to be Las Vegas&#34;. <br><br>The staff was friendly, but the overall busy atmosphere made it seem like the staff was barely in control of the chaos.  I thought the pricing was ok.  <br><br>Yes, I would eat there again, but this wouldn&#39;t be on my list for places to impress someone.
The new parmesan garlic bread and Chile Rellenos are great. And the beet salad is always my fave.

Thank you franchise gods for bringing The Cheesecake Factory to our world of small plates and foreign language menus! I first fell in love with The Cheesecake Factory at their original location in Beverly Hills, where the restaurant is more like an old house and seating is limited so I can see how some may be overwhelmed by the atmosphere and design of the large Washington Square location, but no matter which location  you&#39;re at, you will be served the same great food. <br><br>Yes the portions are large, but that&#39;s what to-go boxes and the gym are for. To me (a girl who likes to eat and get what she&#39;s paying for) large portions earn the restaurant a star, as long as the food is good, and it is! My favorite is the four cheese pasta, but I&#39;ve taken everyone I know to the Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;ve never heard a complaint about what was served, from the salads to the Cajun chicken littles to the appetizers. <br><br>Along with  your main course, they serve two kinds of super yummy bread and of course cheesecake. They always have about 30 flavors of cheesecake to choose from and they&#39;re all quite tasty. They range from great plain cheesecake with fresh fruit, to peanut butter-cookie dough cheesecake. Many are quite rich so I do vote share or get another to-go box.<br><br>If you go on the weekend you will more than likely have to wait a while for your table, but it&#39;s worth it. They have a nice bar with yummy Bellini&#39;s (and other drinks) if you wanna grab a drink while you wait. Or you can venture into the mall and people watch. <br><br>Bottom line- You will not leave hungry, but you will leave wanting more!

Yes, the wait sucks, but every time I have eaten there the food has been super tasty.  The portions are a bit over the top, but hey for the price you are getting like three meals!  Ha!  Sharing is a good idea.  The Crispy Spicy Beef is awesome, the Hungarian Goulash is so rich and delicious, and their Steak Diane isn&#39;t too shabby.  I like this place for special occasions, or to take people from out of town.  The Mojitos there are super tasty and not skimpy.  The menu is a book, and has such a vast variety of food options that I could never hope to try them all.  I adore the whimsical decor, and the staff is always running around like chickens with their heads....you know.<br><br>Then there are the cheesecakes.  Oh glory!  I have tried the lemon raspberry, the white chocolate latte, the coconut chocolate, and the god of cakes &#34;Chris&#39; Outrageous Chocolate Cake&#34;.  It is an amazing mountain of cheesecake, German chocolate cake, and fudge frosting.  It is probably the only cake I have ever loved.

Had a FABULOUS meal here. <br>I haven&#39;t been since I frequented the location back home in Green Valley.<br><br>We will be coming here a lot after last night&#39;s meal.<br><br>We both got the filet mignon - his medium-rare, mine medium. Both were cooked perfectly.<br><br>I substituted the french fries (with filet mignon, really?!) for sauteed spinach.<br><br>The menu is huge, and everything sounds delicious.<br><br>I was upset to find they got rid of the bruschetta. I loved it.  :(<br>But they bring you delicious sourdough baguettes with butter. Good enough.<br><br>The filet mignon was amazing. Best steak I&#39;ve had in years. No joke.<br>I was surprised.<br><br>Then we HAD to get cheesecake to go. I got the pineapple upside down cheesecake (for the love of food, get this!), he got the Oreo cheesecake. I&#39;m not a fan, but it&#39;s popular.<br><br>The interior reminds me of a casino in Vegas. Am I alone in thinking this?
Usually I frown upon such an extensive menu because it tends to result in sloppy unfocused dishes.  Such is not the case at the cheesecake factory. Everything is awesome - especially the cheesecake.
Ahhh...great way to beat the heat!

Great food, as always. Great service, as always. Great atmosphere, as always, except it was a little dark. And the cheesecake is divine, as always.  A little overpriced and I wish the cheesecake slices were bigger. Overall, a yummy experience.

Delicious mojito, friendly staff, great food, best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had! Four stars only because they would not accept a reservation when I called and once we arrived after a long trip we had to wait a long time for a table...

Five stars for the cheesecake, 1 star for the food, 4.5 stars for service. <br><br>Our server was very pleasant and knowledgeable. Our sodas were never empty. He was prompt to offer extra bread and to bring our check. <br><br>We ordered a Pulled Pork Sandwich and a Chicken Parmesan Sandwich. Both were...weird. I could only eat the fries that came with the Pulled Pork sandwich (pretty good fries) because I couldn&#39;t choke down the sandwich. The pork tasted like turkey and had an odd texture. My fiance liked it, so he ate it for lunch the next day. I tried a bite of his Chicken Parmesan. Yuck, the bread was soggy and there was some weird flavor combinations in there. <br><br>Next time, I&#39;ll definitely order the pasta (which is good) with my Red Velvet Cheesecake. <br><br>I wish they had sampler platters for the cheesecake.

The name does not say it all!!<br><br>Sure they have an almost endless list of fantastic cheese cakes that will all make you wish mom cooked like that. They also have a real menu of great food. They have chicken, seafood etc. Not just cheese cake!<br><br>One big surprise was the Kobe Beef burger. Being a burger freak I had to get it and it was great. I finished that up with a Red Velvet Cheese Cake. Oh yea! That hit the spot!!<br><br>I highly recommend this place. Be prepared to wait. I have never had less than a 45 minute wait.

Cheesecake, YUM! Food, always good every time. This is a chain restaurant so I do expect the food taste to be consistent, which it is. The servers we get have always been very friendly and accommodating. LOVE the Avocado Rolls. My favorite is the Steak Diane &amp; Shrimp Scampi, it never fails me.

Today I learned that it&#39;s a bad idea to eat cheesecake for breakfast. And yet, I want to return to the Cheesecake Factory to get another slice (entire cake?) for dinner. Oh, Erin....<br><br>I don&#39;t generally enjoy the food at the Cheesecake Factory &amp; this location was not much of a change. I just find it really difficult to find tasty yet healthy fare at this place. Yesterday my boyfriend and I enjoyed a late lunch on the deck, which was nice- the right amount of sun and people watching for a nice time. I settled on the $15 seared ahi tuna salad, which was underwhelming value-wise, but still tasty. Boyfriend had his usual club sandwich ($11) which he loves. Two slices of cheesecake later ($5-7 per slice) and we were food-coma induced and ready for a nap.<br><br>I&#39;d return to the Cheesecake Factory for desert, and I love the outside seating option for a nice day. But, I&#39;m going to have to dock a few stars for the lacking healthy options &amp; steep prices.
Very good every time. The staff was amazing. Very friendly! I ate to much had to get my cheese cake to go but it was amazing when I ate it. Fresh strawberry always a good choice!

This place is beautiful!  It kind of makes me feel like I&#39;m back in vegas...<br>the food isn&#39;t all that great to me though,  it&#39;s more like an overpriced Applebees.  They usually have a really long wait, and everyoone that works there seems to have a frown plastered on their face.  <br>I have to admit, when they first opened, i waited in long for an insane amount of time to get in.  I enjoyed the oreo cheesecake, but really, I don&#39;t see what the big hype is.

Wait time seemed long considering many empty tables.  Server was not very attentive.  My water refill took 30 minutes to get.  Appetizers came after meal...too full to eat.  Music way too loud, could hardly talk to person across the table.  Food good, but service and atmosphere took away from that.

Called to make reservations and told me they stop taking reservations after 5 o&#39;clock, so she told me I needed to call back within five minutes. I called back and the manager Ashton said they are not taking any reservations. I tried to explain to him that the Lady on the phone two minutes ago said we could..he told me no we stop seating reservation people at five that&#39;s not what the lady told me on the phone. Ashton the manager was very rude and William the store manager shouldn&#39;t have a manager that rude to customers working for the restaurant! I will never eat at this place again after being treated like that on the phone. Lack of customer service will make any business fail no matter how big or small.

Please, just don&#39;t go here. Pick another place in the &#39;great food&#39; city of PDX. The only reason why we went was because we were given a gift card. The food is total crap. Americanized, out of the freezer, greasy, unhealthy.. And, after we got home from dinner, we were both in the bathroom sick.. Not sure what food item made us sick, but we will never ever go back here, and never recommend this pace to anyone..

Yes, there is usually a wait, but I am not sure what the previous reviewer was talking about when he referred to a three-hour wait - unless maybe he was trying to make a statement by using a hyperbole.  I am also not sure what he meant when he talked about the restaurant serving &#39;instantly-forgetable&#39; food.  Unless he is  a connoisseur of fine food and used to eating frequently at the one of these restaurants (<a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.foodandwine.com%2Farticles%2F10-best-new-restaurants-of-the-year-go-list-2008&amp;s=bfadd503f5d617e54269743d9b13bde8bda8985ff9478251d400e10d148dd9a5" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">foodandwine.com/articles…</a>),  I don&#39;t see how he could be blasé about the food at Cheesecake factory.  Anyway, this is not intended to be a a review of another review,  but I just couldn&#39;t resist.<br><br>I have always enjoyed eating at the Cheesecake Factory. Always. The food is great and they do have a pretty exhaustive menu that offers reasonable variety. The service usually varies between  3 and 5 on a scale of 1 - 5.  <br><br>This is what we (party of 4) ordered today:<br><br>Appetizers (Thai Lettuce Wraps, Firecracker Salmon rolls) - both these dishes were excellent.  The sauces that were served with the lettuce wraps were flavorful and I think one of them was had Indian spices. <br><br>Main course: Miso Salmon, Wasabi Crusted Ahi Tuna, Louisiana Chicken Pasta, Pasta Carnonara. Our collective feedback in short: The chef delivered as promised.  <br><br>Dessert: I don&#39;t remember the kind of cheesecake, but it had 3 layers, we each got a slice and we ate in silence - it was a good kind of silence and the kind of silence that you go into when you&#39;re indulging in a guilty pleasure ( I&#39;ll be paying my dues for this indulgence by running 4 miles tomorrow morning)<br><br>The expected wait time when we checked in today was 25 - 40 minutes. Our actual wait time was 20 minutes. <br><br>We&#39;re going back. Soon.

HUGE portions abound here.  It&#39;s too pricey for daily lunch, but if you&#39;re on expense account, you can do it.  Of course, the cheesecake is to die for.<br><br>My measuring stick for a place to get lunch is the good old Clubhouse Sandwich.  If it&#39;s done right, typically, the rest of the fare is done right.  Here, it&#39;s done right.<br><br>I must return upon my next flight north.  4 1/2 stars.

We don&#39;t come often and it&#39;s nothing against the food but mostly the crazy wait times. Contrary to some of the reviews here, it seems everyone in the Portland metro wants to be at the Cheesecake Factory because the waits are pretty long. Aside from that the food is pretty tasty. Our favorites are the Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo and the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp. I&#39;ve also had several of their appetizers including the Egg Rolls, Calamari, and the Spinach Cheese Dip, but not at this particular location, it was one in California. Either way i&#39;ve never been dissappointed with my food. There&#39;s much to choose from on the menu which can be rather overwhelming for some. And the Red Velvet Cheesecake was yummy!!!

Good food and good cheesecakes. I&#39;ve been told different things by employees about if they take reservations. But on Fridays and Saturdays you want to come at least 15-20 minutes before you want to sit down because there&#39;s always a wait.

Firstly: You&#39;re in Portland! Eat somewhere interesting!<br><br>The food here is okay, average, with an overwhelmingly large menu. They have good cocktails. The service is always fantastic. There is nothing here that will &#34;wow&#34; you, but nothing will leave you disappointed either (shouldn&#39;t, anyway) it&#39;s all very safe.<br><br>I would, however, come here for dessert and an appetizer. The avocado eggrolls are worth mentioning. As is the Lemon Raspberry cheesecake. Not too sweet. Just right.

This is probably the biggest Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to, to-date. Lots of seatings and ceiling.  It&#39;s a cross between the Nile + Willy Wonka factory. It doesn&#39;t do much for my taste, but it works for them.<br><br>I would skip the food and go directly to dessert, because, really, there&#39;s a reason why they called it Cheesecake Factory.  So many flavors, it&#39;s hard to stay away.

The food here is delicious there is plenty of selections for you to chose. I normally get there pasta. Although, the first time I went there I had a burger. They are humoungous. So, if you have a big appetite it&#39;s a perfect place for you to go. I don&#39;t even remember if I finished it or not. The only drawback is that the portions sometimes are huge, but other then that I have nothing to complain about oh and since it&#39;s so popular it can get very loud.<br><br>The cheesecake is delivcious. It&#39;s like you&#39;re in heaven. There are plenty of selections for you to chose from. Which is definitely a plus since I&#39;m not a huge fan of chocholate it&#39;s nice to know that there&#39;s a place that will have a very good selection.

My first visit to a Cheesecake Factory was years ago in Chicago. I always remembered a good experience of reasonable good food and an overwhelming selection of delicious cheesecakes! <br><br>I&#39;ve been to the Portland/Tigard location several time since they opened. As some people indicated, I&#39;ve also experienced the long wait to get seated. However, our wait today was only 15-minutes for two people! Although I haven&#39;t returned to a Cheesecake Factory for two years, things hasn&#39;t changed. The decor remained the same, as well as the superb service, good food, and overwhelming selection of cheesecake. <br><br>Oh yea, today I ordered The Navajo (sp?) sandwich. It has a lettuce, tomato, breaded fry chicken, and avocado with seasoned mayo. This sandwich was very delicious! I highly recommend!

Worst customer service lately. I have tried three times thinking maybe next time it will be okay but nope last time they mess up my order, over charge me, and have their incredibly rude women manager not help at all.

HaHa!  Cheesecake factory, with the portion sizes big enough for a week&#39;s worth of meals.<br><br>HUGE-est menu, ever.<br><br>Yum-OH cherry cheesecake.<br><br>pffftttttt.......wait time.  forget it.  <br><br>.....but i really want that cheesecake!  ;) ;) ;)<br><br>an experience to experience.
Wife got food poisoning at this location when we last visited Portland.  Spent that night and the next day praying to the porcelain god.  Will never go back to any Cheesecake Factory.

We have been going to this location for over 3 years regularly. Today is the first time we received extremely bad service. Frederick our server was glad that we received bad service. Amazing!!Very disappointed. Talked to manager and he said he will talk to server.

Date Visited: Monday 12/27/10 (Lunch)<br><br>I thought arriving at the Cheesecake Factory around 2 p.m. would mean no wait, but I was mistaken.  Apparently, the Monday after Christmas means tons of shoppers eating at all hours.  So, we had a 20-minute wait, which wasn&#39;t really bad.  The problem is that they don&#39;t guarantee the little buzzers will work outside the door of the restaurant, so you can&#39;t walk down to Sephora or something and browse while you wait for a table to open up.<br><br>Anyway, we were seated and asked what we&#39;d like to drink.  Our teas were brought along with bread/butter.  I wanted a nice casual meal and definitely didn&#39;t feel rushed at all on this particular visit.  Spazz got the hummus as an appetizer and I was surprised by the massive bowl of hummus delivered.  The bread was stacked beside the bowl.  I ate some of the hummus with the bread (not the pita bread).  Delicious.  <br><br>We both ordered Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta (lunch-sized portions are $10.95 as opposed to the dinner-sized $13.95 portions).  I&#39;ve ordered this dish nearly every time I&#39;ve gone to Cheesecake Factory.  For some reason, this time was the absolute best I&#39;ve had it.  It was FULL of pasta, sundried tomatoes, broccoli, eggplant, pine nuts, peppers, and kalamata olives.  I didn&#39;t feel like I ran out of anything before I was out of pasta, so it was perfect.  <br><br>We mainly went here for lunch because we received a gift card for them.  In addition, we received 2 cards for free cheesecake.  Spazz is vegan, so it was up to me to pick a piece of cheesecake and bring it home.  I ended up getting one full of candy bar goodness and it&#39;s awesome!  I can&#39;t wait to go back.

I know it&#39;s all cool to hate on The Fac (we&#39;re on a nickname basis), especially if you&#39;re a food snob, but if you want a tasty meal you can&#39;t go wrong here. <br><br>The menu is huge and covers about every major area: pasta, steak, seafood, chicken, salads, sammiches, pizza, etc, etc, etc. I&#39;ve never been disappointed with anything I&#39;ve had. I think the specialty chicken dishes are their best offerings. Do yourself a favor and try the Thai chicken pasta.<br><br>The cheesecakes are of course amazing, and I&#39;ve heard a rumor they have other desserts, but come on like you&#39;re not going to get cheesecake! Their key lime cheesecake may be the Greatest Thing on Earth.<br><br>Service is always good and even though the place is packed during prime hours the food arrives quickly. And they&#39;re always happy to substitute sides or whatever else you need.

We had lunch there today. We split the chicken avocado club with sweet potato fries. My husband had the sweetened iced green tea and I had lemonade. We finished it up with a slice of classic cheese cake.<br><br>It was all delicious. Their tea was amazing, the lemonade was exquisite! The sandwich was huge and perfectly done and all of the fixings were very fresh. Our sweet potato fries were warm and yummy. The cheesecake was, of course, to die for!<br><br>Our waitress was really fun and personable as well! Definitely recommend this place! But either come hungry or split a dish!

Wow, I just left from one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. The meal was bad from beginning to end and now I feel horribly sick. Not food poisoning sick, just sick from all the many many very bad quality ingredients that they use in their food. First of all, we started the meal with a margarita and a mai tai. The margarita was more like a waterita and the mai tai was one of the scariest cocktails I have ever tasted in my life. It tasted exactly like the syrup that maraschino cherries sit inside of. I could not drink it at all. Next, we asked the waiter for some glasses of water. Instead of bringing us both water, he only brings water for one person. One of the next times he came around I asked him to please bring another water. Instead of bringing another water, he quickly grabbed the 1 cup of water that was already there and refilled it and came back. Wow. Next, we had some guacamole which was actually not that bad aside from the salsa that accompanied it which was basically just diced tomatoes out of a can. After that, I ordered a margherita pizza. The pizza was one of the scariest parts of all. It was literally just pizza crust with a smear of sauce and some tiny scattered slices of mozzarella. All the places that did not have mozzarella we&#39;re literally just crust. Also, I just remembered I forgot to mention the chicken samosas. This was also one of the scariest parts of the meal by far. Usually samosas are made with a delicious combination of curried vegetables. The outside of the samosas were exactly like egg rolls and the inside was just ground chicken, that&#39;s it.  I instantly felt sick. What can I say, another way that a big restaurant chain in America is scamming Americans out of their money while getting rich and laughing about it. What is our country coming to? Do Americans have taste buds anymore?

First off, I want to declare that I am not a huge, flag waving fan of chain restaurants.  <br><br>So now that you liberal &#34;I can&#39;t stand chains&#34; loonies are off me, here we go.<br><br>I had never been to a Cheesecake Factory, was not overly excited to go, because I would generally rather try the local flair.  But I was with co-workers and majority rules, and for the most part, I am up for anything once.  <br><br>We went on a Thursday evening, were quoted a 20 minute wait which was about 3 minutes.  <br><br>I had the Ultimate Margarita that our fabulous waitress Nicole suggested.  I am glad I took her advice, this was well balanced, not too boozy, just a nice drink.  Sure, you pay for it, but I paid $8 for a lousy beer at an airport bar, so this is small potatoes.<br><br>We had a couple apps, the ahi tuna and the artichoke dip.   I am not a big fan of tuna or artichoke, but I liked these, so they must have been OK.<br><br>I bought into the hype and tried the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta.   When the server set it down, I thought I made a horrible mistake.  I like spicy, but the first scent notes were FIRE IN THE HOLE!   But while I waited for the other entrees to be delivered, the aroma toned down, so I dove in.   Well done, but not the &#34;our #1 dish&#34; I was expecting.  Hype, ya know.   <br><br>I tried the Steak Diane off another plate and it was the best bite of beef I have tasted in a long time.   Just lovely.<br><br>We ordered cheesecake, I think there is a law that this is required.  Both the banana and the chocolate something something scrumptiousness were fantastic.  I suspect it is hard to get a bad dessert here. <br><br>What topped off the meal for me was our lovely server Nicole.  She quickly assessed that this was a table she could have a good laugh with and RAN with it.  We loved her!   She was quick witted, skilled at her craft and gave amazing service.   <br><br>I would go back, certainly.
I llooovvveee me some Cheesecake Factory.  For a chain, they have such an amazing menu and delicious cocktails.  I was VERY pleased with the staff here as well.

The wait is usually long during peak hours, but I love that it&#39;s inside Washington Square Mall.  It&#39;s close to all the great stores.  The Cheesecake Factory has good food which always has my coming back.  I love the Avocado Eggrolls and my all-time favorite drink is the Frozen Iced Mango.  I can go there anything for these 2 items.  Any of their salads are pretty good - all really filling though so I&#39;d recommend to share.  The club sandwich is always a favorite... I&#39;m not a big fan of the pastas - I found some to be a little bland and more carbs than I can handle.

We went there after a piano recital just for dessert. The food was fantastic, but the place was kinda loud and too busy for what we really needed at the time. We chose 2 types of cheesecake to share - one with raspberry, one with chocolate. Very decadent!

Don&#39;t know why, but I am always quite pleased after my meal at the Factory.  I ordered the meatloaf with Mash potatoes and it was simply delicious.  It&#39;s crowded, noises, but definitely worth it!

Love their bread condiments! I love the interior design and their service is spectacular! Their menu is huge! So many selections! I will definitely be coming back to try as much as I can! Their strawberry shortcake dessert is yummy but I definitely recommend you share with someone due to portion size.

The architecture of the interior of The Cheesecake Factory, to me, feels distinctly like I&#39;m in a buffet at any casino in Las Vegas.  Huge, soaring ceilings with unnecessarily intricate artwork, carefully planned lighting - everything you&#39;d expect from said casino.  I definitely prefer more intimate settings, but CF gets away with it.<br><br>We started with the corn fritter appetizer, and honestly I wasn&#39;t expecting much.  They exceeded expectations.  Sweet little fried balls of corn/batter goodness with some kinda tangy/salty dipping sauce.<br><br>I had the fried shrimp platter, which includes several nicely fried jumbo shrimp, fries and some cole slaw.  The shrimp were prepared exactly to my liking, they were crispy, fresh and tasty.  I didn&#39;t particularly care for the fries, but I really enjoyed the cole slaw.  Crisp, tangy and a nice way to clean your palate between bites of shrimp.<br><br>Mrs. Brian I. had the vegetable salad, minus cheese, dressing on the side.  This is a giant freaking salad, and she was entirely happy with it.  The veggies were fresh and crisp.<br><br>Semi-unrelated: I find CF&#39;s website hilarious.  You&#39;re &#34;greeted&#34; by this animated server that explains various aspects of the restaurant.  The way they&#39;ve animated her is... acceptable, but her movements remind of the strippers in the original Duke Nukem game.  Kinda jerky, strangely robotic animation.  Hilarious.<br><br>Back on topic: CF gets an extra star from me for 2 reasons.  First, they have Mac &amp; Jack&#39;s African Amber on tap - one of my absolute favorites and seemingly a rarity around town.  Second, for our server, Jen.  I&#39;m really picky about ordering shrimp.  If it&#39;s not cleaned/deveined then I have a real problem with it.  When I asked her if the shrimp on the platter were cleaned and deveined I wasn&#39;t expecting her to know.  However, she immediately responded &#34;Yes, they&#39;re cleaned, deveined, breaded and fried in-house&#34;.  I was thoroughly impressed.<br><br>I recognize why CF has averaged 3 stars over the course of it&#39;s reviews.  I think they deserve a 4th star because the place is simply &#34;working as intended&#34;.

Work in the area and love the ginormous menu they offer.  I am also loving that they have smaller portions available for those who&#39;s eyes are bigger than their stomach (which is me). <br><br>I like to order a couple of things and the smaller portion menu is fantastic.  If you order anything that&#39;s not &#39;small&#39; be prepared to get oversize portions that is enough for two decent meals.<br><br>I really like their bread with a side of their chipotle dressing.  Such a delicious combo, but watch the calories.....<br><br>I also like their carside to-go. When the mall is swamped with cars and I&#39;m too lazy to keep looking for parking-- it&#39;s the way to go.

I&#39;m giving the manager and waitstaff of this Cheesecake Factory 4 stars.  Why, might you ask?  Well, it was a busy shopping Saturday during the post-Thanksgiving weekend.  We were in town and wanted to see all of our friends and celebrate my hubby&#39;s birthday.  I made a reservation for about 12 people for 1pm.  <br><br>Unfortunately, they screwed up my reservation, and we had to wait about a half an hour to get the tables set up for our large group of hungry adults and children.  Well, this was no biggie, since all of our friends love to make a (late) entrance.  Everyone was on-time, or early for this celebratory lunch.  <br><br>The manager was genuinely sorry and apologized profusely.  I was mildly annoyed, but oh well, it&#39;s only a reservation.  To make it up to us, she told us we could order 4 appetizers, on the house.  It was a good time...we got to see all our friends, celebrate a birthday and enjoy a ton of yummy, FREE food.

Not just cheese cake<br>Large menu they have everything from classic Chinese dishes to Mexican favorites and everything in between! Their cheese cake menu is a long list of mouth watering flavors, making it almost impossible to choose!

Good food, good service, great cheesecake. Perfect for everyone with a 20 plus page menu and everything you could possibly want. Had a nice atmosphere and our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Make sure you don&#39;t order anything too big as you have to leave room for cheesecake. I had the red velvet and it was amazing!

Well, the food was good but nothing extraordinary. Overall a pretty good meal but I have a few major gripes. <br>First off, the menu. How large does it need to be? And many different cuisines?  What type of restaurant is this?  Italian? Burger joint?  Chinese?  Seafood?  Pizzeria? Pick a specialty and go with it. I&#39;d can only imagine how they kitchen staff can prep for a service. With the menu so scattered, a feel like the quality goes down.<br>Second gripe: lighting. I feel like I had to strain to see the person in front of me.  It was also kind of jarring to transition between the mall lighting and the restaurant lighting. <br>Last gripe:  the wait. Nearly an hour. It seemed a little excessive since the service and food were quick (one of the big pluses): the wait was probably due to people having too many choices on the menu. <br>Overall, not bad if you have time to wait and like lots of choices as well as moderately good food.

I wouldn&#39;t say that I&#39;m anti-chain... but chain restaurants don&#39;t impress me very much, and though the Cheesecake Factory wasn&#39;t an exception to this, they&#39;re still &#34;A-OK.&#34;<br><br>I hate waiting, and I definitely hate having to wait in a confined area, so I usually go to the Cheesecake around 2 o&#39;clock to beat the lunch crowd.  I do notice, though, that once you&#39;re seated, whether during prime-time or down-time, you&#39;re attended to quickly and your order comes out at a reasonable time.<br><br>I&#39;ve come to realize, after trying their pizzas, pastas, salads and other entrees, that I&#39;m not a fan of the food here.  Not only are their portions larger than life, but the food itself isn&#39;t very inspiring.  I&#39;m looking for quality, not quantity!!!<br><br>Why 3 stars then, instead of 1 or 2?  Well, for one, as I&#39;ve mentioned, the service is quick once you&#39;re seated.  Two, I love love love their strawberry shortcake with its juicy, sweet strawberries and heaping scoop of ice cream.  &amp;&amp; three, I liked that their mojitos come with a ton of mint leaves!<br><br>Aside from these few perks, however, the Cheesecake Factory should not be a go-to restaurant for your foodings.

if ya wonder why i keep giving out 4stars and more, why?! simple, why would i eat anywhere that&#39;s not good and tasty, waste my hardearned $$$.  Don&#39;t be silly, never will there be a time 4such an activity.<br><br>First time in this area of Oregon, and boy did we have a superb time enjoying the fine weather, nice stay in nearby hotel, checked out Moto shops and yep found a few, 1 in particular of a fine ride that we wanna take back to Cali.  <br><br>What do say about Cheesecake Factory?  This as y&#39;ll know is a chain of fine eatery with their trademark/landmark of amazing variety of cheesecakes like you won&#39;t believe.  Such a huge menu and handsome servings... love to come back for more anytime :)

First of all, the Cheesecake Factory is considered to be the &#34;Worst Restaurant in America&#34; in terms of nutrition- <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Featthis.menshealth.com%2Frestaurants%2Fcheesecake-factory&amp;s=451e62fe5932419ac8ee01f0da627400829c9045d25a80f862f81d098c85536e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">eatthis.menshealth.com/r…</a>.  But don&#39;t let that stop you from indulging in this heavenly place.<br><br>The ambiance is nice, the service is nice, the seating options are nice (inside or outside- outside tables even have heaters!), and the wait is very moderate.  Only like 15 minutes and with the mall being right there, it was not a problem.<br><br>I&#39;ve had never really &#34;dined&#34; here in the sense that all I ever sat down and ate prior to Tuesday was the Cheesecake.  But on Tuesday, with Cheesecakes being half off and I having over $70 in gift cards, decided to sit down and experience the entire dinner.  And it was great.  The menu is huuuuge.  For the appetizer, I went with the fried avocado rolls, apparently one of their specialties, and it was awesome.  Very expensive, but truly something I&#39;d never eaten before.  Tasted like a Chinese spring roll biting in but then immediately changed flavor to a more American taste.  For dinner, they have so many options that it&#39;s hard to decide what to get.  I was going to order from the Skinnylicious menu before I realized it&#39;s really the exact same thing as the normal menu except served in smaller portions, and hence cheaper.  So I ordered the normal veggie burger from the &#34;unhealthy menu&#34;, probably having at least 800 calories, and it was delicious.  I also had some of the cheese pizza, which was excellent.  <br><br>The desserts...  Before I even came, I knew was going to go with the cheesecake, but couldn&#39;t decide which one.  They are all extremely unhealthy, with some cakes having up to 1300-1500 calories in just one slice.  I didn&#39;t let that bother me and ultimately, I ordered the Godiva Cheesecake and split it.  It was a good thing I split it, because that thing was huge!  No one should be able to eat the entire thing after dinner and I&#39;m not surprised it has that many calories.  For a four person family, you really only need two slices.  I also had some of the Tiramisu cheesecake, which was good, but nothing in comparison to the layered Godvida cake which was bursting with flavor.  I don&#39;t even remember what the layers were, but I remember it having a bottom brownie crust, a second layer consisting of cheesecake, actual Godiva chocolate in there somewhere, and topped with a bunch of whipped cream.  <br><br>So yeah, excellent place.  And bill only came out to be $44 with tip for four people.  Pretty cheap considering we had no coupons.  Oh yeah, checked my weight the next day- not a single pound gained (hehe).

We just moved into the area about 25 miles south of here. Due to us looking for housing we have been in a hotel of course eating out. This has been the BEST experience we have had since we&#39;ve been here in 2 months.<br><br>The waitress Angelita was fantastic!  We asked for the mgr &amp; let him know because it is so rare to have a waitress that is so pleasant. <br><br>We will be going back here &amp; asking for her. Hopefully she will be there!

Went here to meet a friend. Wait help was so surly I vow never to return. They were very busy, that&#39;s true. It is no excuse for not being pleasant to deal with.  They may never realize the effect of poor treatment of a customer. I have many choices of where to go to eat. This will not be one of them.

I was excited to dine there since they had outdoor seating and I had never eaten there before. We asked to sit outside since I have a small dog. They sat us and after 5 min they asked us to change our seats.  We did so, then a few min later they asked us to leave because I had my 3lb dog with me sitting outside!! We told them we are with a small dog before we ask to be seated! So unprofessional and rude. They didn&#39;t even ask if the dog is a service dog!

MENU SIZE! Do you think Cheesecake Factory corporate is compensating for something? Too many items? Probably,but most of the appetizers and drinks are really good. I&#39;ve been here many times and have not had a bad entree yet. I&#39;m a salmon lover and their salmon dishes are very good.  My youngest  daughter and I stopped in a couple of weeks ago. We had   pasta dishes we enjoyed. It wasn&#39;t Italy, what do you want from Tigard.  Service is as expected. Atmosphere, big and loud.

Normally I&#39;m a bit more forgiving, but this visit was a bit off.  We came in to treat ourselves for a very hard working week.  Came in early afternoon, and waited 15 minutes, not bad for CCF.  While our server was on top of things at first, what seemed to be a shift change caused some problems.  Not all our food came out on time or together for that matter.  The shift manager apologized, but that was about it.  Once finished, we sat, for a while, till we finally got our server again.  She was asked to cover a shift for someone else and was trying her best to close out her current tables and cover another area across the restaurant.  While not her fault, it was not the best experience especially for how much we paid.  We even got dessert to go.  While in enjoy most of the menu, the place is rarely worth the long waits in addition to the expense.  If there was another location in town it might help.

Even though there&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory where I live, I decided to eat here since it was late and just flew in to the area. I had a combination of Herb Filet of Salmon and Steak Diane with sautéed spinach. I asked for the steak to cook rare but it was overcooked and served at medium-well. The steak was tough and dry. Since it was late and the server wasn&#39;t around to check up on us, I just accepted it as it was. Fortunately, the Salmon was good but the lemon sauce was quite heavy and overly buttery.

Okay we waited for two hours they said max one. Now before you think who on earth waits 2 hours let alone one for a chain food it was my neices 16th bday and she likes the place. Well Todd one of the  manger is an ego mantic rude dbag. He treated my Dad so rudely that our party of 15 will never come again. Even my neice said the cheese cake lost it&#39;s flavor due to the managers crap attitude. Sad times, a fun birthday party turned into a stressful experience. : (

I have really enjoyed the service and food every time me and my wife have had lunch or dinner, but yesterday we were very disipointed with are food that was brought to are table because it was not hot only warm, are waiter was very pleasant and even told me to be careful because my plate has hot. Sorry I have to complain but we expected a better experance!
Don&#39;t come here if you starving since there is always a wait. Don&#39;t come here starving either since they serve dinosaur portions for everything. Great HH too.

Their lunch menu is less expensive than the dinner menu and is still a large amount of food. Sure, they are known for their cheesecake, but I like and recommend their huge hot fudge sundae.  Big enough for two people.

Place is a chain and is what you expect. Food is pretty good, a little over priced. Always busy, mostly because of location, the food is pretty standard chain Italian food, but decent. If you are in the mall, try it, if you are in search of good food, don&#39;t go to far out of your way!

My only experience with Cheese Cake Factory is that Penny works there from the Sitcom &#34;Big Bang Theory&#34;.  While in Tigard an opportunity came up to give it a try.  I was really impressed with the pasta dish I ordered.  I had the chicken chipotle penne pasta.  The dish was very creamy with a hint of spiciness.  I like my food VERY spicy, so I thought it could have been more so, but for the average &#34;Julie or Joe&#34; it was probably just right.  They had some excellent table bread that&#39;s served warm with butter on the side.  The service is top notch, and of-course the dessert was awesome too.  I had the coconut cream cheese cake.

The food is good but a bit generic.  They have a wide selection of items including sandwiches, pasta, steaks, pot pies, salads, etc.  This is a nice place to grab a bite while shopping in the mall.  Food portions are very large as well as drinks.  It&#39;s a very noisy place, but the food service is good and they are prompt in getting your orders.  Their fresh baked bread is good, but nothing special. They have a wide variety of cheesecakes to choose from many of which you can&#39;t go wrong and worth trying.

Food is wonderful, atmosphere is wonderful, customer service is great!  I was having dinner with a group of 6.  Everyone&#39;s dinner came and mine didn&#39;t come until 4-5 minutes later.  A manager brought my plate out, apologized, and insisted on giving me a free piece of cheesecake.  That is the way to keep customers happy!

This was our 2nd trip to this Cheesecake Factory location.  Our first time there was shortly after they had opened and it was a poor experience.  We attributed that to the fact they were still working out the kinks of a new place.  We finally came back to give it a 2nd chance after receiving a gift card.  It was on the 4th of July and it was surprisingly not busy.  There was no wait and since it was really nice outside we sat on the patio.  This location is nicely decorated and well kept.  The waitress who took our order was very nice and friendly.  She brought us our drinks and bread very fast.  We had a calamari appetizer and it was really great.  The dipping sauce was super.  My sons both ordered burgers.  My husband had the Factory Burrito Grande and I had the Hibachi Steak.  The burrito and the steak arrived promptly but the burgers did not.  We waited about 5 minutes for them to appear after the adults had already been served.  I absolutely hate when restaurants do that.  Bring everyone&#39;s main dish at the same time please, or at least say here&#39;s part of your table I&#39;m sorry the rest will be out real soon.  Don&#39;t just leave us hanging.  Anyhow the burrito was cold and so was my steak.  I&#39;m guessing they had already been sitting back there for awhile.  I cut into a piece of steak and it was completely raw I had ordered a medium rare.  I usually cook my steaks at home pretty rare but this was still ice cold in the center with just a sear on the outside.  Not good.  I hate sending things back but I just couldn&#39;t eat it raw.  The waiter who took over for our waitress was not too happy with me.  I guess he thought I was picky?  So after a few minutes it comes back and I swear they didn&#39;t do a darn thing to it.  I ended up just having it boxed up.  Never going back.  If we get a gift card again we&#39;ll be using it on cheesecake only.   By the way if you go in for a whole cheesecake they will say it&#39;s been deeply chilled and will be ready to eat in 2 hours, that really means completely frozen.  At least that was delicious.

I came in for lunch with my two children to the Beaverton location. Sarah B. was our server. From the start, she was not nice and had kind of &#34;attitude&#34; about her. Didn&#39;t say hi or introduce herself, just took our drink orders and left. Came back with our drink and took our order for lunch. I ordered a dish that is not cooked, my son order a hamburger and my daughter had fries only. She brought bread and then left again. After about 15 minutes I asked her where our food was. She said she would check. Never came back to say anything to me. Then 15 minutes later I started to get really mad. She would walk by us but never made eye contact with me. I finally caught her eye and then I think she knew at this point I was mad. Another girl brought out our food and I told her this is ridiculous waiting over 30 minutes for a burger and salad rolls. She said she didn&#39;t know anything about it and left. Then we ate and the manager came over and I told her what happened. The thing that got me mad is that Sarah B. never came over to ask us if everything was ok, nothing about why the food was so late, avoided me actually. My son ordered dessert but I told her I wasn&#39;t going to wait another 30 minutes. We paid and left. This whole thing ruined my day.

I had lunch today.  I got there a little after 11 and since I was alone I sat in the bar.  I ordered fish and chips, which I have had there before.  When the entree arrived it was warm and the fish was half cooked.  I took a bite and there was a weird filler in the fish and it was mushy.  Also, there were four pieces an two of them looked like little nuggets and not actual fish.   I sent it back.  The waitress didn&#39;t seem too concerned  I ended up leaving and was never approached by a manager.  I am working two jobs for the holidays and this was one of my few days off and I was served half cooked fish.  The fish was comparable to frozen fish sticks from the grocery store that have that weird filler.  I have had so many bad experiences in the past few years from being served a salad with wilted lettuce to burnt nachos.  I have had it with this restaurant. Every time I go there I have to add one more thing to the list that I will never order again.  Your restaurant needs to get it together.  I wrote a complaint online so hopefully I will hear back.  Just over it.

I give them 3 stars.  It&#39;s rather a mixed review.  I&#39;ve had overall decent service here, not too thrilled over the food, but o.k. once in a while.  However,  I recently went to pick up a late night craving for tiramisu cheesecake and the girl at the dessert counter was borderline rude.  It would be nice for management to teach their employees that the customers help pay their wages.  BTW, tiramisu cheesecake,  the BEST!!!!  Yummm, it gets the five *****.

I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in years, and the last time I was at one, the food was mediocre at best. Boy was I surprised when I went to the one at the mall the other day. The wait was a bit silly, almost an hour for a party of two. That aside, once we were seated the server was attentive and informative. Which we needed with the 24 page menu, was hard to make a choice. Ended up getting the Hibachi Steak and loving it, finishing the meal with strawberry cheesecake seemed a no brainer so we did. Very enjoyable if a bit over-priced.

Good restaurant. Specially If you planning on celebrating some event. Their dessert is amazing (obviously from its name). The only complain I have about this restaurant is the prices vs. food portions. Their food portions are really big. They can on the other hand decrease the price and the portion. Would be a good idea, i guess!

I&#39;m a fan of CF and this location is on par with the other restaurants in the chain. Re: seating, I recommend requesting a booth if you want even the slightest bit of privacy, as the center seats (long booths) leave about 12&#34; between you and the person sitting next to you. If their conversation happens to be annoying or their kids are screaming or any other variety of annoying dining behaviors, there will be no way to avoid it. Save yourself! Request a booth.
I love it!! Yes it&#39;s cheesy and a chain but it&#39;s good!!! Red velvet is great if u feel like cheesecake, and reeses is great if your in more of a rich chocolate dessert!!
Happy hour menu is one of the best I have ever seen and service is great

I liked this place a lot.  The Shepherd&#39;s pie was excellent and was very big.  I had enough to take home with me and I eat a lot.  Overkill on the onions though.   The chocolate cheesecake was also good but kinda expensive.

I normally avoid eateries with 20 page menu&#39;s and cameos in Kanye West songs, but I make an exception for Cheesecake factory. There are things about this place that I dislike, like the long wait times and the tragically dumpy white pants they make the wait staff wear (no matter how good looking you are, those outfits suck). Overall, I&#39;m not a big cheesecake fan either, which i realize is ironic. <br>The thing that keeps bringing me back here is the food. They make hands down the best lettuce wraps ever, and they have a never ending list of sauce options. I can also tell you with confidence that the tuna tartar and avocado rolls are winners.<br>For a chain, they do an excellent job of keeping a consistently good menu. I&#39;ve never had to send anything back or wished I had ordered something else. The prices are a bit high but you get about 3 meals worth of food on your plate. It&#39;s a great place for a date or a family gathering.

There&#39;s always an incredibly long wait at this place, but that&#39;s because it&#39;s always consistently good.  My guilty pleasure is the fried macaroni balls, I can&#39;t resist them when I come here.  I love the avocado eggrolls and miso salmon as well.  Yum!

found bug in my salad. quality check? showed it to Manager and his reaction was as if  he&#39;s seen this scenario a dozen times. while i love nature I don&#39;t want any crawling creatures in my food. GROSS and unsanitary.

sometimes I reflect fondly upon days (like, when i was in college) when I didn&#39;t know the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s Asian Chicken salad had approximately 1 million zillion calories and i could just enjoy that hellofa salad.<br>oh well.<br>maybe if i jog to tigard and home it&#39;ll be a wash.

OK, Ive been here a few times with my family (not my choice) overall the portions are huge and expensive and to say the food is forgettable means you got lucky. As for the namesake cheesecake the Trader Joe&#39;s New York style is way better and you get the whole cheesecake for the price of a slice here.
Wait is intolerable. Bar seating is sparse. Busy. Hurried. Stressful. Not a fan of the food, either.

Food is average and portions are HUGE-- if that is what you&#39;re looking for.  My meal could feed 3 people and I was so bored and tired of eating it that I didn&#39;t want to bring the left overs home.    Offer half portions, pay more attention to quality.
Rude service and bland oversized portions of food await! The Cheeseflake Factory is the epitome of why 1/2 of America is overweight, and the other 1/2 are just plain rude. Don&#39;t bother.

always good food and delicious cheesecake. cheesecake was divine. tried the 30th cheesecake and it was scrumptious! service was pretty good, except until the end when my waitress tried to get more money out of me (after i already gave her more than enough)!

Something on the menu for every last soul.  If you want to get fat on cheesecake and whipped cream with a half life of 20 years,  this is your place.  I like sitting at the bar and drinking some cocktails like a pomegranate mojito or a lemon drop.  I know, foo-foo all the way but something about this place just makes me swing that way.  It gets way dark in there at night...the lighting is way too low BUT... if you are there with a romantic interest..that can prove to your advantage.  I have any pretty much everything on their menu and never been disappointed.  The outside seating is pretty decent; could people watching spot!  Yes, I enjoy the occasional people judging at the mall while I eat my cheesecake sport. ;)
Stopped here to pick up desert and decided to get the red velvet cheesecake, and it was delightful!! A bit rich but sooooooo good. It was very busy but we only waited a few minutes ;0)

Last night we decided to take the trek to Washington Square to come here for dinner, our motivation was we had a giftcard.<br>The wait wasn&#39;t so bad, 30 minutes on a Sunday night. (I thought it was going to be worse). <br>We got seated and order drinks and appetizer&#39;s, the calamari was good and honestly the best cocktail sauce I have ever had, it was nice and horseradishy! When our food got there I couldn&#39;t believe the enormity of what was in front of me. I ordered Chicken Capoletta(?), there were 3 flattened chicken breasts on my plate with mashed potato&#39;s and asparagus. This meal could have fed a family of 3., seriously, and they would have brought home leftovers. <br>One thing that I did&#39;n&#39;t like is that they call themselves a &#34;Family&#34; restaurant but don&#39;t have a kids menu, we had to purchase an $8.95 appetizer for our 7 year old, again, it could have fed 3 if not 4 people. If you go here split the meal and you will be fine and as always....GET the cheesecake, it is finger lickin&#39; good!

I&#39;ve always had good dining experiences at Cheesecake Factories, even though I think cheesecake itself is disgusting.  It tastes sour and awful.  I&#39;ve heard a couple women remark that it reminds them of the taste of ........

We waited 40 minutes, which is to be expected during a Friday night. Since it was the end of the work week, I thought I would get something exotic at the bar. The Mai Tai was a delight. Fun to look at and tasty. By the time we were seated we were hungry. The service was efficient but rushed. I was still trying to figure out what I wanted to drink when the waiter came. He took the my husband and son&#39;s order and left while I was looking at the menu. When he came back with my husband and son&#39;s the drinks and we placed our order, he did try to bring my drink to me quickly but the place was slammed and he was hustling. When I got my order my first bite was disappointing. My habachi steak was cold as was my plate, meat and vegetables. I had the waiter bring me hot potatoes because I could manage to eat the other food cold, and I really didn&#39;t want to wait to have the whole meal recooked or have the medium rare steak come back well done. My husband enjoyed his steak and salmon. No complaints. My son&#39;s pasta dish was miniscule. My husband and I laughed when we saw it, although our son didn&#39;t find it funny. Poor guy wasn&#39;t even close to full after eating so of course, he had to order a dessert. The Cheesecake Factory does live up to its name. He enjoyed the cake. Still, considering the atmosphere, the price, the cold food/small portion and the fact that the Portland metro has so many really great places to eat, we won&#39;t be going back any time soon. But if we are in the neighborhood and have dinner elsewhere, we wouldn&#39;t hesitate to have our dessert at The Cheesecake Factory!

Ok, so the menu takes forever to go through. Maybe they just want to have everyone covered? Most of the food is pretty average, but oh. my. god. I love cheesecake, and I love tiramisu... so the tiramisu cheesecake is my dream come true (to be honest, I usually skip the meal and just get a drink and tiramisu cheesecake).

Sometimes you just feel like you want Cheesecake Factory. How can you go wrong with a menu that has as many pages as a telephone book?<br><br>This one is much like the others. Except for the fact that I was sat in a section where the floor had obviously been spilled on with some soda...sticky floor, yuck! They walked us right through the sticky part and the entire time we were there, nobody cleaned it. <br><br>Otherwise, my BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad was HUGE and tasty as always. Service was friendly, but I felt our server was a little TOO friendly and eager. But overall, still a decent dining experience.

I have to say as far as chains go this place is pretty consistent.  My main gripe with their dinner is portion size.  They WAAY overdo it.  I went today for lunch and was pleasantly surprised by the price and smaller portions.  I really wish they offered lunch portions all the time, then I would go more often.  Why pay 16 bucks for something when I&#39;m only really eating half?  I&#39;d much rather pay 10 bucks and eat almost all of it!  Their food is pretty good, but their cheesecakes are the star of the show.  Next time were shopping in Washington square I will be back, but I probably won&#39;t ever make a trip out of the way for this place.
Went again.  Key lime cheesecake was perfect again.  Service was great.  Chipotle chicken pasta was awesome.

I don&#39;t write novels like the other people, so this will be short and sweet! I have eaten here a few times, and there always seems to be something that is just &#39;off&#39;... The food is usually pretty decent, but they usually get at least one component wrong. The waitstaff seems to need more training on what comes on each menu item, I think then there wouldn&#39;t be so many mistakes. If we return, it will only be for the cheesecake.

Having been to two Cheescake Factory locations in the S.F. Bay Area, I entered this one with low expectations and a high degree of certainty that I would be in for a long wait for a table, mediocre service, average food and great desserts.  That way, I knew I would not be disappointed.<br><br>While the wait WAS long (over an hour when we were told 30 minutes) we were a large party to accommodate and I was anticipating the wait.  But, the rest of my somewhat low and negative expectations were turned upside-down.<br><br>Food was very good to excellent for all diners.  We had one entree that experienced a kitchen delay.  But the server quickly explained what the problem was along with a very sincere apology.  Because the portions are so large, two in our party eventually wound up sharing a VERY large entree and the &#34;problem entree&#34; was then canceled.  Absolutely no problem.  Even the manager came over to inquire, ensure everything was satisfactory and apologize for the kitchen&#39;s error, made sure we understood what had caused the problem and sincerely apologized AGAIN.  In our collective minds the problem was very minor but the wait-staff&#39;s treatment of it and of us was golden.<br><br>The service:  absolutely excellent all around.  Water glasses constantly filled.  Ice tea refilled.  Bread refilled.  Very quick acknowledgement, a smile and an &#34;absolutely no problem&#34; attitude throughout the meal.  Personal, yet appropriate, conversation with the server.  This location could and should give customer service lessons and training to the S.F. Bay Area locations.  The tip was 35% and the server was highly praised directly to the manager on duty.

I love this place! well, i love the food....not so much the parking, or the wait for a table, or even sometimes the wait for your waiter to return...but the food is worth it. i am a creature of habit &amp; so i only have ordered one item (&amp; it&#39;s only been messed up one time - undercooked noodles) - a cajun kinda pasta w/ bowtie noodles &amp; breaded chicken. i don&#39;t like bowtie, so i put it on penne &amp; i don&#39;t do breaded so i do grilled &amp; let me tell you it&#39;s yummy! but what i love best is the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake! talk about mouth watering!! the menu is entirely too large though, chef ramsey would have a hay day with that...
The menu is overwhelming but portions are huge. Find a way to save room for any of their cheesecakes. They are delicious!

I&#39;ve heard a great deal about the cheesecake warehouse, how awesome the food is and whatnot. Well after waiting for a table(which isn&#39;t a problem) the table was still dirty and then our hostess disappeared and the guy sent to clean the table was snotty about telling us we had to be seated by the front desk. After we explained to him we were, he was even snottier. So that&#39;s the end of the bad stuff. As soon as our actual waitress started helping us, our experience was amazing. The avocado egg rolls were so flavorful and delicious. My wife had the veggie burger and I had the California avocado salad. Both were very well prepared and extremely flavorful. Now to the finisher. What we came for. What the Cheesecake Factory hangs it hat on, the cheesecake. I had the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut cheesecake, and my wife had some kind of chocolate chocolate super chocolate cheesecake.  We decided it was so good that the next time we eat here we will order to go and recommend it to everyone who asks.

This was not a good experience.  My cheesecake was frozen solid.  I had to take it to go while others ate there.  There was no compensation provided.  It&#39;s also way too dark to the point where you can&#39;t even read the menu at night. On the positive side, for once we had no wait at quarter to five on a Saturday!

Very reliable for a chain. Also, they actually cook here. The portions are huge and so is the wait because they&#39;re not smart enough to have more than one in the area.   I recommend the Chinese chicken salad and the charbroiled chicken ranch salad. Very tasty but watch out for duck fans as they are everywhere until their stupid team loses.

What do you expect for a chain. I have only been to a few chain restaurants that i would give 4 stars to. This place is OK, they have a big menu with something for even the most picky person. The food is fine, not great but good enough. The waitstaff is pretty good. Every once in a while you get somebody that you will annoy the hell out of you. The cheesecake is about the best thing going here.... hence the name cheesecake factory.

My husband and I decided, on a whim, to go there last night (a Wednesday around 7:00 p.m.) for dinner. We have been meaning to go for a couple years, and decided to finally try it. <br><br>We were seated VERY quickly. As in, we checked in and less than 5 minutes later were being taken to our table. Our waiter (named Donovan) asked us how we were, to which we replied good and that we had never been there before. His first warning: the menu is very big. As in, 20 pages and then a couple for the cheesecakes and drinks. They also had a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu, which were all under 590 calories and smaller portions.<br><br>He recommended a few things, let us know about their loaded baked potato soup, and then excused himself to get us some water. After bringing the waters and taking down our orders for strawberry lemonade (which was the best we had ever had), we looked over the menu. As our server passed by with cheesecakes, he would stop and briefly show them to use, tell us which one it is, and explain what was in it.<br><br>We finally decided on the chicken madeira and the soup for me, and my husband had the spicy cashew chicken. The soup was great, and although I ordered the cup, it was the size of a bowl. Definitely glad I didn&#39;t get the bowl. They might have brought me a trough!<br><br>When he brought us our entrees, I was shocked at the size of the plate. Two pieces of chicken the size of my head, and a hefty serving of mashed potatoes. I wasn&#39;t wild over the sauce, but it was still very good. It also came with steamed asparagus, which was done perfectly. The mashed potatoes (made with red potatoes) were well seasoned. I barely made a dent in my food. My husbands chicken was spicy, but not overly so. He asked for the brown rice, which complimented the chicken wonderfully. He actually ate half of his plate.<br><br>Thanks to the cheesecakes our server had shown us, it wasn&#39;t hard to decide which ones to get. My husband got Adam&#39;s peanut butter cup cheesecake, and I ordered the Banana cream. We very light and creamy, and a fairly large slice topped with whip cream (mine also had freshly sliced bananas on it).<br><br>I was shocked at our bill as I wasn&#39;t paying too close to the price (about $63), but very satisfied with the quality of food and service we got. We will definitely be going back, but maybe more on a special occasion or just to grab a slice of cheesecake.

My boyfriend and I went to this Cheesecake factory (it was his first time to one) and we both loved it! The menu is huge, you really can&#39;t go wrong and the cheesecakes are to die for! We had the fried macaroni which was great and the crab dip, yummy as well.  He ordered a burger and I had the fettuccine with sun dried tomatoes.  For dessert we had the red velvet cheese cake which was SO GOOD, he looked at me and was like &#34;we have to have this for our wedding cake!!!&#34;.  We also tried Linda&#39;s chocolate cake, and the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake they were both very tasty but rich.  The service was wonderful, we couldn&#39;t stop raving about how nice our waiter was, he always made sure we had refills and was checking in on us he was EXCELLENT! We loved the Cheesecake factory and can&#39;t wait to go back on our next Portland visit.
Lots of vegetarian options.  Beautiful decoration.  Dining here is a real treat, great for celebrating special occasions.
good place to eat. if you guys were closer that would be great. but the drive is worth it!!!

This place always seems to be busy, and for a good reason! The service is always outstanding, and the food is excellent. I especially love their new &#34;special menu&#34; which has the same size portions, the same quality of food, but lower prices. So spend $12 and get enough food for two meals, doesn&#39;t get better than that.

For a mall restaurant, the atmosphere is really nice.  The tall ceilings with a nice tone provides a nice dining environment.  The service is excellent and polite.  The food portions are huge and the price is actually not too bad.  The quality of the food isn&#39;t as good as some of the other Cheesecake Factories that I&#39;ve been to, but it&#39;s still really good.  I would recommend it over the food court, if you&#39;re willing to shell about $5 more per person.

We have been here a few times.  There is always a wait to get a table.  I am not too fond of their food here and it is very pricey  I do however love their cheesecake.  The Red velvet Cheese Cake is my fave!
Don&#39;t listen to these reviews it pulls of the complex menu quite well and has great food but I must say their cheesecake is not that great
Service is top notch!  Food quality is excellent!  I ordered the fresh fish tacos with Mahi and they were delicious!  Topped it off with the Godiva chocolate cheesecake.

I keep coming back again and again to this restaurant. Their menu is outrageous. So, many choices to choose from. Plus you can&#39;t leave without ordering dessert. My all time favorite is the White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Cheesecake. Mouthwatering delicious. For drinks I recently tried the Tropical Martini very yummy, but pricey $10 for a glass. Pasta dish I recommend the Louisiana Chicken Pasta you&#39;ll love it I gaurantee. Appetizers the Thai Lettuce Wraps is messy to eat but a lot of fun and so good. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and it&#39;s always busy all the time. That&#39;s when you know the food is good. The longest I ever waited for a table was 30 min which wasn&#39;t bad. They have an area where you can sit and wait or the mall is right there so you can shop while waiting.

Where to start.. My food had to be remade twice and it still was not correct there after but I just settled eventually. By the time my food had arrived my husband had cleared his plate. It was not the nice dinner we had hoped for. One of the most horrific parts of the dinner was our waitress Courtney H. She complained to us the whole time about how she didn&#39;t want to be at work and how she was in a bad mood. To top it off she was cursing as well. It was the most unprofessional experience from a waitress we have ever endured. She should be fired! I wish I would have made the time to call in and speak to a manager but while we were there and they messed up on my food the manager never came over to apologize or offer anything so I don&#39;t think anything would have even been done had I called in. This all happened on 04/10/12 if anyone is curious. Never going back to the cheesecake factory!

1st thing is 1st, I love Cheesecake Factory. I have eaten at them in several locations but the one at Washington Square in metro Portland Oregon is by far the smallest and also the best.  It is better than its sister Factory in Seattle.  This place has a massive menu with enough unique flavors to satisfy any pallet both gross and subtle.  If you have a group of picky eaters I strongly recommend this restaurant because there is almost certainly something for everyone in your group at this restaurant. Also as a side note, their avocado egg rolls are insanely addictive!

I absolutely love the Cheesecake Factory! It is my all-time favorite restaurant! Since it is such a popular restaurant, we expect a wait, which is fine-that&#39;s when you get a little shopping done! <br>My favorite meal there is the Chicken Madiera Combo with Steak or Salmon -yummmm. Also their Avacado Eggrolls are to die for! Very Yummy. <br>This place is filled with awesome food, you won&#39;t regret going :)

My family and i went to the cheesecake factory today for dinner and indulged ourselves quite a bit. but fist, let me go over the service. We where seated quickly (but it was an odd hous 4:30ish), our waitress was amazing, she went over what the specials/soups of the day where before we had to ask and wasn&#39;t fake at all and was extremely plesant. As for the food, we where brought bread to munch on, a small white french loaf and a small brown bread loaf with oats on the top, and they also brought butter pats.The menu was huge and they have a vey nice bar with plenty to choose from, they also have a new skinylicious menu for the ones watching their weight. We ordered the fried macaroni and cheese (extremely fatty and caloric i know but as i said, we indulged ourselves tonight), and it was amazing. The noodles where well cooked and not soggy or dry from being fried, the sauce was very flavorfull, and the breading kept everything together well. They put a cream marinara on the bottom of the plate for dipping and my family and i agreed that it was perfect with the macaroni balls, (did i say they where formed in four golf ball-sized portions on the plate? no? well now i did.) My dad ordered the fetutini alfredo with a side of sauteed spinach and the spinach was cooked only with a little butter, salt, and pepper in a cast iron pan. my dad said the pasta was well cooked in the alfredo, the sauce wasn&#39;t too thick or to runny and he said it stuck well to the pasta. I had a chipotle crispy chicken sandwich on a kaiser roll. the only thing chipotle about it was a mayo sauce.I agreed with my mom&#39;s following notes on the fies but i liked them that way. Mom had a wild mushroom burger, she said it was tender she asked for rare and got blood rare &#34;the way she likes it&#34;. she didn&#39;t like her french fries, had potential with seasoning, but where twice cooked which made them rubbery. After dinner my family and i decided to have desert which i extremely recommend, dad had the red velvet cheesecake, he says it was very good. (not very talkative tonight) Lol. Mom had the Raspberry Lemon Cheesecake she said the sauce topping was way too tart so she pushed it off to the side, commented that the whipped cream on the side was nice and tasty, also said the amount was just right. Both my parents had coffee&#39;s which had been freshly brewed, mom said it was above average coffee, i observed that it was quite hot, needed 3 sugars and plenty of cream, depending on who was drinking it. I had a cappucino which was, fair warning- huge, alot larger than your average cap. So i had the adams penut butter fudge ripple cheesecake, which was, O.M.G.
